jobs.description: Lifecycle Marketing Manager:We are a luxury home and carpet store seeking an experienced Lifecycle Marketing Manager to join our team.  This person will be responsible for developingand optimizing multi-channel customer journeys to drive engagement, retention, and revenue throughout the customer lifecycle. This role will own the strategy and execution of programs across email, SMS, direct mail, and other channels, using data-driven insights to deliver personalized experiences at scale.They should be comfortable implementing brand strategies, marketing plans, and project management for all marketing initiatives, and working cross-functionally to execute these strategies. This is a full-time position in office.Responsibilities:-Drive strong email and SMS campaigns to acquire and retain customers across our product portfolio-Spearhead all new marketing product launches to drive repeat and new revenue-Coordinate cross-functionally to ensure consistency in brand-related decisions-Analyze and report on brand performance across channels, including but not limited to: direct mail, email, SMS-Monitor market and consumer trends within the interior design and home space-Project management for all marketing projects, serving as the glue between dev, merchandising, and ecomm teams.Qualifications:-Bachelor's degree-3-6+ years of experience in lifecycle, retention, or CRM marketing, preferably in a direct-to-consumer or ecommerce environment.-Proven success managing customer journeys and automated campaigns across digital channels.-Strong analytical mindset; comfortable working with large datasets and drawing actionable insights.-Hands-on experience with marketing automation platforms and CRM tools.-Excellent project management skills with the ability to lead cross-functional initiatives.-Strong copywriting skills and a keen eye for creative and brand voice.-Passionate about customer experience, personalization, and performance marketing.-Experience in home furnishings or interior design is preferred but not required-Experience working in: Klaviyo, Attentive, Google Analytics, Shopify, Asana a plus.We are an equal opportunity employer and welcome applicants from all backgrounds.

jobs.description: about usabc carpet & home is the most iconic luxury home design destination in New York City, enchanting shoppers with its unique, unrivaled high-end rug offering, paired with its expertly curated selection of artisan decor and furniture pieces  sourced across the globe. abc is not only the place where home decor enthusiasts come to discover one-of-a-kind finds, but more so an otherworldly space igniting the customer’s inspiration to bring magic home.What started in the late nineteenth century as a pushcart business selling carpets has become one of the largest and most diverse rug and home collections in the world.  We look to nature and the world to create a meaningful curation that focuses on quality, craftsmanship, and uniqueness to tell a handmade story. Our actions are always in the pursuit of magic.job descriptionWe are looking for a creative and analytical Marketing Associate to join our team. You will be responsible for helping own both paid and organic channels including social/search, influencer/affiliate, lifecycle (email + sms), organic social (Pinterest, Instagram, TikTok) and events + brand partnerships. To understand channel performance you will work closely with the Senior Marketing Manager and Senior Director of Growth for weekly, monthly, and yearly reporting. You should feel comfortable working cross-functionally to execute these strategies and ensure brand consistency. This role will be joining a passionate team of four: VP of Marketing, Senior Director of Growth, Senior Marketing Manager and a graphic designer. This is a full-time position in our office in NYC. This role will report directly to the Senior Marketing Manager.responsibilities:Manage organic social channels including Instagram, Facebook, Pinterest, and LinkedIn, and spearheading the launch of net-new channels like TikTok and YouTubeDevelop channel specific strategies, monitor ongoing performance, and translate anecdotal, qualitative, and quantitative findings to inform future efforts. jobs.description:
Alfred Williams & Company is seeking an **Account Manager** focused on Business Development to drive growth through proactive outreach, relationship building and exceptional client service. You’ll develop new opportunities, expand existing accounts and partner closely with design, project management and customer administration to deliver outstanding workplace solutions.

**Responsibilities**

* Identify, qualify and close new business opportunities.
* Understand client goals and align solutions to business objectives.
* Proactively build and maintain a strong network (A+D firms, commercial real estate, brokers, end users, etc.).
* Own relationships with clients while serving as the primary point of contact.
* Manage day-to-day account needs and advocate for the customer throughout the project lifecycle.
* Lead internal and external meetings, clearly articulate scope, priorities and next steps.
* Coordinate with internal partners (Designer, Project Manager, Project Coordinator) to ensure quality delivery.
* Oversee project timelines, budgets, and change management; escalate risks early.
* Consistently exceed client expectations and add value to strategic and creative conversations.
* Track pipeline activity, forecasts, and progress toward goals.

**Qualifications**

* **2+ years** of relevant experience in commercial furniture, Design, real estate or construction industries.
* Strong written and verbal communication skills; confident presenter and facilitator.
* Self-starter who is proactive, flexible, and comfortable managing multiple projects and deadlines.
* Excellent prioritization, organization, and follow-through.
* Familiarity with proposals, budgeting and basic contract terms.
* Capable of reading and understanding floorplans, AutoCAD, etc.
* Knowledge of the A+D community, commercial real estate ecosystem and project delivery process.

jobs.description: Join Our Team as Director of Sales!Are you ready to make a lasting impact in the workspace solutions industry? Alfred Williams & Company is seeking a dynamic and strategic Director of Sales to lead our San Antonio market. As a member of MillerKnoll’s Certified Dealer Network, we are dedicated to delivering exceptional service across North America, with nearly 50 dealer partners operating in over 240 locations. By joining our team, you’ll play a pivotal role in creating inspiring spaces that drive success for our clients, offering them a seamless experience from project start to finish. If you’re passionate about client relationships, strategic growth and fostering innovation in workspace solutions, we’d love to connect with you.Position OverviewThe Director of Sales for the San Antonio, TX market will lead the development and execution of strategic sales initiatives to drive revenue growth and strengthen Alfred Williams & Company’s presence in the region. This role is responsible for building relationships with clients, identifying market opportunities, and aligning our services with customer needs. The Director of Sales will work closely with the Regional President to shape and implement market-specific sales strategies, ensuring alignment with Alfred Williams & Company’s mission, values, and commitment to exceptional service.Key ResponsibilitiesSales Strategy & Execution: Develop and implement a comprehensive sales strategy for the San Antonio market, aligned with company objectives and growth targets.Client Relationship Management: Establish and maintain strong, long-term relationships with key clients to support their design, workspace, and sustainability goals.Market Development: Identify and pursue new business opportunities, positioning Alfred Williams & Company as the preferred partner for workspace solutions.Performance Tracking: Utilize metrics and client feedback to continuously improve service quality and exceed client expectations.Community Engagement: Represent Alfred Williams & Company within the local community, supporting our values and commitment to sustainability and social responsibility.Sales Team Development: Training, goal setting, performance management, recruitment, motivation, and strategy execution to drive team success.Proven experience in sales leadership within the furniture, design, or similar industries, with a track record of driving growth.Strong relationship-building skills and a customer-centric approach.Strategic mindset with the ability to execute against both short-term goals and long-term objectives.Excellent communication, negotiation, and presentation skills.

jobs.job_title: Anthropologie - Digital Merchandising & Production Manager, 12 month FTC
jobs.description:
About Us:

Founded in 1992, Pennsylvania, USA, by current URBN chairman and president Dick Hayne, Anthropologie was named after his college major (with a decidedly French twist) Anthropologie, which now operates over 200 stores worldwide, has evolved into a leading one-of-a-kind destination for those seeking a curated mix of clothing, accessories, gifts and home décor to reflect their personal style. In 2009 the brand launched its first store in London and now has over 18 stores in the UK and Europe.

Role Summary:

**This is a 12 month FTC and we are looking for a start date of March/beginning of April**

As Digital Merchandising & Production Manager, you’ll lead the visual merchandising and digital content strategy across our e-commerce platform. Acting as the bridge between trading, buying, marketing, and tech teams, you’ll oversee the execution of homepage, category, and product pages to reflect commercial priorities and brand goals. You’ll also drive product activation, manage the digital product pipeline, and champion SEO and content enhancements to elevate the customer journey. With a strong grasp of systems and a proactive approach to system optimisations, you’ll play a key role in shaping the future of our digital experience. You will be managing and supporting a team.

What You'll Be Doing:

Merchandising & Site Content

* Own & deliver on visual site merchandising strategy
* Owns all content on site, ensuring engaging and inspiring to support customer discoverability
* Works closely with Trade on successful execution of site strategy across page optimisations, content callouts, filters, category structure, page merchandising and other site changes to support product discoverability & CVR.
* Oversees execution of homepage & other content pages and ensure they reflect trading priorities and CVR optimisations alongside brand goals
* Liaison between buying, marketing to ensure campaign launch ready (site, product, links..)

Tech & System Optimisations

* Champion tech roadmap optimisations & a go between tech and the business
* Reports tech issues & liaises with tech on issues & opportunities
* Systems expert & seeks opportunities to improve processes

Product Activation

* Plan & oversee product launches across the website
* Manages the digital product pipeline and ensures accurate, timely product uploads in coordination with Buying and Planning.
* Owns product attribution, SEO tagging, and content optimization (e.g., product descriptions, imagery, styling).
* Identifies and resolves product & content gaps to support conversion and improve the customer journey

What You'll Need:

* A proactive, positive and energetic attitude, you’re someone who gets stuck in, solves problems quickly, and brings ideas to the table with enthusiasm
* Excellent written and verbal communication skills, with a sharp eye for emerging talent and unique opportunities
* Management experience
* Strong experience tracking, analysing and reporting on both digital and physical activations
* A people-first attitude and the ability to build rapport quickly both internally and externally
* Super-organised whilst still being flexible, with the ability to juggle multiple projects, meet deadlines and stay calm under pressure
* Digitally confident, with strong working knowledge of Microsoft Office Suite
* Familiarity with performance-tracking tools essential, both native metrics and 3rd-party platforms (i.e. Dash Social, GRIN, Plot)
* Creative and commercially aware, always thinking about how to drive awareness and impact for the brand

The Perks:

* Work-life balance:

* Flexible start and finish times
* Bring your dog to work
* Wellbeing:

* Employees Assistance program to support with mental, physical and financial health
* Fully equipped free gym and on-site wellness room in Brick Lane and 50% discount of external gym memberships
* Private Medical Insurance
* Employee Discount:
* Up to 40% off at all URBN Brands
* Community:
* One paid day to either volunteer or fundraise for a charity of your choice
* Travel:
* Cycle to work scheme, season ticket loan
* Continued Development:
* We offer structured support within the business alongside continued learning and development

#AnthroEU

Equal Opportunity Statement:

URBN is an Equal Opportunities Employer committed to diversity and inclusion. We provide equal employment opportunities regardless of age, sexual orientation, sex, gender reassignment, pregnancy, marital status, religion, race, or disability. We base all our employment decisions on merit, job requirements and business needs.

jobs.description:
Anthropologie is looking for an Influencer Marketing Coordinator. The Influencer Marketing Coordinator will support the day-to-day of the Anthropologie influencer marketing team. This person will report to the Influencer Marketing Associate and partner with Anthropologie’s crossfunctional teams to support the execution of the Anthropologie, AnthroLiving and BHLDN influencer campaigns and giftings.  
  
**Role Responsibilities**

* Assist in management of Influencer campaigns for Anthropologie , AnthroLiving and AnthroWeddings. Including but not limited to:

+ Expand Anthropologie brand awareness by staying up-to-date on up-and-coming influencers excelling in reach and engagement KPIs as well as brand relevant content to test within Anthropologie campaigns
+ Assist in the curation of face sheets, cast scouting for campaigns and contracts
+ Manage campaign timelines and coordination of campaign launch from following up of content concepts, placing product orders, managing content deadlines, initial content approvals, tracking live content and reporting
+ Ensure that product selections adhere to campaign concept and brief parameters prior to placing orders as well as site availability. When orders are placed, manage all steps inclusive of order tracking & resolving order issues
+ Curate product SKU lists to pass off to web dev. team for anthropologie.com linking purposes and create UTMs to provide Influencers for content
+ Capture live content inclusive of IG Stories and ensuring all deliverable obligations are met and track all content on monday.com
+ Ensure social teams are supporting live influencer content via community management
+ Coordinate with digital team on content available for paid social needs and assist in whitelisting strategy by ensuring branded content tool is utilized
+ Assist in ambassador initiatives including but not limited to: campaign launch process, bonus campaigns, collecting reviews, outfitting program coordination, co-op campaigns

* Manage regular pulse of influencer giftings process including but not limited to:

+ Recommending key product gifting opportunities during key calendar moments
+ Coordinate with art team on asset needs: packaging, card inserts, handwritten notes
+ Coordinate with digital teams on landing page experiences, UTMs, QR codes, etc.
+ Coordinate with product teams to curate a personalized gifting product selection that relates to story/brand message being told via gifting
+ Place gifting product orders and manage gifting package process inclusive of sending gifts and coordinate tracking
+ Coordinate entire process of opportunistic influencer giftings
+ Assist in execution of the celebrity home giftings program including but not limited to order placements, inventory checking, landing page coordination, recapping

* Experiences and Events:

+ Assist in casting for Anthropologie brand events and experiences
+ Partner with cross functional teams on invitation assets, casting expectations, casting approvals and product orders
+ Manage outfitting process for influencer attendees

* Budget:

+ Assist in Influencer budget coordination in a timely manner including:
+ Invoice submission assistance
+ Monthly finance tracker and trial balance completion

* Recapping:

+ Ensure all influencer partners are verified on Creator IQ to accurately pull performance
+ Partner with Influencer Associate on pulling together performance metrics to create actionable takeaways and recapping for campaigns
+ Outreach to gifting recipients or event attendees for their account reporting if deliverables aren’t required
+ Responsible for recapping and reporting on content for all giftings and events

**Role Qualifications**

* 1+ years influencer management and/or social media experience desired
* A charismatic and proactive style of communication desired for external communication
* Strong organization skills inclusive of building timelines and tracking weekly and daily product orders and able to work on a variety of projects at one time in a fast-paced environment
* Strong writing and communication skills

#Anthropologie  
  
 **The Perks**URBN offers comprehensive Perks & Benefits to employees. Availability and eligibility to specific benefits may be subject to your location and employment status. Benefits include medical, dental, vision, PTO, generous employee discounts, retirement savings and much more! For additional information visit www.urbn.com/work-with-us/benefits

We believe strongly in fostering a safe, fair and respectful work environment. jobs.job_title: Anthropologie Senior Graphic Designer, Art Department
jobs.description:
Anthropologie is looking for a Senior Graphic Designer for the Art Department. The main objective of the senior designer’s role is to assist and lead on concept, design, implementation of our exclusive own brands—Brand identity management and standards, label and product packaging for apparel, accessories and home products, GWPs, store signage and event/influencer collateral.  
  
**Role Responsibilities**Responsibilities include assisting in the creative, production & management of:

* Seasonal retail & direct packaging
* Printed brand collateral & digital assets
* Product Packaging: Own brand packaging of wide-range of products — home, textile, beauty, gift
* Brand programs — branding and collateral
* Campaign & seasonal assets
* Communication: home office, store, direct
* SubBrands — creative & management of labels, hangtags, messaging & packaging of both apparel and home products

**Role Qualifications**

* Bachelor degree in discipline related to functional work or role with 6+ years of relevant work experience OR demonstrated ability to meet the job requirements through a comparable number of years of applicable work experience.
* Packaging and branding experience highly preferred.
* Experience with Adobe Suite, Basecamp, Monday as well as Microsoft Office
* Knowledge of traditional and digital printing processes, color separations and vendor ready art and die-line files.
* Exceptional written and verbal communication skills: Must be able to communicate the business needs and objectives effectively via email and in meetings.

jobs.description:
About Us:

Founded in 1992, Pennsylvania, USA, by current URBN chairman and president Dick Hayne, Anthropologie was named after his college major (with a decidedly French twist) Anthropologie, which now operates over 200 stores worldwide, has evolved into a leading one-of-a-kind destination for those seeking a curated mix of clothing, accessories, gifts and home décor to reflect their personal style. In 2009 the brand launched its first store in London and now has over 18 stores in the UK and Europe.

Role Summary:

We are looking for a highly skilled Digital Marketing Manager with a proven track record of driving growth across Paid Search, Paid Social, Display, Affiliates and SEO in the UK and wider European markets. This is a pivotal role within the business for improving ROAS and growing all digital marketing channels in line with business goals.

What You'll Be Doing:

* Supporting the Head of Digital Marketing in the development, management and execution of the Anthropologie EU digital marketing strategy
* Management of external digital marketing agencies, ensuring delivery of channel strategy and performance through challenging partners on performance & areas for opportunities
* Support the Head of Digital Marketing with forecasting channel traffic, demand, spend and efficiency
* Manage daily, weekly, monthly, and ad hoc reporting to deliver growth across marketing channels and strategic priorities
* Deliver on clear investment targets across paid channels, ensuring spend & efficiency is aligned to forecasts
* Through analysis, seek opportunities to drive growth & optimise performance across marketing channels
* Manage in-house paid social marketing, through ad planning, optimised investment and review of ad performance.
* Partner with the organic social team on the paid social strategy and cross-funnel budget
* Manage the marketing feeds and work with agency on optimisations
* Manage Affiliate tenancy and commission opportunities, in line with our marketing calendar
* Work closely with the online trading, brand marketing and buying teams to ensure ads and product focuses are aligned with business priorities and trends
* Partner with the ecommerce trading and web production team on SEO recommendations and optimisations
* Management of the Digital Marketing Assistant
* Identify and driver opportunities to grow Digital Marketing channels through new vendors and projects
* Attend weekly, monthly and ad hoc trade meetings, presenting trade and highlighting opportunities to further grow the business

What You'll Need:

* Project management experience
* Confident in all areas of online marketing, with experience in managing multiple activities.
* A confident communicator and willing to influencer through best practice and ROAS

* Ability to analyse marketing campaigns and present strategies based on results
* Strong leadership skills and experience with managing a team
* Ability to multi-task and delegate
* Build strong relationships with internal and external stakeholders

The Perks:  

* Work-life balance:
* Flexible start and finish times
* Bring your dog to work
* Wellbeing:
* Employees Assistance program to support with mental, physical and financial health
* Fully equipped free gym and on-site wellness room in Brick Lane and 50% discount off external gym memberships
* Private Medical Insurance
* Employee Discount:
* Up to 40% off at all URBN Brands
* Community:
* One paid day to either volunteer or fundraise for a charity of your choice
* Travel:
* Cycle to work scheme, season ticket loan
* Continued Development:
* We offer structured support within the business alongside continued learning and development

#AnthroEU

Equal Opportunity Statement:

URBN is an Equal Opportunities Employer committed to diversity and inclusion. We provide equal employment opportunities regardless of age, sexual orientation, sex, gender reassignment, pregnancy, marital status, religion, race, or disability. We base all our employment decisions on merit, job requirements and business needs.

jobs.job_title: Anthropologie - Marketing Planning Manager (12 Month FTC)
jobs.description:
About Us:

Founded in 1992, Pennsylvania, USA, by current URBN chairman and president Dick Hayne, Anthropologie was named after his college major (with a decidedly French twist) Anthropologie, which now operates over 200 stores worldwide, has evolved into a leading one-of-a-kind destination for those seeking a curated mix of clothing, accessories, gifts and home décor to reflect their personal style. In 2009 the brand launched its first store in London and now has over 18 stores in the UK and Europe.

Role Summary:

As Marketing Planning Manager, you’ll play a key role in leading Anthropologie’s brand campaign planning across Europe, with a particular focus on 360 marketing campaigns, retail and trade marketing and project management. Supporting teams across Brand Marketing, Creative, Digital Marketing and Retail, you will lead the planning and delivery of standout omni-channel campaigns activated across in-store, owned, earned and paid channels. You’ll also set-up efficient ways of working and communicating across department and be a key marketing contact across the business.

What You'll Be Doing:

*Campaign Project Management:*

* Take the lead on marketing campaigns and activations, project managing from concept to delivery, working with Brand & Creative, Digital, Product and Retail teams to scope requirements, plan deliverables, manage budgets and deliver campaigns on time
* Own the brand marketing calendar, working closely with US & EU colleagues to align global campaign messaging amplification, and identify and communicate EU-only messages
* Support the Brand Executive on campaign briefing, ensuring cross-departmental briefs are clear and completed by all departments
* Track creative and channel deliverables using project management tools, keeping stakeholders updated on key milestones and actions
* Lead post-campaign reporting and analysis, creating weekly, monthly and quarterly tracking against key metrics, working across teams to collate and present results and learnings to wider teams

*Retail & Trade Marketing:*

* Assist the Senior Brand Marketing Manager to brief and deliver all in-store POS
* Contribute to the successful launch and ongoing marketing of new Anthropologie stores, helping to develop opening plans and overseeing execution of planned activity
* Work with Retail and Digital teams to plan promotional messaging into the marketing calendar, capture Creative requirements and brief Creative teams

*Planning Processes:*

* Create ongoing efficiencies and review ways of working across teams to more effectively plan and manage marketing processes and communication
* Input into monthly and campaign Budget planning and tracking alongside Brand, Influencer, Social, and PR teams, reviewing regularly with the Marketing Director and Finance team
* Own regular planning meetings, campaign kick-offs & channel alignments, and support channel teams on their planning
* Onboard Brand & Creative teams onto a new project management tool, and set up campaign planning functionality

What You'll Need:

* A proactive, positive and energetic attitude, you’re someone who gets stuck in, solves problems quickly, and brings ideas to the table with enthusiasm
* Experience in Marketing Project Management or Brand Marketing ideally in Retail (either in-house or agency) with a strong knowledge of 360 campaign planning processes and deliverables
* Demonstrable experience in planning and delivering 360 brand awareness and performance-driven campaigns, partnerships, and experiential activations
* Highly-organised with strong planning and process optimisation skills, and the ability to be flexible, juggle multiple projects, meet deadlines and stay calm under pressure
* Strong experience tracking, analysing and reporting on both digital and physical activations
* Excellent written and verbal communication skills
* Confident at communicating with senior stakeholders and with across global teams, and the ability to build rapport quickly both internally and externally
* Digitally confident, with strong working knowledge of Google and Microsoft office tools, as well as project planning tools such as Asana, Trello and Figma
* Strong understanding of performance and results tracking, and familiarity with performance-tracking tools, both native metrics and 3rd-party platforms
* Creative and commercially aware, always thinking about how to drive awareness and impact for the brand
* Ability to recognise and ensure activations are on-brand and of the high creative standard our customers expect of Anthropologie, aligning with the global brand identity

The Perks:

Work-life balance:  

* Flexible start and finish times

* Bring your dog to work

Wellbeing:  

* Employees Assistance program to support with mental, physical and financial health

* Fully equipped free gym and on-site wellness room in Brick Lane and 50% discount of external gym memberships
* Private Medical Insurance

Employee Discount:  

* Up to 40% off at **all URBN Brands!**

Community:  

* One paid day to either volunteer or fundraise for a charity of your choice

Travel:  

* Cycle to work scheme

* Season ticket loan

Continued Development:  

* We offer structured support within the business alongside continued learning and development

#AnthroEU #LI-SW1

Equal Opportunity Statement:

URBN is an Equal Opportunities Employer committed to diversity and inclusion. We provide equal employment opportunities regardless of age, sexual orientation, sex, gender reassignment, pregnancy, marital status, religion, race, or disability. We base all our employment decisions on merit, job requirements and business needs.

jobs.job_title: Anthropologie Temporary Home Designer - Graphic Design
jobs.description: Role Summary:Anthropologie Home is looking for a Temporary Graphic Designer. The Graphic Designer will contribute to the visual identity of Anthro Living by developing compelling product packaging and graphic treatments for a range of home products. The ideal candidate will be a creative and detail-oriented individual with a strong understanding of design principles and a proven track record of bringing design concepts to execution. This role requires the ability to work both independently and collaboratively within a fast-paced environment, ensuring brand consistency and visually appealing solutions that resonate with the Anthro Living customer.Role Responsibilities:Conceptualize and design innovative product packaging solutions that are both aesthetically pleasing and functional, considering production feasibility and brand guidelines.Develop creative graphic treatments for Anthro Living products, including but not limited to candles, home fragrance, decorative accessories, and seasonal items.Maintain a strong awareness of current design trends, techniques, and technologies to inform design solutions.Collaborate closely with designers, product development, and marketing teams to ensure visual elements are cohesive and effectively communicate the Anthro Living brand message.Manage design projects from concept to final production, including preparing files for print or digital output.Contribute to the development and maintenance of brand style guides and visual standards.Role Qualifications:Bachelor's degree in Graphic Design or a related field.3-5 years of professional experience in graphic design, preferably within a retail or lifestyle brand environment.Proficiency in industry-standard design software, including Adobe Photoshop, Illustrator, and InDesign.A strong portfolio demonstrating a solid understanding of typography, layout, color theory, and visual hierarchy, with examples of packaging and product graphics.Proven ability to translate creative concepts into effective and brand-appropriate visual solutions.Excellent communication, presentation, and interpersonal skills.The Perks:URBN offers comprehensive Perks & Benefits to employees. jobs.description: Role Summary:Anthropologie is hiring a digital marketing professional to develop and execute the Paid Social marketing activation strategy for Anthropologie Group brands, Anthropologie and BHLDN. This role is highly cross-functional where teamwork, innovation, analysis, and strategic thinking are critical aspects of this position’s responsibilities.We are looking for a Paid Social media coordinator who knows how to execute within paid social channels and can help us to explore how to grow our paid social presence while connecting our mission and our unique product assortment customers. You will collaborate closely with our other paid digital channels, creative and merchandising leads as well as ad tech stakeholders to align the channel and business growth goals.In this role collaboration and clear communications are key. It is critical that you are curious, a self-starter, and a willing teammate who takes pride in ownership of this important program. The ideal candidate has serious analytical chops and strong work ethic with a drive to provide growth for the business. It's important to possess an eagerness to innovate, measure, test, sometimes fail, learn, and evolve to implement improved strategy for Anthropologie Group campaigns across Paid Social media.Role Responsibilities:Work under the Manager Paid Social and cross-functionally with creative, merchandising, and analytics teams to incorporate the business vision into paid social programsExecute strategy to drive profitable demand and support business priorities.Provide campaign analysis to help generate data-driven recommendations that improve current marketing and business practices in and initiatives, remaining flexible and willingness to support opportunities to drive the businessThe position demands strong analytical, planning and multi-tasking skills to achieve business jobs.description: About Us:Founded in 1992, Pennsylvania, USA, by current URBN chairman and president Dick Hayne, Anthropologie was named after his college major (with a decidedly French twist) Anthropologie, which now operates over 200 stores worldwide, has evolved into a leading one-of-a-kind destination for those seeking a curated mix of clothing, accessories, gifts and home décor to reflect their personal style. In 2009 the brand launched its first store in London and now has over 18 stores in the UK and Europe.Role Summary:We are looking for a Freelance Social Content Creative to support the Anthropologie social team. You’ll support with ideation, creative execution and post-production for Anthropologie Europe’s TikTok and Instagram accounts.This position will be a mix of working remote, in our office and in our stores 3 days a week.What You'll Be Doing:Develop and demonstrate understanding of Anthropologie’s key audiences and how best to engage themOffering of-the-moment, specialist advice on developing social trends, suggesting how these can be applied to Anthropologie’s content strategyEnd-to-end management of project-based content creation, from sample selection and shooting, through to video capturing, editing and writing captionsPresent ideas back to the social team for approval.Collaborate on the planning of the social content calendarEnsure your creative and ideation maintains brand TOV.What You'll Need:A positive can-do attitudeHyper-fixated on detailStrong knowledge of the developing social media landscape, both current and emerging innovationsStrong knowledge of fashion, homeware and cultural trends in the social spaceVideo editing skills – Capcut essential, Premiere optional.Confident in front of the cameraStrong organisation skills – must be able to manage multiple video projects at once.Balance being a forward planner with the ability to be reactive and adaptable in a changing retail environmentAbility to centre the brand in all creative processesStrong English language and communication skillsPlease share either their own social profile online OR a portfolio showcasing previous work.#AnthroEU #LI-ER1The Perks:Work-life balance:Flexible start and finish timesBring your dog to workEqual Opportunity Statement:URBN is an Equal Opportunities Employer committed to diversity and inclusion. jobs.description:
Arhaus was founded in 1986 on a simple idea: Furniture and décor should be sustainably sourced, lovingly made, and built to last. Today, we partner with artisans around the world who share our vision, creating beautiful, heirloom-quality pieces that can be used—and loved—for generations.

Arhaus is seeking a Senior Graphic Designer, Digital to join their Creative team. The ideal candidate will be able to translate strategic insights into brand defining creative storytelling, have a high attention to detail, be able to drive creative innovation, and manage the creative design process. As a Senior Graphic Designer, Digital, you'll be responsible for the concepting, execution and on-time delivery of high-quality creative materials across marketing channels with a focus on building the Arhaus brand, engaging customers, and driving business results.

**Essential Duties & Responsibilities:**

* Lead and manage the creative design process from concept to completion, ensuring that all deliverables support Arhaus brand pillars, engaging customers, and driving business results
* Partner with copywriters and marketing partners to brainstorm, design and develop creative work for various campaigns, including print ads, digital banners, social media content, and other marketing materials.
* Design materials that enhance the Arhaus brand and the overall customer experience
* Drive innovation with editorial storytelling approach that elevates customer engagement
* Provide expertise that pushes the team to do the most effective and elevated work possible
* Demonstrate exceptional creative concepting ability across multiple marketing channels, as evidenced by a diverse portfolio of work
* Translate strategic insights into effective and highly creative ideas
* Oversee and mentor designers, providing guidance and feedback to ensure their professional growth and the quality of their work.
* Partner with Marketing leads to grow the business and explore new business opportunities
* Manage multiple projects and deliverables simultaneously
* Maintain accountability for overall quality of creative work
* Conduct and participate in design reviews with a range of stakeholders across the organization

**Requirements:**

* Bachelor or Master’s degree in Advertising, Communications, Design, or other related field (or other relevant equivalent)
* 7+ years of experience in Art Direction
* Fluent in Adobe Suite
* Strong conceptual and visual storytelling skills, with an exceptional portfolio showcasing a range of campaign work..
* Strong understanding of design principles, typography, color theory, and layout design.
* Ability to balance big-picture creative thinking with hands-on design execution.
* Strong project management skills and ability to function as project leader influencing others as well as individual contributor. Able to work well in cross-functional teams.
* Strong leadership skills and the ability to mentor and guide junior team members.
* Team Player – Must be able to manage and work with various members of creative, ecommerce and social teams
* Must be organized and able to prioritize, multi-task and work independently
* Fluent in English, with excellent communication, presentation, and social skills
* Strong communication, presentation, and interpersonal skills including the ability to communicate design concepts appropriately to different audiences and varying levels of the organization
* Excellent presentation, teambuilding and communication skills, as well as a strong customer service mentality, to build and maintain relationships

Arhaus is an Equal Opportunity Employer and prohibits discrimination and harassment of any kind. Arhaus is committed to the principle of equal employment opportunity for all employees and to providing employees with a work environment free of discrimination and harassment. All employment decisions at Arhaus are based on business needs, job requirements, and individual qualifications, without regard to race, color, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, religion or belief, family or parental status, or any other status protected by the laws or regulations in the locations where we operate. Arhaus will not tolerate discrimination or harassment based on any of these characteristics. Arhaus encourages applicants of all ages.

jobs.description:
Job Details  
  
**Description**Job Description  
  
Since 1986, our mission has been simple. We design and build heirloom quality products while holding true to our commitment to use earth-friendly materials and to give back whenever possible. We are looking for a strategic and passionate leader who shares our love of story-telling and believes passionately in the value of heirloom quality artisan furniture, sustainability, and our mission to continue to learn and grow as a brand.  
  
Arhaus is seeking a Manager, Growth Marketing to lead our paid media strategy and execution across paid social, display, video, search and emerging channels. In this highly data-driven, creative role, this individual will be instrumental in shaping and scaling our digital presence, driving profitable growth and brand affinity through innovative campaigns and rigorous performance optimization. Reporting to the Director, Content & Growth Marketing, this leader will own the strategy, planning, execution, budget management and performance across all growth channels and will directly lead and oversee a team of specialists, ensuring both team and channel success. This position is located on-site at our Corporate Headquarters in Boston Heights, OH.  
  
Key Responsibilities

* Own the growth marketing strategy across paid social, display, video, and search, aligning campaigns with business objectives
* Develop full-funnel paid media plans that drive awareness, engagement, and conversion while maximizing efficiency
* Set channel KPIs and manage budgets, ensuring delivery against sales and ROI targets
* Lead cross-functional collaboration, partnering closely with Creative, Analytics, and Ecom to deliver best-in-class campaigns
* Oversee in platform activation and optimization across all platforms refining targeting, bidding, creative and landing page strategies
* Translate performance data into insights, providing actionable recommendations to stakeholders and senior leadership
* Manage vendor relationships to ensure alignment, performance and continuous growth
* Continuously test and evolve campaigns and strategies, building roadmaps for creative, audience, and channel innovations
* Lead and develop a high-performing team, providing coaching, feedback, and career development opportunities for direct reports
* Stay ahead of industry trends and platform updates to inform strategy and maintain competitive advantage

**Required Experience**

* 4+ years of growth or performance marketing experience, including strategic planning, performance optimization and hands-on execution of multi million dollar programs
* Demonstrated leadership and people management experience, with proven success managing direct reports
* Deep understanding of the digital advertising ecosystem, including campaign structure, audience segmentation, bidding strategies, and attribution modeling
* Demonstrated understanding and experiencing in full funnel strategy
* Strong storytelling skills with the ability to distill complex data into insights for stakeholders and senior leadership
* Data-driven problem solving skills, with a desire to look for opportunities through data analysis and to take action on them
* Experience in a fast-paced environment where deadlines, priorities, and initiatives pivot at the speed of digital trends
* Self-starter with exceptional organizational, prioritization, and communication skills, with the ability to lead both teams and cross-functional partners

**Preferred Experience**

* Familiarity with multiple forms of analytics and measurement tools (ie A/B + Brand/Conversion Lift Testing, GA4, Media Mixed Modeling, etc)
* Experience with retail and/or eCommerce D2C brands
* Understanding of retail calendar and seasonal process
* Passion for digital innovation, consumer trends, and the intersection of brand and performance marketing

jobs.description:
Arhaus was founded in 1986 on a simple idea: Furniture and décor should be sustainably sourced, lovingly made, and built to last. Today, we partner with artisans around the world who share our vision, creating beautiful, heirloom-quality pieces that can be used—and loved—for generations.

**Essential Duties & Responsibilities:**

The Vice President of Commerce and Marketing Technology will be a visionary leader responsible for shaping and executing the company’s commerce strategy across retail, eCommerce, and emerging marketing technology platforms. This executive will drive innovation, enhance customer engagement, and deliver seamless, personalized shopping experiences through cutting-edge technology and is responsible for delivery and continuous improvement of all customer-facing technology platforms that drive revenue and brand engagement. This includes ownership of the enterprise **e-commerce, point-of-sale (POS), order management, CRM, loyalty, and marketing technology ecosystems**. The role requires a proven track record of leading large-scale technology initiatives preferably with Shopify experience, fostering innovation, and aligning technology with business goals in a fast-paced retail environment.

**Commerce and Marketing Strategy & Leadership**

* Develop and execute the technology vision for commerce and marketing technologies to accelerate growth and profitability.
* Partner with executive leadership to align innovation roadmaps with overall business objectives.
* Lead a high-performing technology organization (blend of internal and external teams), fostering a culture of innovation, agility, and continuous improvement.

**Commerce and Marketing Platform Management**

* Lead the vision, design, and lifecycle of e-commerce, POS, OMS, and CRM systems (e.g., Shopify, Manhattan Active Omni, Salesforce Marketing Cloud, or similar).
* Oversee integrations between ERP, WMS, PIM, and digital front-ends to ensure real-time inventory visibility, accurate pricing, and personalized marketing.
* Champion enterprise data integration and governance across the martech stack (CDP, analytics, tagging, and privacy compliance).
* Ensure scalability, security, and performance of commerce and marketing platforms to support rapid growth and evolving customer needs.
* Drive enhancements in digital merchandising, personalization, payment solutions, and omnichannel integration.

**Innovation & Emerging Technology**

* Identify and deploy emerging technologies that enhance the retail experience and operational efficiency.
* Establish partnerships with technology providers, startups, and innovation labs to stay ahead of market trends.
* Pilot and scale new digital experiences that deepen customer engagement and loyalty.

**Customer Experience & Data**

* Ensure a frictionless omnichannel journey—online, mobile, and in-store—through unified authentication, cart persistence, and loyalty experiences.
* Enable store associates with reliable POS and clienteling tools that reflect real-time customer and product data.
* Partner with Marketing and Customer Insights to leverage martech capabilities for personalization, automation, and A/B testing. Lead efforts to deliver personalized, data-driven customer journeys across channels.
* Leverage analytics, customer insights, and predictive modeling to optimize product recommendations, promotions, and digital content.
* Champion a customer-first mindset in all technology initiatives.

**Operational Excellence**

* Oversee technology budgets, vendor relationships, and enterprise platform investments.
* Implement best practices for governance, cybersecurity, compliance, and risk management.
* Partner with store operations, supply chain, and marketing to enable seamless omnichannel experiences.

**Requirements:**

* 15+ years of technology leadership experience, with at least 7 years in senior roles overseeing engineering, operations and best practices.
* Commerce and/or marketing technology management in retail or consumer-facing industries.
* Strong background in enterprise architecture, digital commerce platforms, and customer experience technologies.
* Demonstrated success in leading digital transformation and delivering measurable business impact.

jobs.description: Job DetailsDescriptionSince 1986, our mission has been simple. We design and build heirloom quality products while holding true to our commitment to use earth-friendly materials and to give back whenever possible. We are looking for someone who shares our love of story-telling and believes passionately in the value of heirloom quality artisan furniture, sustainability, and our mission to continue to learn and grow as a brand.Arhaus, a leader in premium, luxury home furnishings, is seeking a highly strategic, creative, and experiencedSr Product Marketing Managerto join our team. This role is central to ensuring that both oursales teamsandclientshave the information they need to make informed decisions and to successfully sell and buy Arhaus products. The Product Marketing Manager will drive the communication of Arhaus’quality, craftsmanshipandproduct differentiation, creating clear, compelling, and accessible content that resonates with both our internal teams and clients. This position will also oversee the development and execution of product marketing collateral, partnering closely withProduct Merchandising,Marketing, Creative, andPhoto Studioteams while ensuring internal teams to deliver on time.Essential Duties And ResponsibilitiesElevated Product Strategy & Presentation:Lead the creation and implementation of product marketing strategies that emphasize Arhaus’ luxury craftsmanship and quality, ensuring product messaging is clear, compelling, and resonates with both customers and the sales team. Highlight the premium value and unique design differentiation of Arhaus products across all channels.E-Commerce Optimization & Customer-Facing Content: Work closely with the E-commerce and creative teams to ensure that products are launched on Arhaus.com on-time and that product content on Product Detail Pages (PDP) and Product Listing Pages (PLP) is optimized for conversion, clearly communicating the luxury quality and differentiated design of Arhaus products. Ensure all digital content reflects the brand’s premium positioning, guiding customers through the buying journey with rich product descriptions, imagery, and multimedia.Customer Communication & Support: Develop clear, easy-to-understand product information and materials for customers, both in-store and online. Ensure that the information available to customers supports their decision-making process, providing them with the necessary details about product features, quality, craftsmanship, and differentiation to facilitate purchasing decisions.Sales Enablement & Training Materials: Create and support comprehensive product materials for the sales team, ensuring they have all the necessary information to effectively sell Arhaus products. Be the marketing lead in strategizing future opportunities for refining our product information process and technology – ie, product feature sheets, FAQs, competitive analysis documents, and in-depth product modules that highlight product quality, craftsmanship, and unique selling points, enabling the sales team to communicate with confidence and close more sales.Cross-Functional Collaboration:Serve as the central point of contact for all product presentation and marketing initiatives between Product Merchandising, E-commerce, Creative, Sales, and other teams. Ensure all teams are aligned on product priorities, marketing timelines, and key messaging, and facilitate the smooth execution of product-related content.Process Development & Optimization: Establish and refine internal processes and communication tools for managing product marketing initiatives to ensure timely, effective execution of product launches. Optimize tools and set clear timelines, task assignments, and accountability structures to keep all teams on track and ensure timely delivery of marketing materials, training content, and digital assets.Partnership with Product Merchandising Team: Collaborate closely with the Product Merchandising Team to establish seasonal product priorities that reflect Arhaus’ luxury positioning and sales goals. Work together to prioritize products for ecommerce presentation and marketing and ensure that these priorities are communicated clearly to the creative, photo studio, and ecomm teams for seamless execution of content that reflects the brand’s quality and premium value.Collaboration with Creative & Photo Studio Teams: Once product priorities are set, communicate these priorities clearly to the creative and photo studio teams. Ensure creative timelines align with targeted launch dates and product merchandising priorities. Hold teams accountable for achieviOversee the creation of high-quality, on-brand visual assets that showcase the craftsmanship and luxury of Arhaus products.Alignment and Support of Selling & Service Team: Evaluate and Identify opportunity in how marketing can better support our selling & service teams with product information. Develop and implement a strategy to support those teams.Team Leadership & AccountabilityLead and manage cross-functional teams, including content creators, copywriters, designers, and external agencies. Ensure that all team members are held accountable for deadlines and deliverables, maintaining the highest quality standards. Develop efficient workflows and processes that foster collaboration and streamline execution.Market & Competitive AnalysisStay up to date on industry trends and competitor activities. Use this information to adapt Arhaus’ product positioning and ensure that our product offerings remain best-in-class in terms of both luxury and value. Analyze consumer behavior and purchasing patterns to further optimize product messaging and marketing strategies.RequirementsBachelor’s degree in Marketing, Business, or a related field.8+ years of product marketing or product merchandising experience, ideally within the luxury retail or home furnishings industry.Proven experience working with cross-functional teams (e.g., Product Merchandising, E-commerce, Creative, Sales) to bring product marketing strategies to life.Ability to create compelling product messaging that clearly communicates luxury, quality, craftsmanship, and product differentiation for both internal teams and customers.Strong experience in creating and managing sales enablement tools and materials that support both in-store and online sales efforts.Exceptional project management skills with the ability to juggle multiple priorities, drive projects to completion, and maintain high standards of execution.Leadership experience, with the ability to manage teams, set expectations, and hold teams accountable for deliverables.Strong understanding of marketing, e-commerce, product content creation, and digital marketing best practices.Ability to analyze market trends, customer feedback, and sales data to refine product positioning and communication strategies.Excellent communication and collaboration skills, with a focus on ensuring both sales teams and customers have the information they need to succeedArhaus is an Equal Opportunity Employer and prohibits discrimination and harassment of any kind. Arhaus is committed to the principle of equal employment opportunity for all employees and to providing employees with a work environment free of discrimination and harassment. All employment decisions at Arhaus are based on business needs, job requirements, and individual qualifications, without regard to race, color, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, religion or belief, family or parental status, or any other status protected by the laws or regulations in the locations where we operate. Arhaus will not tolerate discrimination or harassment based on any of these characteristics. Arhaus encourages applicants of all ages.

jobs.description:
Key Responsibilities  
  
AI Art Direction & Visual Strategy

* Set visual direction for AI-generated imagery across all AFI brands and product lines
* Establish comprehensive AI imagery standards that maintain brand integrity and quality
* Develop creative briefs and visual guidelines specifically for AI-generated content
* Partner with creative teams to integrate AI imagery seamlessly with traditional photography and design

Studio Output & Quality Management  
  

* Oversee AI output and maintain quality standards for all AI-generated visual content
* Develop quality control processes and approval workflows for AI-generated imagery
* Ensure AI-generated content meets brand standards and commercial requirements
* Monitor and optimize AI production workflows for efficiency and consistency

Team Education & Development  
  

* Lead team education on new AI tools and techniques across the creative organization
* Develop training programs and best practices for AI tool adoption
* Mentor team members on AI art direction principles and creative applications
* Stay current with emerging AI technologies and assess their potential for creative implementation

Process Innovation & Workflow Development  
  

* Design and implement agentic workflows that scale AI production thoughtfully
* Create systematic approaches that combine AI efficiency with creative excellence
* Collaborate cross-functionally to integrate AI capabilities into existing creative processes
* Document and refine AI production methodologies for scalable implementation

**Required Qualifications**Experience & Background  
  

* 6+ years of professional art direction experience with demonstrated leadership in creative innovation
* Proven track record in visual content creation, photography, or digital imaging
* Portfolio featuring art direction created by AI and traditional photography required
* Experience in retail, furniture, or consumer goods industries preferred

Core Competencies  
  

* Advanced expertise in AI image generation tools
* Strong understanding of traditional photography and art direction principles
* Proficiency in creative software (Adobe Creative Suite, Figma, etc.)
* Excellent process design and workflow optimization skills
* Knowledge of emerging AI technologies and creative applications

Leadership Skills  
  

* Demonstrated ability to educate and inspire teams on new technologies
* Strong collaboration and cross-functional partnership capabilities
* Excellent communication skills with ability to present AI concepts to leadership
* Balance of innovative thinking with practical implementation expertise
* Change management experience in adopting new creative technologies

jobs.description:
**AI Art Director - Ashley Furniture Industries**

**Location: Tampa FL**

*About Us*

Ashley is America's largest furniture manufacturer and a global retail leader. We’ve been committed to delivering beautiful, quality home furnishings at an accessible price point for over 75 years. Now, we're evolving our brand to meet the changing lifestyles of today's consumers.This is an exciting time to join the team and make a real impact. You'll be part of a transformation, working with passionate professionals who are reshaping an industry and creating meaningful connections between our products and the lives they enhance.

**Position Overview**

Ashley Furniture Industries is seeking an innovative AI Art Director to advance AFI's creative innovation by setting the visual direction for AI-generated imagery, establishing standards, and developing agentic workflows. Reporting directly to the Sr. Director of Image Capture, this pioneering role focuses on art direction , studio output and quality , and team education on new tools and techniques. This leader ensures we scale AI thoughtfully and effectively while unlocking efficiency, expanding creative possibility, and keeping AFI at the forefront of AI-enhanced production.

**Key Responsibilities**

AI Art Direction & Visual Strategy

* **Set visual direction for AI-generated imagery** across all AFI brands and product lines
* Establish comprehensive AI imagery standards that maintain brand integrity and quality
* Develop creative briefs and visual guidelines specifically for AI-generated content
* Partner with creative teams to integrate AI imagery seamlessly with traditional photography and design

Studio Output & Quality Management

* **Oversee AI output and maintain quality standards** for all AI-generated visual content
* Develop quality control processes and approval workflows for AI-generated imagery
* Ensure AI-generated content meets brand standards and commercial requirements
* Monitor and optimize AI production workflows for efficiency and consistency

Team Education & Development

* **Lead team education on new AI tools and techniques** across the creative organization
* Develop training programs and best practices for AI tool adoption
* Mentor team members on AI art direction principles and creative applications
* Stay current with emerging AI technologies and assess their potential for creative implementation

Process Innovation & Workflow Development

* **Design and implement agentic workflows** that scale AI production thoughtfully
* Create systematic approaches that combine AI efficiency with creative excellence
* Collaborate cross-functionally to integrate AI capabilities into existing creative processes
* Document and refine AI production methodologies for scalable implementation

**Qualifications**

Experience & Background

* **6+ years of professional art direction experience**with demonstrated leadership in creative innovation
* Proven track record in visual content creation, photography, or digital imaging
* **Portfolio featuring art direction created by AI and traditional photography required**
* Experience in retail, furniture, or consumer goods industries preferred

Core Competencies

* **Advanced expertise in AI image generation tools**
* Strong understanding of traditional photography and art direction principles
* Proficiency in creative software (Adobe Creative Suite, Figma, etc.)
* Excellent process design and workflow optimization skills
* Knowledge of emerging AI technologies and creative applications

Leadership Skills

* Demonstrated ability to educate and inspire teams on new technologies
* Strong collaboration and cross-functional partnership capabilities
* Excellent communication skills with ability to present AI concepts to leadership
* Balance of innovative thinking with practical implementation expertise
* Change management experience in adopting new creative technologies

**Our Core Values**

* Honesty & Integrity
* Passion, Drive, Discipline
* Continuous Improvement/Operational Excellence
* Dirty Fingernail
* Growth Focused

**Benefits We Offer**

* Health, Dental, Vision, Employee Assistance Program
* Paid Vacation, Holidays, and Your Birthday off
* Generous Employee Discount on home furnishings
* Professional Development Opportunities
* Ashley Wellness Centers (location specific) and Medical Tourism
* Telehealth
* 401(k) and Profit Sharing
* Life Insurance

To learn more about Ashley Furniture, our community engagement programs, environmental stewardship, and our core values, please visit our Corporate Social Responsibility information page:

**Corporate Social Responsibility**

**https://www.ashleyfurniture.com/about-us/corporate-social-responsibility/report/**

We are an equal opportunity employer and provide a drug-free working environment. While Ashley appreciates the interest of all candidates only those meeting specific position requirements may be contacted. Principals Only.

**Search Firm Representatives Please Read Carefully:**

*Ashley Furniture Industries, LLC, is not accepting unsolicited assistance from search firms for this employment opportunity unless an agreement is in place. Please, no phone calls or emails. All resumes submitted by search firms to any employee at Ashley Furniture via email, the Internet or in any form and/or method without a valid search agreement in place for this position will be deemed the sole property of Ashley Furniture. No fee will be paid in the event the candidate is hired by Ashley Furniture as a result of the referral or through other means.*

jobs.description: Director of Product Marketing – OnSite: Tampa, FLAbout the Role:We are seeking a seasonedDirector of Product Marketingto define and lead the strategy, positioning, and execution of product launches across our multi-brand home and furniture portfolio. This highly visible leadership role serves as the central connector across Merchandising, Product Development, Sales, Marketing, and Creative, ensuring each product enters the market with precision, consistency, and impact. You will own the go-to-market (GTM) strategy, develop scalable product messaging and positioning frameworks, and guide a high-performing team in bringing new collections to market across direct-to-consumer, retail, wholesale, and marketplace channels. This role offers the opportunity to shape category leadership, drive meaningful growth, and elevate how our brands engage customers across a diverse and evolving landscape.To be considered for this opportunity, you must be able to commute to Ashley’s Corporate Office in Tampa, FL. Relocation assistance is available for qualified candidates.Why This Opportunity Is Special:Build the Foundation:This is a unique opportunity to architect the Product Marketing function from the ground up at the largest furniture manufacturer in America.Lead Through Influence:You’ll sit at the center of our business—where strategy meets storytelling and product meets customer.Be a Category Shaper:We’re launching high-velocity SKUs across multiple categories: upholstery, casegoods, motion, and bedding.Join a Growth-Obsessed Team:We move fast, think big, and iterate quickly. You'll have both leadership and ownership.What You’ll be Doing:GTM Strategy & Category OwnershipOwn and managego-to-market plans, calendars, and cross-functional launch workflows across all furniture categoriesDefineproduct positioning, selling narratives, and consumer-facing benefits for each channel (DTC, retail, Amazon, Wayfair, etc.)Drive alignment with Merchandising and Development to prioritize the right SKUs for each seasonal launchMessaging & Content BriefingWrite and evolvecore messaging documentsand storytelling frameworks that drive marketing campaigns, packaging, PDPs, and retail contentPartner with Creative and Brand teams to brief onimagery, video, 3D renderings, and copyneeded for launch assetsEnsurechannel-ready contentis accurate, timely, and compliant with each retailer or platformHub Between DepartmentsAct as the central bridge betweenProduct Development, Merchandising, Sales, Creative, and MarketingAlign on timelines, product specifications, messaging priorities, and asset needsRun cross-functional meetings and checkpoints to keep all teams informed and accountableProduct Accuracy & Consumer InsightsPartner with Data & Insights to validate claims, track reviews, and refine positioning over timeEnsure accuracy of product names, specifications, claims, dimensions, and visual representationMaintain centralized systems for product content readiness and version controlTeam LeadershipBuild and manage a high-performing team:Product Marketing Managers (by category)Content & Readiness ManagerLaunch Project ManagerOptional: Insights AnalystFoster a team culture of collaboration, creativity, and continuous improvementSkills & Qualifications:Bachelor’s degree required; advanced degree preferred8–10 years of progressive experience in product marketing, brand marketing, or category leadership—ideally within home, furniture, or consumer goods industriesDemonstrated success leading product launches across multiple channels, with expertise in DTC, marketplace, and wholesale environmentsProven people leadership experience within high-growth, fast-paced businessesStrong ability to collaborate across functions, with direct experience partnering with Merchandising, Sales, Product Development, Creative, and Retail Marketing teamsExceptional communication, strategic thinking, and execution skills with a strong bias toward resultsAbility and willingness to travel as needed to support business objectivesBackground in organizations such as Wayfair, Amazon, Home Depot, or Steelcase a plusReports to:Head Merchant/Marketplace Category Lead & Chief Creative OfficerLevel:Director (8–10 years experience)What We Offer(subject to eligibility requirements):Benefits: When you join our family, you are eligible to participate in our comprehensive benefits programs which includes Health, Dental, Vision, Life/Disability, Flexible Spending Accounts, 401(k), Paid Holidays, Paid Vacation. Benefits may vary based on position and location, so we encourage you to speak with the recruiting team during the interview process.Our Core Values:Honesty & IntegrityPassion, Drive, DisciplineContinuous Improvement/Operational ExcellenceDirty FingernailGrowth FocusedTo learn more about Ashley Furniture, our community engagement programs, environmental stewardship, and our core values, please visit our Corporate Social Responsibility information page:Corporate Social Responsibilityhttps://www.ashleyfurniture.com/about-us/corporate-social-responsibility/report/This company values its diversity and is proud to be an equal opportunity employer. All employment decisions are made on the basis of an individual’s skills, qualifications, merit and business need.

jobs.description:
**Marketing Specialist, Partnerships – OnSite: Tampa, FL**

Ashley is seeking a Specialist, Strategic Partnerships to join our dynamic Field Marketing & Partnerships team. This role is your gateway to managing a large sports & entertainment portfolio spanning NFL, NBA, MLB, NHL, and top collegiate programs.

**What You'll Do:**

You'll be the driving force behind 40+ activations across 9 professional and 3 collegiate partnerships, executing everything from in-venue signage and paid media campaigns to VIP hospitality and sweepstakes. You'll collaborate across Marketing, Creative, PR, and Retail teams to bring high-impact brand moments to life, while tracking performance data that proves ROI.

**What We're Looking For:**

A detail-obsessed project manager with 1–3 years in marketing partnerships, sponsorships, or event execution (sports/entertainment background strongly preferred). You thrive in fast-paced environments, juggle multiple campaigns with ease, and bring strong organizational chops plus proficiency in Microsoft Office and project management tools.

**Why This Role Matters:**

You'll protect Ashley's strategic assets, ensure flawless delivery, and free senior leaders to focus on growth, all while traveling 20–30% for on-site activations that put you courtside, rinkside, and in the heart of the action.

Reports to: Manager, Strategic Partnerships

**Key Responsibilities**

* Execute contractual deliverables including in-venue signage, paid media, sweepstakes, in-store activations, and digital/social campaigns.
* Manage day-to-day partnership assets and campaign trackers, ensuring deadlines, budgets, and creative approvals are met.
* Lead logistics for activations: ticketing, hospitality, VIPs, promotions, and on-site event support.
* Collaborate with Marketing, Creative, PR, Retail, and Community teams to integrate campaigns into national brand moments.
* Track and compile performance data for recaps, KPI reporting, and ROI analysis.
* Maintain detailed calendars and process documents to ensure consistent execution across dozens of activations.
* Serve as a professional liaison with partners and vendors, escalating relationship management to the Manager as needed.
* Travel as needed (20–30%) for event execution and on-site activations.

**Qualifications**

* Bachelor’s degree in Marketing, Business, Sports Management, or related field.
* 1–3 years of experience in marketing partnerships, sponsorships, or event execution—sports/entertainment background strongly preferred.
* Strong project management and organizational skills; proven ability to juggle multiple campaigns.
* Proficiency in Microsoft Office; experience with project management software (Asana, Smartsheet, etc.) a plus.
* Detail-oriented, proactive, and comfortable working in a fast-paced environment.

**Benefits We Offer**

* Health, Dental, Vision, Employee Assistance Program
* Paid Vacation, Holidays, and Your Birthday off
* Generous Employee Discount on home furnishings
* Professional Development Opportunities
* Ashley Wellness Centers (location specific) and Medical Tourism
* Telehealth

* Life Insurance

**Our Core Values**

* Honesty & Integrity
* Passion, Drive, Discipline
* Continuous Improvement/Operational Excellence
* Dirty Fingernail
* Growth Focused

jobs.description: International Marketing Specialist (Bilingual) – Colton, CA (on-site)What Will You Do?The International Marketing and Advertising Manager is an integral member of the team that must deliver to the company objectives with specific emphasis on developing successful multi-channel marketing programs for international markets including the licensee retail stores, mass merchants and independent retailers. This position involves developing and implementing retail promotion calendar and multi-channel marketing strategies to meet both store and website traffic, sales/revenue, sales per guest (SPG) and growth objectives, while leading and influencing multiple constituents, such as licensees, internal departmental partners and peers, with a high degree of communication and insight with tactical execution.Collaborate with Licensees and International Licensees to establish a comprehensive marketing promotions calendar for each international territory in order to achieve the organization’s annual multi-channel marketing plan and aligns separate but related constituents and business goals into a singular marketing platform and brand message.Drive a cultural of diversity while managing a Marketing/Advertisement understanding from their local perspectives. Understanding and creating unique strategies for different regions and countries, to meet the individual needs.Collaborate with leadership on the alignment of annual and quarterly Company goals of store and website traffic, sales, online site traffic, mattress sales and overall market growth, by country.Drive traffic through a promotional calendar for each global market.Drive the development and deploy aggressive offer and event promotion to licensees, mass merchants and retailers.Develop mattress promotions plan and calendar.Develop new and innovative ways to leverage financing as a traffic driver where possible in each foreign market.Leverage Google Analytics to provide weekly eCommerce traffic reporting; identify and make recommendations for growth opportunities.Lead retailers to provide detailed measurement and reporting on store and website traffic and sales, while identifying and recommending changes to improve effectiveness.Develop first-hand knowledge of market dynamics, competitors, and opportunities by communicating with each market, identifying business potential, and corresponding marketing programs.Develop consistent global market competitive analysis and reporting. Provide real-time recommendations to address market promotions opportunities.Collaborate and communicate with retailers and agencies to execute marketing and advertising trend analysis, monitoring, and competitive benchmarking, as appropriate.Collaborate with a variety of internal teams to identify and socialize market trends and dynamics to develop corresponding marketing programs.Demonstrate the Company’s Core and Growth Values in the performance of all job functions.What Do You Need?Bachelor’s Degree in Marketing, Business Administration, Advertising or related field, or equivalent work experience preferredBi-lingual, RequiredExperience in a B2C marketing and/or advertising function in a high volume, big-box, multi-retail store, preferably in furniture, RequiredProject or Supervisory/Management experience, PreferredStrong attention to detailExcellent verbal and written communication skillsExcellent interpersonal skillsEffective time management and organizational skillsWork independently as well as in a team environmentDocument management systemAnalytical and problem solving skillsMaintain confidentialityWho Are We?At Ashley, we’re more than a business…we’re family. As the largest manufacturer of home furnishings in the world, we know what it takes to build incredible furniture and future leaders. We’re problem solvers with the grit to persevere during challenging times and innovators who won't coast when times are good. We create solutions, not excuses. And never settle for status quo.
