jobs.job_title: Senior Director of Product, Sales & Services
jobs.description: Ashley Furniture is the largest manufacturer of furniture in the world. Our talented engineers and designers travel the world to stay ahead of evolving trends, new materials, and emerging technologies. Our global teams work closely, ensuring that new products meet our standards of excellence while optimizing efficiencies in manufacturing, cost control, and speed to market.Senior Director of Product, Sales & ServicesLocation: Tampa, FL (on-site)As the Sr. Director of Product for Sales & Service at Ashley Furniture Industries, you will play a pivotal role bridging the gap between business and technology, driving product strategy and execution within our Sales and Service Organization, which includes Order Management, CRM, and our Ashley Direct website. This role is responsible for translating business vision into actionable initiatives and collaborating with Technology to deliver impactful solutions using Agile methodologies.Primary Job FunctionsThis section describes the primary /essential responsibilities that this job performs.Company Values: Demonstrate the Company’s Core and Growth Values in the performance of all job functions. (Honesty & Integrity, Passion, Drive & Discipline, Continuous Improvement, Dirty Fingernail, Growth-Focused, Customer Centric, Boundaryless, and A Culture of Leadership)Product Strategy: Develop and execute comprehensive strategies that align with business goals and customer needs. This includes working with stakeholders to define product vision, setting OKRs, and creating roadmaps to achieve them.Product Development: Work closely with business stakeholders and engineering teams to develop product requirements. Make critical decisions and tradeoffs to ensure that product development is on track and meets the defined specifications and quality standards.Feature Prioritization: Prioritize features and initiatives based on business and technology objectives, customer feedback, and business value. Continuously reassess and adjust feature priorities based on changing market conditions, customer feedback, and business needs.Roadmap Planning: Create and maintain detailed product roadmaps. Communicate these roadmaps to stakeholders and ensure alignment across the organization.Cross-Functional Collaboration: Work closely with Supply Chain, Customer Service, and other key business functions to ensure seamless product integration and execution. This includes coordinating product launches, creating go-live strategies, and ensuring alignment across departments.Customer Focused:Work closely with support teams to understand common issues and areas for improvement and use this information to drive product enhancements and reduce customer pain points.Data Analysis: Utilize data analytics to develop strategies, identify trends, and measure ROI and product performance.Team Management: Lead and mentor a team of direct reports, fostering a high-performance, collaborative cultureAgile Methodology: Support and advocate for Agile methodologies to manage product development. This includes leading and participating in sprint ceremonies to ensure efficiency and alignment.Thought leadership: Bring expertise in the industry and functional area to drive innovation and efficiency. Understand and influence the applications and systems supporting the product.Executive Reporting: Deliver regular product updates, including monthly reviews for executive stakeholders. Manage the team through all business processes such as budget reviews, annual planning, strategy offsites, etc.Job QualificationsEducation:Bachelor’s degree in business administration or a related field. MBA is a plus.Experience:15+ years of experience in B2B product management, preferably in enterprise software engineering and deep understanding of business operations in relevant functional areas.Knowledge, Skills and AbilitiesDeep understanding of order management and customer service workflows and technology.Strong analytical and problem-solving skills, with the ability to make data-driven decisions.Proven ability to translate business objectives into a structured product strategyExcellent communication and interpersonal skills, with the ability to effectively collaborate with cross-functional teams and influence stakeholders at all levels.Proficiency in product management tools (e.g., JIRA, Trello, Aha!) and methodologies (e.g., Agile, Scrum).Ability to thrive in a fast-paced, dynamic environment and manage multiple priorities simultaneously.Strong leadership skills, with the ability to inspire and motivate teams.Who Are We?At Ashley, we’re more than a business…we’re family. As the largest manufacturer of home furnishings in the world, we know what it takes to build incredible furniture and future leaders. We’re problem solvers with the grit to persevere during challenging times and innovators who won't coast when times are good. We create solutions, not excuses. And never settle for status quo. It’s the reason we’re always searching for better ways to delivering an exceptional customer experience. That's why Ashley Furniture is #1 in our industry.Ready to grow? You’ve come to the right place. Ashley Furniture has a “Growth Mindset”, and once you join our team, you’ll learn from the best in the business.Apply today and find your home at Ashley!Benefits We OfferHealth, Dental, Vision, Employee Assistance ProgramPaid Vacation, Holidays, and Your Birthday offGenerous Employee Discount on home furnishingsProfessional Development OpportunitiesAshley Wellness Centers (location specific) and Medical TourismTelehealth401(k) and Profit SharingLife InsuranceOur Core ValuesHonesty & IntegrityPassion, Drive, DisciplineContinuous Improvement/Operational ExcellenceDirty FingernailGrowth FocusedTo learn more about Ashley Furniture, our community engagement programs, environmental stewardship, and our core values, please visit our Corporate Social Responsibility information page:Corporate Social Responsibilityhttps://www.ashleyfurniture.com/about-us/corporate-social-responsibility/report/We are an equal opportunity employer and provide a drug-free working environment. While Ashley appreciates the interest of all candidates only those meeting specific position requirements may be contacted. Principals Only.Search Firm Representatives Please Read Carefully:Ashley Furniture Industries, LLC, is not accepting unsolicited assistance from search firms for this employment opportunity unless an agreement is in place. Please, no phone calls or emails. All resumes submitted by search firms to any employee at Ashley Furniture via email, the Internet or in any form and/or method without a valid search agreement in place for this position will be deemed the sole property of Ashley Furniture. No fee will be paid in the event the candidate is hired by Ashley Furniture as a result of the referral or through other means.

jobs.description: The Vice President of Sales (Motion) is responsible and accountable for establishing and driving execution of the business priorities for major functions at Ashley. As a Senior Leader, the Vice President of Sales will drive Ashley to meet its strategic goals to ensure Ashley continues to grow and thrive. The Vice President of Sales is responsible and accountable for the creation and execution of plans and strategies for developing business and achieving Ashley’s sales goals. This individual is expected to create a culture of success and ongoing business and sales achievement. The Vice President of Sales holds the important responsibility of managing the sales team, operations, and resources to deliver profitable growth. As a member of the Ashley team, this individual should continuously strive to do their part to ensure Ashley is the best furniture company. Through passion, drive, and discipline, our employees have created a winning team where continuous improvement and customer satisfaction is at the heart of Ashley. We are committed to earning and retaining trust from both our customers and our employees, and the Vice-President of Sales should share these same values.ScopeThe Vice President of Sales(Motion) is responsible and accountable for enhancing the brand, creating alignment and accountability in the sales organization, enhancing sales talent, and executing a competitive sales strategy aimed at market growth domination.Primary Job ResponsibilitiesSenior Leader Job Responsibilities:Engage Employees- Delegate decision-making authority and task responsibility to employees based on strengths to maximize their job ownership and commitment to outcomes.- Provide timely guidance and feedback to help others excel so that they become more committed to their jobs and the organization.- Build and lead an engaged team that is committed to Ashley and its bottom line.Cultivate a Customer Focused Culture- Make customer relationships and satisfaction the primary driving force when designing products and processes.- Embrace the Ashley vision by creating an environment that inspires people to generate innovative ways to increase customer satisfaction when designing products and processes.- Set high standards and accountability for customer satisfaction in all business activities at Ashley.Job Specific Responsibilities:Enhance the Brand- Make customer satisfaction the primary focus to enhance Ashley’s recognition in the marketplace.- Commit to a long-term sales strategy to enhance Ashley’s brand by analyzing information, evaluating options, and selecting the best sales strategy.- Use insight into market drivers to capitalize on business opportunities that will enhance Ashley’s recognition in the marketplace.Enhance Sales Talent- Attract, develop, and retain talented individuals to build a competitively superior sales organization.- Provide timely guidance and feedback to help sales employees excel on the job and meet key accountabilities.- Delegate decision-making authority and task responsibility to help sales employees realize their highest potential at Ashley.Create Alignment and Accountability in the Sales Organization- Commit to a long-term strategy for increasing alignment and accountability at Ashley by analyzing information, evaluating options, and selecting the best sales strategy.- Align communication, people, culture, and processes to drive flawless execution of Ashley’s objectives.- Delegate decision-making authority and task responsibilities to ensure flawless execution of Ashley’s strategies.Execute Competitive Sales Strategy- Use insight into market drivers to execute a competitive sales strategy that will create new business opportunities.- Execute a competitive sales strategy for Ashley by aligning communication, people, culture, and processes.- Leverage business knowledge and experience to drive sales strategies that will gain competitive advantage.Schedule ExpectationsFlexible and willing to work extended hours when necessary; 50% travel.Job Qualifications:- **Educational Background:** Bachelor's Degree in Business Administration, Marketing, or a related field. MBA or advanced degree preferred.- **Experience:** 10+ years of relevant experience in sales leadership, account management, or a similar role within the retail or furniture industry. Proven track record of driving customer engagement, product adoption, and achieving sales goals.- **Skills:** Exceptional leadership and team management abilities. Strong analytical and problem-solving skills. Excellent verbal and written communication skills, with the ability to convey complex information clearly and concisely. Proficiency in CRM tools and sales software. Ability to work independently and as part of a team. Strong financial literacy with experience in budget management and financial reporting.Benefits We OfferHealth, Dental, Vision, Employee Assistance ProgramPaid Vacation, Holidays, and Your Birthday offGenerous Employee Discount on home furnishingsProfessional Development OpportunitiesAshley Wellness Centers (location specific) and Medical TourismTelehealth401(k) and Profit SharingLife InsuranceOur Core ValuesHonesty & IntegrityPassion, Drive, DisciplineContinuous Improvement/Operational ExcellenceDirty FingernailGrowth FocusedTo learn more about Ashley Furniture, our community engagement programs, environmental stewardship, and our core values, please visit our Corporate Social Responsibility information page:Corporate Social ResponsibilityAshley Furniture is an Equal Opportunity Employer. All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, national origin, or protected veteran status and will not be discriminated against on the basis of disability

jobs.description:
**Build Your Career with Ashley**

**Field Manager of Licensee Sales**

**What Will You Do?**

* Conduct ongoing location visits to identify and support the licensee in product training, merchandising and product assortments, partner on velocity walks and help support any additional areas of opportunity to help grow wholesale sales.
* Supports licensee new store openings and grand re-openings. Participates in new licensee onboarding.
* Participates in operational strategy meetings to devise execute best practices or improvement plans to address region licensee needs or correct identified issues.
* Ensures licensees in district remain in compliance with the TUA. Monitors brand standards, including product and visual, through a rigorous protocol of field visits and licensee self-reporting to help improve and continually enhance brand equity in the licensee community.
* Fosters the licensee network communication process, including field reports, weekly newsletters, quarterly business strategy meetings and reporting protocols. Maintains strong relationships with the region licensees. Resolves licensee issues and concerns.
* Attends Markets to help introduce licensees to new products and programs.
* Participates in quarterly Licensee Sales meetings to provide team building and support to licensees.
* Assists in the support of Tier 2-5 licensees as needed. Works as part of a team, plus on occasion will engage in deeper dives into problematic areas or developing opportunities as a member of a “strike force” approach.
* Promotes the Ashley brand image through active involvement in community associations and events, such as the Chamber of Commerce, Kiwanis, or Rotary Club or volunteer organizations.
* Demonstrates the company’s core and growth values in performance of all job functions.

**What Do You Need?**

* Bachelor’s degree required in Business Administration, Management, Marketing or related field or an equivalent combination of education and experience will be considered.
* Three to five years of retail sales and sales management or distribution center experience. Preferably with experience in furniture retail and fulfillment-based operations employing a license or franchise model.
* Visual Merchandising, Furniture or Training experience a plus.
* Exceptional knowledge of retail, sales and training operations processes.
* Willingness to travel 80%
* Ability to facilitate training and/ or presentations in front of small and large audiences.
* Strong business acumen, with demonstrated knowledge of finance, management, marketing and merchandising.
* Knowledge of licensed business owner or franchise law.
* Knowledge of training management and improvement methods and tools.
* Outstanding analytical and problem solving skills, with the ability to dig deep into the data and then turning that insight into action to drive results.
* Outstanding leadership skills, with the ability to build an inspiring culture through vision, empowerment and development.
* Outstanding verbal and written communication skills, with the ability to organize thoughts, communicate clearly, completely and concisely.
* Strong project/resource management and organizational skills, with the ability to consistently meet demanding deadlines.
* Strong skills in relationship management and coaching that result in the accomplishment of goals.
* Strong skills in agility, along with the ability to pivot easily when directions and priorities change on short notice.
* Strong skills in MS Office Suite or similar office software.

**Who Are We?**

At Ashley, we’re more than a business…we’re family. As the largest manufacturer of home furnishings in the world, we know what it takes to build incredible furniture and future leaders. We’re problem solvers with the grit to persevere during challenging times and innovators who won't coast when times are good. We create solutions, not excuses. And never settle for status quo. It’s the reason we’re always searching for better ways to delivering an exceptional customer experience. That's why Ashley Furniture is #1 in our industry.

Ready to grow? You’ve come to the right place. Ashley Furniture has a “Growth Mindset”, and once you join our team, you’ll learn from the best in the business.

Apply today and find your home at Ashley!

**Benefits We Offer**

* Health, Dental, Vision, Employee Assistance Program
* Paid Vacation (80 Hours), Holidays, and Your Birthday off
* Generous Employee Discount on home furnishings
* Professional Development Opportunities
* Ashley Wellness Centers (location specific) and Medical Tourism
* Telehealth
* 401(k) and Profit Sharing
* Life Insurance

**Our Core Values**

* Honesty & Integrity
* Passion, Drive, Discipline
* Continuous Improvement/Operational Excellence
* Dirty Fingernail
* Growth Focused

To learn more about Ashley Furniture, our community engagement programs, environmental stewardship, and our core values, please visit our Corporate Social Responsibility information page:

https://www.ashleyfurniture.com/about-us/corporate-social-responsibility/report/

*We are an equal opportunity employer and provide a drug-free working environment. While Ashley appreciates the interest of all candidates only those meeting specific position requirements may be contacted. Principals Only.*

jobs.description:
**About Us**

Ashley is America's largest furniture manufacturer and a global retail leader. We’ve been committed to delivering beautiful, quality home furnishings at an accessible price point for over 75 years. Now, we're evolving our brand to meet the changing lifestyles of today's consumers. This is an exciting time to join the team and make a real impact. You'll be part of a transformation, working with passionate professionals who are reshaping an industry and creating meaningful connections between our products and the lives they enhance.

**Position Summary**

The Regional Sales Manager for Electronics will lead sales initiatives across designated territories within Ashley's corporately owned retail markets. This role is responsible for driving brick-and-mortar sales performance of our Electronics category, ensuring seamless integration of electronics offerings into the customer shopping experience across all specified locations.

**Primary Job Functions**

**Sales Leadership & Territory Management**

* Drive Electronics category sales performance across assigned corporate retail territories
* Develop and execute regional sales strategies to maximize Electronics penetration in brick-and-mortar stores
* Lead, coach, and develop store teams to integrate Electronics selling into the customer journey
* Monitor and analyze sales metrics, market trends, and competitive landscape to identify growth opportunities
* Establish and maintain sales targets, KPIs, and performance benchmarks for the region

**Training & Development**

* Ensure consistent execution of Electronics selling techniques across all locations
* Train store teams to naturally incorporate Electronics into customer conversations throughout the sales journey
* Develop and implement best practices for Electronics product presentation
* Conduct regular store visits to provide hands-on coaching and support

**Operational Excellence**

* Ensure compliance with Electronics program standard operating procedures (SOPs)
* Maintain product accuracy and consistency across all regional locations
* Collaborate with merchandising and operations teams to optimize Electronics category performance
* Partner with vendors to maximize training and sales opportunities

**Strategic Planning**

* Identify market-specific opportunities and challenges within assigned territories
* Provide feedback and insights to leadership on market conditions, customer preferences, and competitive activities
* Support new store openings and Electronics category expansions

**Secondary Job Functions**

1. Maintain reliable attendance.
2. Actively participate in departmental meetings, training and education. Assist with training other employees and providing backup.
3. Complete other assignments and special projects as requested.

**Job Qualifications**

**Education:**

* Bachelor Degree in Business, Marketing, or related field or equivalent work experience, Required

**Experience:**

* 5+ years of experience in Sales Management, preferably in consumer electronics or home furnishing, Required
* Muti Unit Management experience, Preferred
* Consumer Electronics or Home Furnishings experience, Preferred

**Licenses or Certifications**

* None

**Knowledge, Skills and Abilities**

* Strong attention to detail
* Excellent verbal and written communication skills
* Excellent interpersonal skills
* Effective time management and organizational skills
* Work independently as well as in a team environment
* Document management system
* Analytical and problem solving skills
* Maintain confidentiality
* Working knowledge of Continuous Improvement
* Handle multiple projects simultaneously within established time constraints
* Proficient computer skills, including experience with Microsoft Office Suite, internet
* Perform under strong demands in a fast-paced environment
* Work professionally with customers and co-workers to efficiently serve our customers, treating both with enthusiasm and respect
* Display empathy, understanding and patience with employees and external customers
* Respond professionally in situations with difficult employee/vendor/customer issues or inquiries

**Schedule Expectations**

1. This position will be required to travel frequently (up to 75%).
2. Flexible and willing to work extended hours when necessary.

**Job Competencies**

1. **Results-Oriented**: Consistently achieves and exceeds sales targets
2. **Leadership**: Inspires and motivates teams to perform at their best
3. **Customer-Focused**: Understands customer needs and delivers exceptional experiences
4. **Analytical Thinking**: Uses data to drive decisions and identify opportunities
5. **Communication**: Effectively communicates vision, expectations, and feedback
6. **Adaptability**: Thrives in a fast-paced, evolving retail environment

**Our Core Values**

* Honesty & Integrity
* Passion, Drive, Discipline
* Continuous Improvement/Operational Excellence
* Dirty Fingernail
* Growth Focused

To learn more about Ashley Furniture, our community engagement programs, environmental stewardship, and our core values, please visit our Corporate Social Responsibility information page:

**Corporate Social Responsibility**

**https://www.ashleyfurniture.com/about-us/corporate-social-responsibility/report/**

jobs.description:
**About Us**

Ashley is America's largest furniture manufacturer and a global retail leader. We’ve been committed to delivering beautiful, quality home furnishings at an accessible price point for over 75 years. Now, we're evolving our brand to meet the changing lifestyles of today's consumers. This is an exciting time to join the team and make a real impact. You'll be part of a transformation, working with passionate professionals who are reshaping an industry and creating meaningful connections between our products and the lives they enhance.

**Position Summary**

The Retail Experience Marketing Specialist is responsible for ensuring an exceptional in-store experience across bedding and electronics categories. This role manages all aspects of retail marketing execution, including signage coordination, vendor communication, store audits, and compliance with set standards. The specialist will serve as a key liaison between marketing, visual merchandising, vendors, and retail locations to ensure timely delivery and proper placement of all point-of-purchase (POP) materials.

**Key Responsibilities**

**Signage Execution**

o Coordinate ordering and delivery of signage for scheduled remodels, new store openings, and bedding or electronics campaigns.

o Brief in-store campaign POP assets, including signage placement and in-store video assets.

o Work with marketing to ensure all signage aligns with brand strategy and meets established standards.

o Maintain mattress gallery standards guide.

**Vendor & Store Coordination**

o Partner with construction team, merchants and vendors confirm timely shipment and arrival of marketing materials.

o Communicate with store teams to ensure proper POP placement and adherence to visual standards.

**Store Audits & Compliance**

o Conduct store audits to verify compliance with bedding and electronics visual standards.

o Provide detailed recaps and action plans for stores needing updates or corrections.

· Order Management

o Process bedding request forms submitted by stores for missing items required to meet standards.

o Place orders for additional signage or materials as needed to maintain compliance.

**Qualifications**

· Bachelor’s degree in Marketing, Business, Merchandising or related field (or equivalent experience).

· 3+ years of experience in retail marketing, visual merchandising, or related role.

· Strong organizational skills with the ability to manage multiple projects and deadlines.

· Excellent communication and vendor management skills.

· Proficiency in Microsoft Office Suite; experience with project management tools a plus.

· Ability to travel for store audits and openings 50% of the time.

**Key Competencies**

· Detail-oriented and highly organized.

· Strong problem-solving and follow-through skills.

· Collaborative team player with ability to work cross-functionally.

· Comfortable working in a fast-paced, deadline-driven environment.

**Our Core Values**

* Honesty & Integrity
* Passion, Drive, Discipline
* Continuous Improvement/Operational Excellence

jobs.description:
The Marketing Coordinator works directly with marketing management to drive brand awareness and intent to visit Ashley HomeStores. The Marketing Coordinator is responsible for providing **Storis** operational support and general assistance to the marketing department in the day-to-day management of marketing initiatives. This position works closely with internal stakeholders across multiple disciplines and outside agencies to ensure communications and promotions are aligned with marketing objectives. The Marketing Coordinator is accountable for the continued growth of awareness, engagement and visitation by implementing strategies of marketing initiatives.

**Primary Job Functions:**

1. Storis expert for the marketing team that serves as liaison for all departments.

2. Facilitate the creative process, including submitting work requests, reviewing changes and routing for

approval.

3. Work closely with various departments to ensure marketing campaigns are deployed as planned.

4. Provide project management for all assigned projects, ensuring deadlines are met and projects progress

in a timely fashion.

5. Pull campaign results, update reporting and assist with campaign analysis.

6. Contribute to brainstorming, consistently monitoring competitive landscape and marketing trends in

order to make effective recommendations.

7. Communicate effectively with other members of the marketing team to meet department goals.

8. Establish and maintain effective communication and working relations with internal and external

partners in order to secure and maintain their cooperation for assistance with special events and

promotional programs.

9. Coordinate the creation and printing of all internal marketing material requests.

10. Provide administrative support for the marketing department; schedule meetings, order and maintain

office supplies, coordinate events, book travel, submit expense reports, etc.

11. Demonstrate the Company’s Core and Growth Values in the performance of all job functions

**Secondary Job Functions:**

1. May be responsible for store assistance and support when necessary for events such as grand openings or other special events.

2. Maintain reliable attendance.

3. Actively participate in departmental meetings, training and education. Assist with training other employees and providing backup.

4. Complete other assignments and special projects as requested.

**Education:**

Bachelor degree in Marketing, Communications, Advertising or related field, or equivalent work experience, Required

**Experience:**

1 year experience in Marketing, Required

**Knowledge, Skills, Abilities:**

• Storis

• Knowledge of standard concepts, practice and procedures associated with

online and offline marketing efforts

• Knowledge of branding, marketing and advertising principles

• Flawless execution and excellent attention to detail

• Project management and presentation skills

• Effectively work in a cross-functional team environment

• Excellent verbal and written communication skills

• Excellent interpersonal skills

• Effective time management and organizational skills

• Work independently as well as in a team environment

• Document management system

• Analytical and problem solving skills

• Maintain confidentiality

• Working knowledge of Continuous Improvement

• Handle multiple projects simultaneously within established time constraints

• Proficient computer skills, including experience with Microsoft Office Suite, internet

• Strong skills in agility, along with the ability to pivot easily when directions and

priorities changes on short notice

• Perform under strong demands in a fast-paced environment

• Work professionally with customers and co-workers to efficiently serve our

customers, treating both with enthusiasm and respect

• Display empathy, understanding and patience with employees and external customers

• Respond professionally in situations with difficult employee/vendor/customer issues or inquiries

**Schedule Expectations:**

1. Occasional Domestic Travel

2. Flexible and willing to work extended hours when necessary.

**Job Competencies:**

1. Ethics and values

2. Integrity and trust

jobs.description: For over 75 years, Ashley Furniture has been the largest home furnishings manufacturer, transforming homes worldwide. With our customer base continuously growing, we are expanding our reach by opening more stores to meet the increasing demand. Our dedication to quality, style, and affordability has solidified our reputation as a trusted and recognized brand worldwide.Purpose at AshleyThe Sales Manager holds primary responsibility for managing and driving sales and margin within the retail store, aligning with the financial plan by overseeing a sales team. In addition to driving sales, the Sales Manager supports the Store Manager in fostering a high-performing sales culture, strategically managing talent, and recruiting and developing sales staff while embodying Ashley’s Culture and Vision to enhance brand perception and become the go-to destination for home furnishing needs. Serving as a role model for guest relationship-building, the Sales Manager leads and develops retail sales associates in executing the Company’s sales approach, manages store operations such as opening and closing procedures, and ensures compliance with policies and procedures to deliver an exceptional in-store experience. Without the Store Manager, the Sales Manager may assume full leadership responsibilities for the store.What You’ll DoRecruit, onboard, train, and motivate sales associates while fostering a positive work environment conducive to high performance and low turnover.Conduct performance reviews, offer ongoing coaching, and facilitate strategic engagement activities such as huddles to align store decisions with company strategy.Lead store sales associates to meet sales and profit goals while fostering a high-performing sales culture aligned with company strategy.Facilitate promotional events improvement and enhance the overall customer experience.Serve as a role model of Ashley's culture and vision, embodying the company's values and principles in all interactions.Manage customer jobs.job_title: Senior Director of Merchandising - Rugs, Lighting, Art, Accessories, Textiles
jobs.description: Senior Director of Merchandising - Rugs, Lighting, Art, Accessories, TextilesWhat Will You Do?The Senior Director, Merchandising is responsible and accountable for establishing and driving execution of business priorities through the facilitation of product development inclusive of the collection, coordination, collation, management, and the utilization of a category product development input process for multiple product categories for the company.Key Responsibilities:Strategic LeadershipThis position will work with Merchandising leadership to formulate and guide the category development strategy for assigned product categories.Additionally, the Senior Director, Merchandising is responsible for working with a variety of internal and external teams and senior executives utilizing a data input-based process in developing the category product development strategy.The role of the Senior Director, Merchandising is to drive Ashley to meet its strategic goals to ensure Ashley continues to grow and thrive.Directly lead and inspire a team of Category Merchants, coordinating and managing the work of employees by directing members of the team to meet the area’s goals. review and evaluate product mix and gain insight regarding quality or other issues and translate those findings into executable plans.Provide product development recommendations to the in-house design team; jobs.description:
BASIC FUNCTION

The Sales Associate has the primary responsibility to maximize sales volume by growing existing business, developing new business, and providing the best possible customer service while enhancing Baker’s mission to offer the highest quality and service standards in the industry.

SPECIFIC RESPONSIBILITIES: Customer Communication

• Greet customers in a friendly, professional manner and in a timely fashion (5 minutes or less).

• Assist all customers as called in rotation.

• Create and maintain quotations for customers who come into the Showroom or who call for information.

• Follow up on all quotations within one week and on a weekly basis.

• Inform customers of price increases two weeks prior to the increase occurring.

• Inform customers of discontinued product, extended lead times, etc.

• Provide customers with product information.

• Follow up with a thank you note or phone call to all new customers who come into the Showroom.

• Assist the designer’s client when the designer is unavailable.

• Assist end users when available or when requested by the manager.

• Always maintain professional courtesy with associates and customers.

• Consistently practice proper telephone etiquette.

• Return phone calls within 24 hours.

• Communicate with Showroom receptionist as to whereabouts if absent from Showroom. Order Entry

• Enter all orders into the system within 24 hours of receipt of the deposit or the purchase order (for net 30 accounts). Include all necessary information on the purchase order (i.e., customer information, delivery information, product options, pricing, etc.)

• Provide an adequate explanation to the customer for all denials of special requests on product and/or delivery dates. Customer Service

• Review the purchase order once it is generated and confirm its receipt by the factory. Return checked purchase orders to the Customer Service Associate within 24 hours.

• Check factory acknowledgments and verify that the product has been ordered correctly. Report to the Customer Service Associate any incorrect acknowledgment with corrections in writing.

• Track receipt by factory of COM (customer’s own material) fabric, finish samples or any other materials required for completion of order.

• Review the Open Order Report and address any problems.

• Send thank you cards to customers after placing an order.

• Call customers periodically with updated information regarding status of the order.

• Once the product is shipped, contact customers to ensure the product and the service are acceptable.

• Partnering with Regional Account Coordinator, alert customers when product arrives at the distribution center that a remaining balance invoice will be sent. Inform customers that their payment may be sent prior to

2

receiving the invoice for more timely receipt of product. Apprise Net 30 customers when product arrives at distribution center and notify that shipment to the local receiver will occur shortly.

• Assist Regional Account Coordinator in handling customer claims; monitor progress of customer complaint resolutions and communicate updates to customers. Customer Development and Maintenance

• Provide personal accounts with information regarding current and upcoming Showroom events and sales.

• Provide customers with materials and catalogues for their libraries.

• Participate in design-oriented events to ensure visibility and contact with current and potential customers.

• Maintain updated customer information including contact data, special interests, etc.

• Maintain updated calendar of customer special dates (events, installations, publications, etc.).

• Identify and implement ways to prospect new customers and increase conversion of turns to personal accounts. Showroom Responsibilities

• Assist in the display maintenance of the showroom to ensure optimum showroom appearance.

• Assist other Sales Associates as necessary or as directed by the Showroom Manager.

• Assist in the maintenance of samples, tear sheets and resource files.

• Assist in product training and mentoring of new Sales Associates.

• Ensure catalogs and price lists are up to date.

• Product Knowledge

• Maintain knowledge of all vendor products, pricing, options, finishes, details, etc.

• Maintain thorough, up-to-date knowledge of all products, pricing, and local competition.

EDUCATIONAL AND EXPERIENCE REQUIREMENTS:

Bachelor's Degree Preferred. Candidate will possess previous 3-5 years of high-end sales/customer experience, preferably in the furniture/design industry. Basic knowledge of the history of furniture design (periods, styles, designers, etc.) is preferred.

Baker is an equal opportunity employer.

conversion_revenue.insight: Le consultant est responsable de dépasser les objectifs de vente mensuels et annuels.
conversion_revenue.evidence: Meet or exceed monthly and annual sales targets by pursuing referrals and repeat business.
conversion_revenue.relevance: L'amélioration de la conversion et des ventes est directement liée à l'utilisation d'images de haute qualité, ce qui est un avantage de presti.

brand_consistency.insight: Le rôle est critique pour l'expérience de la marque California Closets.
brand_consistency.evidence: The Sales and Design Consultant role is critical to the California Closets Design Brand experience.
brand_consistency.relevance: La cohérence de la marque est essentielle pour maintenir une image de marque forte, ce qui est soutenu par des visuels de qualité.

creative_direction.insight: Le consultant doit écouter les besoins des clients et collaborer sur chaque détail.
creative_direction.evidence: By listening to a customer's needs and collaborating on every detail.
creative_direction.relevance: Cela montre l'importance de la direction créative dans la conception de solutions personnalisées.

photography_staging.insight: Le consultant utilise un logiciel de conception pour créer des solutions de rangement personnalisées.
photography_staging.evidence: design custom storage solutions utilizing our proprietary CAD software program.
photography_staging.relevance: L'utilisation d'outils de conception est essentielle pour créer des visuels attractifs et réalistes.

design_tools.evidence: design custom storage solutions utilizing our proprietary CAD software program.

status_quo.evidence: delivering highly personalized, whole-home design solutions and exceptional service.

analysis.sales_recommendation: Il est recommandé de cibler les entreprises de design d'intérieur et de décoration qui cherchent à améliorer leur présentation de produits. Mettre en avant la capacité de presti à générer des images de haute qualité et à respecter l'identité de marque pourrait être un argument de vente clé.

jobs.description:
**The Opportunity**Our retail expansion in the primary markets starts with hiring the best leaders. As a Sales/Operations Manager, you will focus on operational activities to grow the business. You will promote the Ballard Designs brand at every guest encounter and ensure your stellar team exemplifies brand values, standards, and experience. The dynamic energy from your leadership will increase company programs, increase sales, and set your store to exceed all expectations.  
  
You will report to the store leader.  
  
Your hiring location is **Tampa, Florida****Who We Are**Since 1982, Ballard Designs has offered a unique curation of home furnishings and décor from all periods and provenance. Its designers travel the world for inspiration, translating the latest fashion, color, and style trends into finely crafted products not found anywhere else. Ballard Designs is part of the Cornerstone brands - four interactive, aspirational home and apparel lifestyle brands that deliver inspirations that help customers enjoy, enhance, and celebrate life.  
  
**Your Impact**

* Perform a variety of operational activities, including scheduling, inventory management, backroom organization & store maintenance
* Experience with 'Division of Responsibility' understanding, competent in merchandise flow processes, including inspecting and receiving new merchandise and entering data into the inventory management system
* Manage the performance of the associates and provide feedback.
* Assure all back areas meet company standards of cleanliness and a safe work environment

**What You Bring**

* 3+ years of shipping and receiving management experience in the specialty retail industry
* Proficiency using Microsoft Word, Excel (can maintain complex spreadsheets), Outlook, Workday, Kronos, and POS Systems
* Lift and mobilize medium to large items, up to 50lbs
* Availability to work flexible schedule, including evenings, weekends, and holidays

Remote work is not permitted in NYC currently.  
  
#Onsite  
  
Our Total Rewards package includes benefits you’ll love such as competitive compensation, paid time off, an employee assistance program, parental leave, paid volunteer hours, and amazing company discounts! In our US market, you can also expect health care benefits starting on day 1, 401(k), and tuition reimbursement benefits. QVC Group is committed to inclusion and belonging for all and ensuring that our workplace provides equal employment opportunities for all team members and candidates and complies with all applicable federal, state, and local laws and regulations. As an equal opportunity employer, QVC Group is committed to a barrier-free employment process. If you need reasonable accommodations/support throughout, please contact us at workwithus@qvcgrp.com for assistance. If provided, salary ranges are a general guideline only, and actual salaries will vary and are based on factors such as a candidate's qualifications, skills, experience, and geographic location as well as business and market conditions.

jobs.job_title: Retail Sales Associate - Balsam Hill Studio
jobs.description:
**Job Description**We are seeking an enthusiastic and driven individual to assist the management team in our Balsam Hill Studio retail store at Whalers Village in Lahaina, HI. In the full-time Sales Associate role, you will have the opportunity to help ensure that our customers experience the magic of Balsam Hill in an inspired holiday setting.  
  
The Sales Associate will support the store management team by fostering a positive work environment that ensures customer satisfaction, boosts productivity, and drives sales. From enhancing the customer shopping experience to assisting with store opening and closing, the Sales Associate is vital to the success of Balsam Hill Studio. We are particularly excited about candidates with a proven history of retail success and creating customer-centric shopping experiences!  
  
**What You’ll Do**

* Assist customers and provide top notch service to ensure all patrons leave satisfied
* Assist with merchandising, cleaning, and restocking
* Gather customer feedback
* Achieve sales targets by generating revenue through effective sales strategies
* Perform opening/closing routines as needed
* Demonstrate exemplary customer service and selling skills

**What You Bring To The Table**

* 2+ years of retail experience preferred
* Strong communication skills with customers and sales staff
* Demonstrated time management, organizational and multi-tasking skills
* Passion for exemplary service
* Great sales skills: retail sales experience a strong plus
* Proficiency with iPads, basic computer skills, and basic data entry (data entry very minimal overall)
* Flexibility: willingness to perform other various duties as required

**Physical Requirements**

* Must be able to work onsite for every shift
* May assemble and disassemble Christmas trees and other decorations
* May lift and or move items up to forty pounds

**Notes:**The Sales Associate role is a full-time in-person position, expected to work around 40 hours per week.  
  
**About Us:** Balsam Brands is a global, eCommerce retailer with roots in holiday and home décor. We strive for excellence in everything we do and present a unique opportunity for those seeking to have a meaningful impact in a people-first company that values relationship building, authenticity, and doing the right thing. We have steadily growing teams in Boise, the Bay Area, Dublin, and the Philippines.  
  
Balsam Hill Studio, an extension of our holiday brand Balsam Hill®, reimagines souvenir shopping, offering premium ornaments unique to each store's location. The Balsam Hill Studio retail store at Whalers Village in Lahaina, HI will feature unique, handcrafted ornaments specific to Hawaii. Presenting tourists with beautiful, curated options for mementos to remind them of their extraordinary adventures every holiday season for years to come.  
  
The company's mission is to create joy together. We empower our team and partners to love what they do, provide products and experiences that inspire meaningful moments with family and friends, and give back to our families and communities in impactful ways. When you join Balsam Brands, you'll find a culture of caring people doing challenging work and building a welcoming workplace.  
  

* Check out our flagship brand, Balsam Hill: www.balsamhill.com
* Balsam Brands in Forbes: https://bit.ly/balsambrandsforbes2023
* Balsam Brands on LinkedIn: http://www.linkedin.com/company/balsam-brands/
* Glassdoor: https://bit.ly/balsambrands-glassdoor

The pay rate for this position is: $19.50 per hour.  
  
*At Balsam Brands, we strive to build a diverse, equitable, and inclusive team to fulfill our purpose to create joy together. Balsam Brands is proud to be an equal opportunity employer. We encourage people from all backgrounds, ages, abilities, and experiences to apply. We do not discriminate on the basis of race, ethnicity, religion, national origin, citizenship, marital or family status, disability, sexual orientation, gender identity or expression, pregnancy or caregiver status, veteran status, or any other legally protected status. We will ensure that individuals with disabilities are provided reasonable accommodations to participate in the job application and interview process, to perform essential job functions, and to receive other benefits and privileges of employment.***Additional Information**All your information will be kept confidential according to EEO guidelines.

jobs.job_title: Interim Project Coordinator, Ecommerce & Strategic Projects
jobs.description:
**Job Description**

Balsam Hill is seeking a proactive and detail-oriented Interim Project Coordinator to support the execution of key ecommerce and strategic initiatives over a three-month period. This part-time, interim role is ideal for a flexible and organised professional who can manage multiple workstreams, coordinate stakeholders, and ensure timely delivery of project milestones across digital and business transformation projects.

This position reports to the General Manager and Business Lead, Europe. This is a part-time, hybrid in-office position located in our Dublin office, which will require you to work three days in-office (Monday, Tuesday, Wednesday).

To ensure sufficient overlap with functional and cross-functional team members globally, some flexibility with this role's regular work schedule will be required. Most of our teams have overlap with early morning and/or early evening PST. Specific scheduling needs for this role will be discussed in the initial interview.

**What you’ll do:**

* Coordinate and track progress across ecommerce and strategic project initiatives, ensuring alignment with timelines and deliverables.
* Support project leads by preparing updates, reports, and presentations for internal stakeholders and senior management.
* Manage meeting schedules, documentation, and follow-up actions.
* Liaise with cross-functional teams, including marketing, merchandising, operations, and IT, to ensure project milestones are achieved.
* Assist with timelines, communication, and implementation of new tools or workflows.
* Maintain project trackers, budgets, and performance dashboards.
* Provide administrative and analytical support to the Strategic Projects team as needed.

**What you bring to the table:**

* Well-suited for graduates or early-career professionals who have hands-on experience managing projects, supporting eCommerce operations, or coordinating cross-functional business initiatives.
* Excellent organisational skills with strong attention to detail and the ability to manage multiple priorities.
* Proficient in Excel, PowerPoint, and common project management tools (e.g., Slack, Asana, Jira).
* Strong communication and stakeholder management skills.
* Able to adapt quickly within a fast-paced, changing environment.
* Self-starter with the ability to work independently and manage workload effectively within part-time hours.
* Demonstrated AI literacy, enabling effective understanding, interaction, and critical evaluation of AI technologies and applications across diverse business functions

**Notes:** This is a temporary position, expected to last through end of January

**About Us:** Balsam Brands is a global, omnichannel retailer with roots in holiday and home décor. We strive for excellence in everything we do and present a unique opportunity for those seeking to have a meaningful impact in a people-first company that values relationship building, authenticity, and doing the right thing. We have steadily growing teams in Boise, the Bay Area, Dublin, the Philippines, Canada, and Mexico.

**The company's mission is to create joy together. We empower our team and partners to love what they do, provide products and experiences that inspire meaningful moments with family and friends, and give back to our families and communities in impactful ways. When you join Balsam Brands, you'll find a culture of caring people doing challenging work and building a welcoming workplace.**

* Check out our flagship brand, Balsam Hill: www.balsamhill.com
* Balsam Brands in Forbes: https://bit.ly/balsambrandsforbes2023
* Balsam Brands on LinkedIn: http://www.linkedin.com/company/balsam-brands/

*At Balsam Brands, we strive to build a diverse, equitable, and inclusive team to fulfill our purpose to create joy together. Balsam Brands is proud to be an equal opportunity employer. We encourage people from all backgrounds, ages, abilities, and experiences to apply. We do not discriminate on the basis of race, ethnicity, religion, national origin, citizenship, marital or family status, disability, sexual orientation, gender identity or expression, pregnancy or caregiver status, veteran status, or any other legally protected status. We will ensure that individuals with disabilities are provided reasonable accommodations to participate in the job application and interview process, to perform essential job functions, and to receive other benefits and privileges of employment.*

 **Additional Information**

All your information will be kept confidential according to EEO guidelines.

jobs.description:
**Job Description**The Director of eCommerce (Temporary) will play a significant role in building a best‐in‐class global eCommerce website and creating a superior home décor shopping experience. This role will be accountable for driving and monitoring our webstore performance via effective merchandising, A/B testing, personalization, and optimization projects. This person will be a key stakeholder in the creation of the eCommerce roadmap and a key contributor to our company roadmap and annual priorities.  
  
The Director of eCommerce (Temporary) will work closely with Product Management, UI/UX, Marketing, and Creative teams to build a conversion‐driven website design that supports the brand vision and seasonal campaigns and proves our brand value to our shoppers. This person will also work closely with Product Management and Technology teams to identify technology, processes, eCommerce software, and feature improvements that contribute to the overall growth and profitability of the business**.**This position reports to the VP of eCommerce and is based in our Redwood City office location. This role is expected to work in a hybrid model, which currently includes Monday, Tuesday, and Wednesday in-office.  
  
**What You’ll Do**

* Guide and support a global team of eCommerce Merchandisers to deliver best in class shopping experiences on our international sites
* Oversee development of eCommerce site strategies including navigation, landing experiences, site search, and other tactical plans that will help meet and exceed conversion, revenue and profitability goals
* Participate in evaluating tool and systems opportunities that drive eCommerce features and efficiencies, including use of technology to deliver a best‐in‐class personalized merchandising experience
* Oversee eCommerce day‐to‐day responsibilities, including:
* Drive improvement for key page/category metrics (conversion, bounce, exit, revenue, engagement, etc.) through the optimization of online merchandising that enhances overall customer experience
* Drive innovation and optimization through testing and application of eCommerce best practices
* Monitor, meet, and report on eCommerce KPI's (conversion, bounce/exit, cart abandon, RPV, brand/category revenue, etc.) across devices, pages, and customer segments, and be able to explain the business drivers behind fluctuations in these metrics
* Collaborate with the Marketing, SEO, Merchants, Pricing, and Planning teams to define business goals for our brands to align on strategies that drive growth
* Partner with Creative by contributing to creative briefs, reviewing creative concepts against business goals, and identifying asset requirements
* Partner with Merchandising (physical product) to ensure that product goals and benefits are being translated onto our site in a way that is consistent with their strategies
* Partner with Product Management and Technology teams to ensure technical support for the execution of eCommerce projects and website operations
* Provide input for prioritization of eCommerce projects, bug fixes, and maintenance tasks that go to Website Operations, Creative, and/or Technology teams

**What You Bring To The Table**

* 14+ years of experience in eCommerce/Retail
* Exceptional analytical skills required
* Prior experience managing teams required; remote management preferred
* Ability to influence across functions and communicate across levels
* Prior experience in leading cross functional projects
* Experience in working with Creative, Product Management and/or Technology teams
* Bachelor’s Degree in Merchandising, Economics, General Business Management or equivalent

**Notes:** This is a temporary position, expected to work 40 hours per week and last through January 2026.  
  
**About Us:** Balsam Brands is a global, omnichannel retailer with roots in holiday and home décor. We strive for excellence in everything we do and present a unique opportunity for those seeking to have a meaningful impact in a people-first company that values relationship building, authenticity, and doing the right thing. We have steadily growing teams in Boise, the Bay Area, Dublin, the Philippines, Canada, and Mexico.  
  
The company's mission is to create joy together. We empower our team and partners to love what they do, provide products and experiences that inspire meaningful moments with family and friends, and give back to our families and communities in impactful ways. When you join Balsam Brands, you'll find a culture of caring people doing challenging work and building a welcoming workplace.  
  

* Check out our flagship brand, Balsam Hill: www.balsamhill.com
* Balsam Brands in Forbes: https://bit.ly/balsambrandsforbes2023
* Balsam Brands on LinkedIn: http://www.linkedin.com/company/balsam-brands/
* Glassdoor: https://bit.ly/balsambrands-glassdoor

**Benefits**At Balsam Brands, we strive to offer a competitive compensation and benefits package. For permanent, full-time team members, our current package includes:  
  

* Competitive compensation, including a cash-based incentive plan; salary is reviewed yearly and may be adjusted as part of the normal compensation review process
* Comprehensive Medical, Dental, and Vision coverage, with 100% of monthly premiums covered for team members, and 85%+ employer-paid premiums for other coverage tiers that include dependents
* Up to $2,000 annual funding toward HSA accounts
* Medical, transit, dependent care FSA

jobs.description: Job DescriptionWe are looking for a customer-obsessed Marketing Product Manager to lead the strategy, development, and optimization of our marketing technology stack. jobs.description: Job DescriptionThe Email Marketing Specialist will be responsible for designing, coding and testing emails that nurture customer relationships throughout their journey with our brand Balsam Hill US. This includes building campaigns and multi-touch flows with proper logic, flawless rendering, and advanced personalization based on user behavior and lifecycle stage.This position reports to the CRM Marketing Manager and is based in our Redwood City office location. jobs.description: Job DescriptionWe are seeking an enthusiastic and driven individual to assist the management team in our Balsam Hill Studio retail store at Whalers Village in Lahaina, HI. In the full-time Sales Associate role, you will have the opportunity to help ensure that our customers experience the magic of Balsam Hill in an inspired holiday setting.The Sales Associate will support the store management team by fostering a positive work environment that ensures customer satisfaction, boosts productivity, and drives sales. jobs.job_title: Account Executive, B2B Sales - Design Industry
jobs.description: Job DescriptionAs Account Executive, B2B Sales, will drive new business growth for Balsam Hill by selling premium holiday décor packages to interior designers, event planners, and other design professionals who craft seasonal experiences for their clients. This is a hunter role, ideal for a self-starter with deep connections in the design world, who thrives without a set playbook and is passionate about premium product storytelling.This is a relationship-driven sales role focused on building trust, understanding client needs, and delivering tailored solutions aligned with the brand objectives. The Account Executive will play a hand in evolving the product assortment by sharing client feedback and work closely with the Customer Success team to ensure a seamless customer experience.As a brand ambassador for Balsam Hill, the Account Executive will lead engagement with key design industry associations to enhance the company’s presence and position Balsam Hill as the preferred partner for design professionals. Additionally, the Account Executive will play an integral role in establishing a nationwide network of designers and decorators who may be contracted to support holiday installations.This full-time position reports to the Director of Customer Engagement, B2B and can work remote from any U.S. state where Balsam Brands is currently setup as an employer, which includes Arizona, California, Illinois and Texas. This role can also work locally in our Redwood City, CA location. Our local teams work in a hybrid model, which currently includes Monday, Tuesday and Wednesday in-office.To ensure sufficient overlap with functional and cross-functional team members globally, some flexibility with this role's regular work schedule will be required. Most of our teams have overlap with early morning and/or early evening PST. Specific scheduling needs for this role will be discussed in the initial interview.What you’ll do:New Business Acquisition:Own the full sales cycle from prospecting through close, selling to interior designers, event planners, and similar professionals, and independently managing a national territoryDesigner Network Development(Secondary Focus): Identify, recruit, and build relationships with a network of designers and decorators across the country who can support holiday installations for high-end clientsEvent & Industry Representation: Represent Balsam Hill at industry events, trade shows, and conferences (e.g., ASID Gather), enhancing brand visibility and building strong industry partnershipsABM and Prospecting: Work in partnership with the marketing team to leverage ABM strategy, buyer intent tools, and social media to engage high-potential clientsSales Collateral:Collaborate with internal teams to develop persuasive sales tools and presentations tailored to design industry prospectCRM and Technology: Use HubSpot for pipeline management, ZoomInfo for lead insights, and LinkedIn Sales Navigator for social sellingPerformance Tracking and Reporting: Track KPIs and sales performance, adjusting strategies to stay aligned with business growth goalsWhat you bring to the table:5+ years in B2B sales with experience in the Interior Design, Event Planning, or adjacent design industriesBachelor’s degree in Business, Marketing, or a related design fieldDemonstrated success in new business acquisition and territory development, preferably in design-related B2B salesAn eye for design and a genuine passion for aesthetics, with the ability to connect with creative professionals and speak their languageHighly motivated self-starter who thrives in ambiguity and knows how to build from scratchProficient with HubSpot, LinkedIn Sales Navigator, and other sales tools; understands how to use social media for prospecting and brand buildingAble to craft compelling presentations and messages that inspire designers and align with their aesthetic valuesWillingness to travel up to 30–40% for client meetings, trade shows, and eventsTravel for remote team members: At Balsam Brands, we believe that time spent together, in-person, collaborating and building relationships is important to who we are. For our newest remote Brandits, we will arrange travel to one of our local offices within your first three months of employment so you can meet and train with your new team in-person. You may also get to travel an additional 1 – 2 times a year for events such as team retreats, offsites, or learning and development opportunities.Notes:This is a full-time, permanent position with benefits. Please only apply if you are able to live and work full-time in one of the states listed in this posting. State locations and specifics are subject to change as our hiring requirements shift.About Us:Balsam Brands is a global, omnichannel retailer with roots in holiday and home décor. We strive for excellence in everything we do and present a unique opportunity for those seeking to have a meaningful impact in a people-first company that values relationship building, authenticity, and doing the right thing. We empower our team and partners to love what they do, provide products and experiences that inspire meaningful moments with family and friends, and give back to our families and communities in impactful ways. jobs.description: Job DescriptionWe are looking for an innovative and strategic leader with a passion for visual storytelling and a strong understanding of home décor trends to help us fulfill our mission of creating joy together. The Senior Manager of Creative Content will be creative, detail-oriented, and will collaborate closely with creative leads and cross-functional partners to create high-quality visual content that evolves our brand story and drives engagement with our target audience.This role offers a unique opportunity to contribute to the elevation of the visual identity of our home décor retail brand through creative leadership, strategic planning, and high-quality content production. This role requires experience in photography and videography for both print and digital channels, as well as knowledge of photo and video editing, production, styling, and branding. Key areas of responsibilities include the development of creative concepts and the ability to bring these ideas to life in photo, video, and memorable customer experiences.This full-time position is a part of the Creative Team reporting to the VP, Creative Director and supports the Balsam Hill global brand. It is hands-on with leadership responsibilities including mentoring and directing studio managers, producers, photographers, videographers and editors, both for internal and external teams. This role is a brand ambassador and effectively collaborates with other Creative team leaders, merchants, marketing, vendors, and external production teams.This role is expected to work in a hybrid model, which currently includes Monday, Tuesday, and Wednesday in our Redwood City or Burlingame offices as well as additional time on location for shoots throughout the year.What You’ll DoCreative Leadership and Content Development:Collaborate with creative leads to develop and maintain a clear and compelling creative vision for the photo and video content produced by the studioIntroduce holistic storytelling strategies that support business initiatives across multiple mediums including print and digitalPartner with marketing and eCommerce teams to develop comprehensive content strategies that support product launches, promotions, campaigns and brand storytellingIntroduce new concepts and ideas through swipes and storyboard developmentBring creative vision to life by overseeing creative development of media productions from concept through executionWork with external talent to develop photo and video style guidesStay updated on current home décor trends, photography techniques and video production styles to ensure the studio’s work is fresh and relevantMaintain an intimate understanding of the customer and their journey throughout every touchpoint to create impact and build loyaltyWork closely with art directors, photographers, videographers and stylists to ensure work is high-quality, inspiring and on-brandIn partnership with our Global Brand Design team, brainstorm and contribute creative ideas for visual content that resonates with our target audience and drives engagementProduction ManagementCoordinate with Creative Operations Team to drive timelines and achieve milestonesCollaborate with Creative Operations to develop new best practices for post-production processes and workflowsOptimize budget to ensure efficiency and efficacy of all work produced and be accountable for budget reporting to Creative Ops teamPartner with producers to oversee high level scheduling and freelance hiresDevelop vision for building a best-in-class media studio and partner with Studio Manager to build out a roadmap for executing upgradesEnsure that team is delivering on postproduction needs that align with brand standards and advise on asset management and workflowsNegotiate contracts and manage relationships with external vendors and freelancersManage and track asset usage rights, including negotiating permissions, monitoring expiration dates, and educating teams on compliance requirements to ensure legal and proper use of all assetsTeam LeadershipLead, mentor and inspire a team that includes producers, studio management and post-production artistsDisplay leadership and inspire teams to develop compelling and meaningful work by fostering creative exploration, collaboration and innovationGuide direct reports and functional team members by identifying opportunities for growth, leveraging team strengths, and developing members toward organizational effectiveness.QualificationsWhat you bring to the table:Knowledge and experience with both the technical and creative side of media productionBachelor’s degree in Design or equivalent work experience10+ years of experience with consumer brands, campaigns, and photo productionProficient in Adobe Creative Suite (InDesign, Illustrator, Photoshop)Online portfolio displaying exceptional strategic, conceptual, and visual designDeep knowledge of media production and best practicesAbility to respond and give productive feedbackFlexible and adapts to the changing needs of the businessSupport process, proactively identifying challenges and fostering actionable solutionsExcellence in a deadline-driven environment with the ability to manage multiple prioritiesHighly self-motivated, with excellent communication skills, conflict resolution, and negotiation skillsFamiliarity with Ecommerce and digital marketing trendsAbout Us:Balsam Brands is a global, eCommerce retailer with roots in holiday and home décor. We strive for excellence in everything we do and present a unique opportunity for those seeking to have a meaningful impact in a people-first company that values relationship building, authenticity, and doing the right thing. We have steadily growing teams in Boise, the Bay Area, Dublin, and the Philippines.The company's mission is to create joy together. We empower our team and partners to love what they do, provide products and experiences that inspire meaningful moments with family and friends, and give back to our families and communities in impactful ways. When you join Balsam Brands, you'll find a culture of caring people doing challenging work and building a welcoming workplace.Check out our flagship brand, Balsam Hill: www.balsamhill.comBalsam Brands in Forbes: https://bit.ly/balsambrandsforbes2023Balsam Brands on LinkedIn: http://www.linkedin.com/company/balsam-brands/Glassdoor: https://bit.ly/balsambrands-glassdoorBenefitsAt Balsam Brands, we strive to offer a competitive compensation and benefits package. For permanent, full-time team members, our current package includes:Competitive compensation, including a cash-based incentive plan; salary is reviewed yearly and may be adjusted as part of the normal compensation review processComprehensive Medical, Dental, and Vision coverage, with 100% of monthly premiums covered for team members, and 85%+ employer-paid premiums for other coverage tiers that include dependentsUp to $2,000 annual funding toward HSA accountsMedical, transit, dependent care FSAInfertility coverage offered on all medical plansGenerous parental leave program and flexible return optionsCompany-paid life and AD&D insuranceCompany-paid short and long-term disability insurance401(k) with dollar-for-dollar company match up to $4,000 per calendar yearEmployee Assistance Program (EAP) and other mental health and wellness perksPaid holidays, annual shutdown week, PTO, and volunteer time-off (VTO) packagesPaid 5-week sabbatical leave after 10 years of employmentAnnual continuous learning benefit up to $1,000 per person, per fiscal yearUp to $300 flexible reimbursement to support setup of new team member's work-from-home environmentGenerous team member merchandise discountValuable extras: identity theft protection, subsidized parking, monthly wellness, pet insurance, accident & critical illness insuranceThe base pay range for this position is: $152,000 to $183,000. Where an individual falls within that range will vary based on several factors including geographic location and may vary depending on candidate qualifications and experience, applicable skills, and other job-related factors. We benchmark our pay ranges against current external data sources and regularly review compensation for our team members. Balsam Brands is committed to providing our team members with an internally fair, externally competitive, and fiscally prudent total compensation package administered in a simple and consistent manner.At Balsam Brands, we strive to build a diverse, equitable, and inclusive team to fulfill our purpose to create joy together. jobs.job_title: Senior Manager, Wholesale & B2B Sales Strategy
jobs.description: Job DescriptionAs Senior Manager, Wholesale & B2B Sales Strategy you will lead impactful projects for our fast-growing International business, working closely with senior leaders and cross-functional teams to expand our B2B and wholesale footprint through strategic partnerships and targeted growth initiatives. Success in this role requires a knack for breaking down big problems into key questions, a strong passion for taking initiative, learning, and driving recommendations to completion. You’ll thrive as a self-starter who pays close attention to detail while managing multiple projects, adapts to ambiguity and evolving priorities, and learns quickly. With a flexible work style, you’ll collaborate across functions and geographies, ready to jump in and help—even in roles outside your expertise—to drive the planning and implementation of key growth projects in a dynamic, creative, and inspiring work environment.This full-time position reports to the VP of International and is located in Dublin, Ireland. This role is expected to work in a hybrid model, which includes three days in-office.To ensure sufficient overlap with functional and cross-functional team members globally, some flexibility with this role's regular work schedule will be required. Most of our teams have overlap with early morning and/or early evening PST. Specific scheduling needs for this role will be discussed in the initial interview.What You’ll DoStrategy Development and Business Growth:Develop and execute a comprehensive, long-term strategy for B2B and wholesale partnerships across international marketsIdentify, evaluate, and pursue strategic partnership opportunities, negotiating complex deals that align with company objectives and profitability goalsConduct thorough market analysis, staying on top of industry trends and competitive landscapes to inform strategic decision-makingCreate and implement go-to-market strategies for new international B2B and wholesale initiativesFinancial Management And Performance OptimizationDevelop financial models and business cases for new initiatives, forecasting revenue and profitability for international B2B and wholesale channelsEstablish KPIs and metrics to measure success, analyzing performance data to identify trends and areas for improvementWork with operations teams to ensure efficient execution and continuous improvement of international B2B and wholesale programsCross-functional Leadership And CollaborationGuide cross functional team members by identifying opportunities for growth, leveraging team strengths, and developing members toward organizational effectivenessCollaborate with senior leadership to align international B2B and wholesale strategies with overall company goalsDevelop and maintain relationships with key decision-makers in target companies and marketsProvide regular updates and insights to senior management on the progress and performance of international B2B and wholesale initiativesQualificationsBachelor's degree required; MBA or other relevant advanced degree preferred10+ years of experience in business development, strategy, or related fields, with a focus on B2B and wholesale channelsStrong understanding of international markets, particularly in EuropeRetail experience in a relevant industry requiredProven track record of developing and executing successful international growth strategiesAdvanced financial acumen, including:Ability to create and interpret complex financial modelsProficiency in financial analysis and forecasting for B2B and wholesale channelsExperience in budgeting and financial planning for international business operationsOutstanding analytical and problem-solving skills, with the ability to translate data insights into actionable strategiesStrong familiarity with data analysis tools and CRM systems, including the ability to write clear, detailed requirements for technical teamsExceptional communication and presentation skills, with the ability to influence senior stakeholdersExperience leading and mentoring teams in a fast-paced, dynamic environmentFluency in English required; additional language skills are a plusAbout Us: Balsam Brands is a global, omnichannel retailer with roots in holiday and home décor. We strive for excellence in everything we do and present a unique opportunity for those seeking to have a meaningful impact in a people-first company that values relationship building, authenticity, and doing the right thing. We have steadily growing teams in Boise, the Bay Area, Dublin, the Philippines, Canada, and Mexico.The company's mission is to create joy together. We empower our team and partners to love what they do, provide products and experiences that inspire meaningful moments with family and friends, and give back to our families and communities in impactful ways. When you join Balsam Brands, you'll find a culture of caring people doing challenging work and building a welcoming workplace.Check out our flagship brand, Balsam Hill: www.balsamhill.comBalsam Brands in Forbes: https://bit.ly/balsambrandsforbes2023Balsam Brands on LinkedIn: http://www.linkedin.com/company/balsam-brands/At Balsam Brands, we strive to offer a competitive compensation and benefits package.
