jobs.description: Job DescriptionAs the B2B eCommerce Site Merchandising Manager, you will be pivotal in launching and the ongoing optimization of our Shopify website. You will develop and execute the content strategy to create a seamless and engaging shopping experience that drives customer engagement and conversions. You will ensure a customer-first site experience while aligning with overall site management and operational goals.This full-time position reports to the VP of Digital Experience and is expected to work in a hybrid model, which currently includes Monday, Tuesday, and Wednesday in-office.What you’ll do:Develop and execute a site content strategy focused on enhancing the overall eCommerce experience for our B2B customers. Manage the content that displays to customers on the homepage and landing pages across desktop and mobile web, including owning the cross functional process of requesting content based on the site refresh calendar and uploading all content in the content management systemCollaborate with VP Digital Experience and B2B Business Manager to build content strategy, ensuring content is both engaging and aligned with customer expectationsMonitor customer behavior and identify opportunities to improve the user journey, enhancing overall site experienceCommunicate Creative briefs and partner with Creative team to ensure an engaging and brand enhancing shopping experience. Enhance customer journey with compelling descriptions, high-quality images, and relevant keywords to improve visibility and engagementDevelop and maintain a clear and intuitive product categorization and navigation structurePartner with SEO team to implement SEO best practices to increase organic search visibility and drive quality trafficUse analytics tools to track and analyze website performance, leveraging insights to continuously refine the CX. Make improvements to product sorts, search functionality, and merchandising tacticsProvide supervision to a small team, defining tasks aligned with common goals, and fosters the professional development of team members through active discussion, feedback, coaching, and mentorshipWhat you bring to the table:Bachelor’s degree in Marketing, Business, or a related field8+ years of work experience with at least 5+ years of experience in Shopify site management and content merchandising, with a focus on digital experienceB2B experience is highly preferredProven expertise in developing and executing site content strategies on Shopify that drives business outcomesStrong analytical skills and experience using customer insights and performance data to inform continuous site optimizationProficiency in SEO principles and the ability to optimize site contentStrong understanding of the 3 C’s (Customer, Company, Competitor) and 4 P’s (Product, Price, Place, Promotion) of MarketingDemonstrate self-motivation and take initiative to drive progress independentlyThrive in ambiguity by making thoughtful decisions with incomplete informationExcellent collaboration and communication skills, with the ability to work cross-functionally across levels of seniority to align content and customer experience goalsTravel 1-2x per year for conferences and off-sites as requiredAbout Us:Balsam Brands is a global, eCommerce retailer with roots in holiday and home décor. jobs.description: Job DescriptionBalsam Hill, a leader in premium artificial Christmas trees and holiday décor, is seeking an accomplished leader to drive our indirect channel efforts and accelerate omnichannel growth through strategic wholesale partnerships and marketplace expansion.Reporting to the Chief People & Growth Officer, the VP of Indirect Channel Sales will play a pivotal role in developing and executing comprehensive strategies to expand Balsam Hill's market presence through indirect channels. This role will drive strategic initiatives, manage complex relationships across multiple stakeholders, and ensure the successful execution of partnership-driven growth opportunities. While the primary focus will be on the U.S. business, successful candidates will provide mentorship and guidance to the international growth team, offering leadership and insight into international indirect channel growth.If you’re a visionary leader with a passion for omnichannel innovation and a track record of driving impactful results through indirect sales channels, we want to hear from you. This full-time position is expected to work in a hybrid model, which currently includes Tuesday and Wednesday in-office. Regular travel (~10-20%) to key retail partners and team locations will be required, primarily within the U.S.What you’ll do:Develop and execute comprehensive indirect channel strategies that align with Balsam Hill’s direct digital and in-store experience and support our omnichannel goalsLead and optimize Balsam Hill's indirect channel business, including:Strategic relationships with national retailersMarketplace partnerships and growthReverse logistics programsDrive analytical decision-making through:Demand planning and forecastingSupply chain optimizationSales performance analyticsChannel profitability analysisCollaborate cross-functionally with:Merchandising teams on product development and assortment strategyMarketing teams on channel-specific programs and brand positioningOperations teams on supply chain and reverse logisticsTechnology teams on e-commerce and system integrationsInternational business teams on strategies to accelerate indirect international channel growthLead strategic planning and execution for:Amazon business growth and optimizationNational account managementLead the team to achieve business outcomes by promoting collaboration and alignment with organizational values; translate company initiatives into a clear vision, aligning team actions with company priorities while fostering performance and professional developmentWhat you bring to the table:20+ years of progressive retail and account management experience; global experience strongly preferred10+ years of leadership experience with P&L responsibilityProven track record in omnichannel retail strategy and executionExtensive experience in:Strategic planning and executionChannel strategy developmentProduct marketing and developmentAmazon marketplace optimizationDemonstrated success in managing relationships with major retailers (Target, Costco, Sam’s Club, Lowes, Home Depot, Amazon, Walmart, etc.)Strong background in both traditional retail and eCommerceExperience in multi-channel sales team leadership (direct and indirect); proven ability to recruit and develop high-performing teamsTrack record of successful cross-functional leadership, relationship building, and stakeholder managementLeadership competencies:Strong analytical and data-driven decision-makingExecutive presence and communication skillsChange management and organizational development expertiseNote:the responsibilities and scope of this role are subject to change as business needs evolve.About Us:Balsam Brands is a global, eCommerce retailer with roots in holiday and home décor. We strive for excellence in everything we do and present a unique opportunity for those seeking to have a meaningful impact in a people-first company that values relationship building, authenticity, and doing the right thing. We have steadily growing teams in Boise, the Bay Area, Dublin, and the Philippines.The company's mission is to create joy together. We empower our team and partners to love what they do, provide products and experiences that inspire meaningful moments with family and friends, and give back to our families and communities in impactful ways. When you join Balsam Brands, you'll find a culture of caring people doing challenging work and building a welcoming workplace.Check out our flagship brand, Balsam Hill: www.balsamhill.comBalsam Brands in Forbes: https://bit.ly/balsambrandsforbes2023Balsam Brands on LinkedIn: http://www.linkedin.com/company/balsam-brands/Glassdoor: https://bit.ly/balsambrands-glassdoorAt Balsam Brands, we strive to offer a competitive compensation and benefits package. Where an individual falls within that range will vary based on several factors including geographic location and may vary depending on candidate qualifications and experience, applicable skills, and other job-related factors. We benchmark our pay ranges against current external data sources and regularly review compensation for our team members. Balsam Brands is committed to providing our team members with an internally fair, externally competitive, and fiscally prudent total compensation package administered in a simple and consistent manner.At Balsam Brands, we strive to build a diverse, equitable, and inclusive team to fulfill our purpose to create joy together. Balsam Brands is proud to be an equal opportunity employer. We encourage people from all backgrounds, ages, abilities, and experiences to apply. We do not discriminate on the basis of race, ethnicity, religion, national origin, citizenship, marital or family status, disability, sexual orientation, gender identity or expression, pregnancy or caregiver status, veteran status, or any other legally protected status. jobs.description:
Digital Marketing & Content Manager   
Position Overview   
The Digital Marketing & Content Manager will plan, assist with creation and oversee digital content to align with marketing goals. This role is responsible for analyzing performance of content/campaigns across social media channels. This includes maintaining content calendars and sharing information across internal and external teams. There will be a strong focus on preparing and leading the social media strategy to drive engagement and brand awareness. They will communicate events and assets to digital partners, licensed and open market partners.   
The manager will collaborate with the marketing team and other departments to develop online strategies that increase company brand awareness. They will make sure that all company communications have consistent messages across social and digital channels.   
They will help identify processes, techniques, and opportunities for improvement of communication of assets and events. This person will work closely with the marketing team, sales team, licensed and open market teams and outside agencies. They should be able to work collaboratively and effectively across the team while focusing on action and learning. They also will measure how effective communications strategies are and suggest improvements.   
Key Responsibilities

* Develop and lead a comprehensive content strategy that supports the business and marketing objectives
* Collaborate with copywriters, graphic designers and the marketing team to produce high-quality, on-brand content
* Create and manage content calendars, including scheduling and publishing organic posts
* Support content creation, including video/reels, interactive formats, and other digital assets
* Track, analyze, and report on content performance, providing insights and recommendations
* Manage influencer partnerships and evaluate ROI
* Stay current on industry trends, competitor activity, and consumer behavior

Skills & Competencies   

* Expertise in social media strategy, execution, and performance analysis
* Proficiency in content formats including video, reels, interactive forms/features, and GIFs
* Strong project management skills with ability to lead cross-functional collaboration
* Excellent communication and presentation skills
* High attention to detail, intellectual curiosity, and a self-motivated approach

Required Qualifications   

* Bachelor’s degree in marketing, business, communications, or related field
* 5-7 years of experience in digital marketing and social platform management
* Proven expertise with Meta, Pinterest, and TikTok, including content publishing and performance tracking
* Advanced skills in Microsoft Excel and PowerPoint
* Hybrid work arrangement: partial remote flexibility with required in-office days at corporate HQ in Bassett, VA

IND1 #LI-KS1 #ZR

jobs.description:
Req #128

Lane Venture, 2309 N. College Ave., Newton, North Carolina, United States of America

Job Description

Posted Monday, November 10, 2025, 11:00 PM

**Sales & Marketing Support Specialist**

This position supports the Lane Venture marketing team in promoting furniture products and the brand across multiple channels. The role includes supporting the team with clerical and administrative tasks including maintaining accurate content, managing marketing materials, and assisting with the coordination of marketing campaigns, while ensuring consistent brand representation across all customer touchpoints.

Responsibilities to include:

* Maintaining the product price books with precise product information, images, and pricing.
* Managing updates to the company website and e-commerce platforms, ensuring accurate product descriptions, images, and pricing.
* Creating and managing documents, spreadsheets, and presentations.
* Conducting data entry, retrieval, and database maintenance.
* Managing and updating marketing materials, website content, and other media platforms.
* Maintaining the product calendar to ensure the timely delivery of marketing assets.
* Supporting the development of marketing materials, such as brochures and catalogs.
* Assisting in planning and executing marketing campaigns for furniture collections, seasonal promotions, and showroom events.
* Helping to organize events for the furniture market.
* Providing administrative support to the marketing team, including data entry and scheduling.
* Ensuring brand guidelines are adhered to across all channels and materials.
* Possible occasional travel for the furniture market may be required.

Key Skills

Ideal candidate will have:

* 1 – 3 years of experience in marketing, communications, or administrative support.
* Proficient with marketing software and tools (Adobe software)
* Proficient in Excel and all Microsoft software
* Strong organization skills and attention to detail and high levels of accuracy
* Excellent written and verbal communication abilities
* Ability to multitask and meet deadlines
* Must be self-motivated.

Benefits:

* Medical, dental, and vision plan
* Short and Long-term disability
* Paid holidays and paid vacation
* Life insurance
* AFLAC
* 401(k) plan
* Stock Purchase Plan
* Employee Assistance Program
* Tuition Reimbursement Programs

online, mail a resume to Bassett Furniture, Inc., PO Box 47, Newton, NC 28658, or fax resume to 828-465-7792.

Job Details

Pay Type

**Hourly**

Lane Venture, 2309 N. College Ave., Newton, North Carolina, United States of America

jobs.job_title: Senior Product Manager, Marketing Technology and Personalization
jobs.description: We Go Beyond:At Beyond, we believe that everyone should “Be You!”. Beyond is a community that upholds a culture of understanding, acceptance, and respect. We believe a person’s individuality, traits, beliefs, and characteristics should be valued and embraced. Living by this ethos is essential to the success of our business. Our goal is to foster a more inclusive environment where every employee visibly demonstrates inclusive behaviors and respect for individuals.Beyond, Inc. is seeking a Senior Product Manager to lead the evolution of our marketing technology stack across Bed Bath & Beyond, Overstock, and buybuy BABY. This role is central to enabling repeat purchases, customer loyalty, and long-term profitability through smarter, more personalized marketing.As a Strategic Product Leader, you will own the roadmap for MarTech capabilities spanning email, push, in-app messaging, audience segmentation, content personalization, and experimentation tooling. You’ll work at the intersection of engineering, marketing, analytics, AI/ML, and external vendors to create the levers and infrastructure that help our teams deliver the right message to the right customer at the right time.Base Pay Range:$124,000 - $145,000Responsibilities:Priorities: Business Impact & Strategic FocusDrive initiatives that improve customer retention, LTV, and profitability through targeted and timely customer engagement.Prioritize projects that balance short-term marketing agility with long-term platform scalability and tech debt reduction.Establish clear success metrics tied to business outcomes: conversion rates, engagement, frequency of purchase, and opt-in retention.Process: Building Efficient, Scalable WorkflowsDefine and document martech workflows across campaign operations, audience segmentation, personalization, and A/B testing.Partner with Engineering and AI/ML teams to automate content delivery and decision-making using machine learning and generative AI.Implement and evolve data- and content-related processes that support dynamic campaign personalization at scale.Platforms: Vendor Strategy, AI, and Migration ManagementOwn platform evaluations and decisions as we shift from custom-built tools to best-in-class vendors like Braze, Salesforce Marketing Cloud, Movable Ink, and Google Gemini.Collaborate with technical architects to design modular, extensible solutions that future-proof our MarTech stack.Lead platform migrations and manage a backlog of technical debt, deprecations, and upgrades with a strategic lens.People: Cross-Functional Leadership & InfluenceServe as the connective tissue between Marketing, Engineering, Analytics, AI/ML Engineering, Merchandising, and Brand.Act as the voice of product in high-stakes conversations; listen deeply, synthesize feedback, and align diverse stakeholders.Influence without authority by leading through clarity, transparency, and outcome-driven decision-making.Stay organized while fielding inbound requests from across the company—understanding when to say “yes,” “no,” or “not yet.”Requirements8+ years of product management experience, ideally in e-commerce, ad tech, or martech.Proven track record building or evolving marketing platforms, personalization engines, or campaign operations tooling.Deep understanding of marketing workflows, including content authoring, audience segmentation, testing, and orchestration.Experience with Braze, Salesforce, Movable Ink, Google Gemini, CDPs, or similar platforms.Exposure to AI/ML technologies and how they can be used to optimize content delivery, segmentation, and performance.Strong data acumen—able to define KPIs, interpret dashboards, and partner with analysts to drive decisions.Proficient in Agile methodologies, backlog management, and cross-functional execution.Preferred QualificationsExperience managing large-scale platform migrations or vendor transitions.Familiarity with generative AI tools for subject line testing, creative scaling, or campaign analysis.Comfortable navigating strong personalities and conflicting priorities with empathy and clarity.BA/BS preferred; technical or analytical background preferred.Who We Are:We’re a passionate group of collaborative problem solvers and creative innovators, working on cutting-edge technology. From building award-winning retail applications (with amazing AR functionality) to creating leading blockchain and machine learning technologies, each of us embodies a unique value and contributes a diverse perspective to the team.What We Offer:401k (6% match)Flexible SchedulesTuition Reimbursement, Leadership Development Program, & Mentorship ProgramEmployee Resource Groups (LatinX, Black Employee Network, LGBTQIA+, Women’s Network, Women In Tech)And More…Benefits vary based on position, tenure, location, and employee electionPhysical Requirements:This position requires you to sit, stand and perform general office functions. You may also be required to lift up to 25 pounds occasionally. Bending, stooping and reaching are also frequently required.Equal Employment Opportunity:It is our policy to provide equal employment opportunity for all applicants and associates. This policy includes our commitment to ensure that all employment decisions are made without regard to race, color, religion, gender, national origin, disability, pregnancy, veteran status (including Vietnam era veterans), age, sexual orientation, gender identity, or any other non-job-related characteristic protected by law.Back to Beyond Careers

jobs.description: TITLE:Senior Sales Manager-Trade + ContractREPORTS TO:Director | Trade + ContractABOUT US: Blu Dot (www.bludot.com), an award-winning designer and maker of modern home furnishings, is currently searching for a Strategic Growth Manager to join our dynamic and values-driven company.Company PurposeInspire a more creative way of living through good design that's good to everyone.Core ValuesGood design is good. Good design should be reflected in everything we do.Keep it simple.Strive for economy in all that you do.Everyone is invited to our party.Treat every individual with respect & dignity.Our glass is half full.Focus on the positive.Be humble.We take nothing for granted.Turn it up to 11.Determine what is expected and do a little more.Stay curious.Try, learn, improve, repeat.ABOUT THE ROLE: The Trade + Contract Strategic Growth Manager will oversee Trade + Contract sales channels, managing national B2B accounts, strategic partnerships, and custom contract sales channels managed from Blu Dot's HQ in Minneapolis. This role is responsible fordriving revenue growth, strengthening client relationships, and developing initiatives to expand Blu Dot presence within the industry. The Trade + Contract Strategic Growth Manager will also lead the in-house Trade + Strategic Contract Partnership teams, ensuring a consistent, sales-driven and relationship-focused approach at every client touchpoint. Collaborating closely with leadership, our in-market Contract sales team, fellow customer facing channel managers, and business operations, the role will align strategies to meet company objectives while delivering exceptional value to clients - ensuring new customer acquisition and YoY revenue growth in channel.Success in this role will hinge on building continued brand awareness, world class service in both Residential Trade and Contract channels, intuitive market strategies, fiscal prudence, and talent development.Trade + Contract Sales:Drive revenue growth and expand market share within assigned accounts and regions for both residential Trade + Contract customer channels.Set sales goals and KPIs for the team, tracking performance to ensure targets are met.Participate in attaining and executing company OKR goals as assigned.Partner with Director to define and execute strategic sales goals by channel to meet and exceed business objectives.Lead a team of account managers and service professionals, ensuring alignment with company goals and customer service standards.Motivate engagement by sharing the Blu Dot brand origin story and imbuing a love of original design to clients & team members.Solicit feedback about Residential Trade and Dealer experience (separately) via annual customer survey deployment.Deploy and manage Contract account (Dealer) prospecting and account tracker. Measure quarterly and report on channel penetration by market - identifying top prospecting opportunities and deploying action plans and accountability expectations with customer facing teams.  Identify and deploy initiatives that support opportunities for improving Trade + Contract client customer experience at every touch point.Ensure standard sales discounting is being adhered to and that best practices are in place for special pricing considerations - establish and maintain internal tracking log for all known Dealer/project pricing exceptions.Represent Blu Dot as needed at industry-specific trade shows and via partner specific in-market initiatives.Sales Strategy + Execution:Develop, implement, and monitor performance of data-driven strategies to optimize sales and marketing ROI, focusing on high-growth segments and strategic accounts.Identify new business opportunities and markets, driving acquisition strategies within both the residential trade and contract furniture landscapes.Leverage analytics and market research to develop smarter outreach campaigns targeting high-value accounts.Monitor market trends and competitor activity and programming to adjust sales approaches accordingly.Audit and segment customer groups by class (delineation by system line) to improve communications and marketing efficacy.Assist Director in building and analyzing market budget analysis - holding yourself and the team accountable for reaching budgeted sales goals on both an annual and quarterly basis.Be versed in Contract sales data and reporting- review and analyze data to inform decision making - top Dealers, A + D outreach (led by outside sales teams) and prospecting, Dealer incentives and YoY performance.Client Relationship Management:Build and maintain strong, long-lasting relationships with national B2B clients and strategic partners.Primary strategic account owner for Dealer clients representing Contract system lines (Allsteel, Teknion, MillerKnoll, Haworth and our strategic partner, Steelcase), National Contract accounts, and our online Residential trade program.Serve as the final escalation point for key accounts, resolving issues and driving proactive solutions to maintain top industry reputation and repeat business.Compile and maintain industry-specific event invitation lists, using data-driven reporting to ensure key accounts are prioritized for relevant events.Team Management + Development:Foster a high-performance team culture by driving innovation and championing professional growth.Empower team to deploy customer-centric and creative problem-solving tactics and encourage ownership of accounts, barriers, solutions, and new ideas.Provide timely and constructive feedback to direct reports, be invested in their development and trainingRecognize individual and team achievement - share praise and successes.  Conduct annual performance reviews in timely and constructive manner - Director and channel Operations Manager to provide partnership/input in crafting.  Act as a sounding board and trusted thought partner to Director for all channel specific expansion and program efforts.  Recruit, train, and onboard new sales team members as dictated by business need.  Lead by example - uphold and demonstrate our company core values.Marketing + Brand Awareness:Maintain awareness of Residential Trade + Contract industry and competitive landscape - possess a technical and professional knowledge base and competitive analysis platform.Assist in the execution and evolution of ongoing company strategic initiatives such as Contract Email Campaign.Audit digital and printed materials available for specific Trade + Contract client outreach - work with Trade + Contract project manager on new asset briefs with marketing as needed.Cross-Functional Collaboration:Work closely with marketing, business operations, and product teams to successfully deploy strategic initiatives that align with the company's growth objectives.Provide input into product development and service enhancements based on client feedback.Solicit and communicate quality issues and assortment feedback, as they specifically relate to Trade + Contract clientele needs.Consult with outside Contract sales teams to build monthly Trade + Contract newsletter content, highlighting customer-class specific products, resources, initiatives and brand updates.Partner with accounting & business operations to evaluate customer payment status and credit limits, balancing risk with business growth opportunities.Reporting + Analysis:Develop and maintain customer segmentation frameworks to enhance marketing strategies and improve client engagement.Enable specific sales insights by implementation of robust channel reporting, leveraging Blu Dot's analytics platform, Tableau.Monitor sales performance, analyzing data to make informed decisions.Identify underperforming customer segments and lapsed accounts and implement targeted outreach campaigns.Evaluate sales performance trends, identifying opportunities for improvement.Work with Product and BI Teams to analyze channel specific assortment data and analyses.Prepare and present sales, open projects and prospect reports to direct leader weekly.Ideal Experience + Qualifications*:8+ years of experience in key account or national account management within the contract furniture, design, or architecture industries.8+ years of experience managing people or teams.Extensive experience developing, executing, and measuring successful sales strategies for B2B clients.Demonstrated ability to manage large-scale projects while maintaining focus on high-priority goals, such as customer classification improvements and revenue growth.Emotionally intelligent with strong interpersonal skills and a natural aptitude for building relationships and trust.Proficiency in CRM platforms, Microsoft Office Suite, and data analysis & visualization tools such as Tableau.Exceptional presentation and communication skills, both written and verbal.Strategic thinker with the ability to translate market insights into actionable plans.Additional Requirements:Position is based out of Minneapolis, MN headquarters with a flexible working environment/schedule (no full-time remote work available).Flexibility to work in-person and in the evenings (for industry events) as required.Occasional travel required.Everyone's welcome to our party! Blu Dot always welcomes candidates with unique and diverse backgrounds. Blu Dot is a member of E-Verify. Applicants must be currently authorized to work in the United States.For California job applicants, our privacy notice can be found here.

jobs.description:
**Job Title**Sales Associate - Retail Guest Experience Sales Specialist  
  
**Job Overview**Our Sales Associates - Retail Guest Experience Sales Specialists are a driving force behind Bob’s Discount Furniture’s success and expansion. Whether you're looking for full-time or part-time opportunities, you'll find a supportive, fun, and team-oriented environment at Bob’s. As a Sales Associate - Guest Experience Sales Specialist, you’ll help customers bring their home design dreams to life while delivering world-class service in a low-pressure, gimmick-free atmosphere—just the way Bob’s intended!  
  
**What You’ll Bring To Bob’s**At Bob’s Discount Furniture, we value the unique skills and experiences that each candidate brings. Success in this role is driven by a combination of customer service ability, interpersonal skills, and a passion for helping others. If you enjoy working with people, are energized by a sales environment, and love home décor, this role is for you!  
  
**Key Skills For Success**To excel in this role, you will need to demonstrate strengths in the following skill areas:  
  
**Core Competencies & Expertise**

* Customer Engagement and Active Listening
* Relationship Building and Client Follow-Up
* Consultative Selling and Product Knowledge Application
* Team Collaboration and Communication
* Adaptability to Retail Schedules and High-Energy Environments
* Comfort with Digital Tools and Point-of-Sale Systems
* Organizational Skills and Time Management
* Problem Solving and Goal Orientation

**Preferred Competencies & Skills**

* Previous retail or commission-based sales experience
* Bilingual communication skills
* Passion for home design and interior décor
* Experience with customer relationship management tools or systems

**Who We Are**At Bob’s, we have fun, we love what we do, and we’re growing fast! As one of the leading omni-channel furniture retailers in the country with over 200 stores, we’re committed to creating a workplace that values skills-based hiring, diverse perspectives, and an inclusive culture where everyone can thrive.  
  
**How We Will Support Your Success**We know you have many choices when it comes to your career. At Bob’s, we invest in your growth, well-being, and career advancement.  
  
**Benefits & Perks**

* Hourly Advance / Draw vs. Commission pay structure
* Medical, Dental, and Vision coverage
* Employer-paid and voluntary Life Insurance options
* 401(k) Profit Sharing Plan with generous match
* Paid time off including vacation, sick days, holidays, and your birthday!
* Employee Assistance Program and Emergency Support Programs (Bail Out & Helping Hand)
* Exclusive Employee Discounts
* Flexible retail schedules including evenings, weekends, and holidays
* Tuition reimbursement and professional development opportunities

**Our Culture & Core Values**At Bob’s, we believe in fostering a positive, inclusive, and skill-driven work environment. Our core values—Honesty, Integrity, Transparency, Community, Safety, Diversity, Accountability, and Fun—guide everything we do. We’re not just a workplace; we’re a team that supports and celebrates each other!  
  
**Minimum Qualifications**

* Energetic and self-motivated with strong interpersonal skills
* Basic computer proficiency
* Must be at least 18 years old to be considered for employment with Bob’s
* Ability to work a flexible retail schedule, including weekends and holidays

**Physical Demands**

* Ability to stand for long periods and move throughout the showroom
* Must be able to lift and move up to 50 lbs as needed

**Diversity is a Core Value at Bob’s**At Bob’s Discount Furniture, we want you to feel at home. Whether you’re shopping with us or a part of the Bob’s team, we want you to know that you are valued, appreciated, and free to be who you are. We are committed to creating a place as diverse as the communities we serve.  
  
*It is policy of Bob’s Discount Furniture, Inc., to provide equal employment opportunity to all employees and applicants for employment. No person shall be discriminated against or harassed because of race, religion, color, sex, age, national origin, disability, pregnancy, citizenship, veteran or military status, or any other protected status in accordance with federal, state or local law.**If you would like to contact us regarding the accessibility of our website or need assistance completing the application process, please contact* *talentacquistionteam@mybobs.com**. This contact information is for accommodation requests only and cannot be used to inquire about the status of applications.*

jobs.job_title: Digital Content Manager - Temporary Role (Manchester, CT)
jobs.description:
At Bob’s Discount Furniture, the Digital Content Manager (Temporary Role) plays a critical role in owning and optimizing our digital asset management (DAM) system while streamlining workflows and ensuring efficient content delivery across platforms. This role blends technical expertise, project management, and creative collaboration to drive efficiency, structure, and scalability within our growing content ecosystem.  
  
**What You’ll Bring To Bob’s**Success in this role requires a unique combination of technical, operational, and interpersonal skills. You will leverage your expertise in DAM systems, automation, and metadata structures to support end-to-end creative operations, while serving as a trainer, collaborator, and process optimizer.  
  
**Key Skills For Success****Core Competencies & Expertise**

* Digital Asset Management (DAM): Proven experience with DAM platforms (Cloudinary preferred) including organization, tagging, archiving, rights management, and user onboarding/training.
* Workflow Optimization: Ability to analyze and streamline creative workflows, leveraging low-code tools (Zapier, Power Automate, Airtable Automations) and light scripting (Python) to increase efficiency.
* Content Metadata & Taxonomy: Skilled in developing and managing scalable metadata standards, taxonomy models, and folder structures to ensure intuitive and accessible content.
* Creative & Technical Tools: Proficiency with Adobe Creative Suite (Photoshop, Illustrator, InDesign, Premiere Pro) to collaborate with design teams and support asset formatting.
* Systems Integration: Knowledge of REST APIs and connectors for integrating DAM with marketing tools, repositories, and analytics dashboards.
* Project Management: Experience using tools like Asana, Trello, or Monday.com to support creative timelines, asset flow, and cross-team visibility.
* Compliance Awareness: Understanding of content rights, licensing, and accessibility requirements (including ADA compliance).

**Preferred Competencies & Skills**

* Strong communication and training skills to onboard and enable diverse stakeholders.
* Highly detail-oriented, organized, and process-driven, with the ability to scale complex systems simply.
* Background or interest in library sciences, content taxonomy, or metadata systems.
* Retail or e-commerce creative team experience.

**Minimum Qualifications**

* 3–5 years of experience in digital asset management, creative operations, or marketing project coordination.
* Demonstrated technical skills in low-code platforms, workflow automation, and light scripting.
* Familiarity with cross-functional collaboration in creative or marketing environments.

**Who We Are**At Bob’s, we have fun, we love what we do, and we’re growing fast! As one of the leading omni-channel furniture retailers in the country with over 200 stores, we’re committed to creating a workplace that values **skills-based hiring, diverse perspectives, and an inclusive culture where everyone can thrive.****Growth Opportunity**This is a high-impact role at the intersection of marketing, operations, and technology. You will:  
  

* Lead simplification and automation efforts to reduce friction in creative workflows.
* Shape how digital content systems scale as our product and creative output grows.
* Collaborate with passionate creatives in a team-oriented, no-ego culture that values clarity, collaboration, and momentum.

**Diversity is a Core Value at Bob’s**At Bob’s Discount Furniture, we want you to feel at home. Whether you’re shopping with us or a part of the Bob’s team, we want you to know that you are valued, appreciated, and free to be who you are.  
  
We are committed to creating a place as diverse as the communities we serve. It is policy of Bob’s Discount Furniture, Inc., to provide equal employment opportunity to all employees and applicants for employment. No person shall be discriminated against or harassed because of race, religion, color, sex, age, national origin, disability, pregnancy, citizenship, veteran or military status, or any other protected status in accordance with federal, state or local law.  
  
If you would like to contact us regarding the accessibility of our website or need assistance completing the application process, please contact talentacquisitionteam@mybobs.com. This contact information is for accommodation requests only and cannot be used to inquire about the status of applications.  
  
**Expected Base Pay Not Including Potential Commissions, Incentive, Bonus, etc. Opportunities:**$45.00+

jobs.description:
**Job Title**Retail Outlet Sales and Operations Manager  
  
**Job Overview**As a **Retail Outlet Sales and Operations Manager** at Bob’s Discount Furniture, you’ll lead and inspire a team dedicated to optimizing sales, operations, and customer experience within our outlet locations. You’ll play a critical role in ensuring merchandise is received, staged, and sold efficiently, while maintaining a safe, organized, and customer-friendly showroom and warehouse. This hands-on leadership role blends sales strategy with back-end operational excellence to drive success across multiple departments.  
  
This is a full-time, in-store leadership position requiring flexible availability including evenings, weekends, and holidays.  
  
**What You’ll Bring To Bob’s**At Bob’s Discount Furniture, we value the unique skills and experiences that each candidate brings. Success in this role is driven by a blend of operational expertise, sales acumen, team development, and strategic thinking. If you thrive on leading teams, solving problems, and delivering results while creating a fun and organized retail environment, this is the opportunity for you.  
  
**Key Skills For Success**To excel in this role, you will need to demonstrate strengths in the following skill areas:  
  
**Core Competencies & Expertise**

* Retail sales and back-end operations leadership
* Team management, coaching, and scheduling
* Inventory control and cycle counting
* Logistics coordination and merchandise flow
* Safety compliance and warehouse standards
* Showroom merchandising and outlet presentation
* Customer experience and satisfaction
* Performance feedback and employee development
* Critical thinking and process improvement

**Preferred Competencies & Skills**

* 2–5 years of retail and/or warehouse leadership experience
* Experience in sales-driven environments
* Proven success in team development and accountability

**Who We Are**At Bob’s, we have fun, we love what we do, and we’re growing fast! We’re not just a workplace; we’re a team that supports and celebrates each other!  
  
**Minimum Qualifications**

* Demonstrated leadership and decision-making abilities
* Strong communication and organization skills
* Experience in inventory, receiving, and merchandising
* Must be at least 18 years old to be considered for employment

**Physical Demands**

* Ability to stand, walk, bend, and lift throughout the workday

* Frequent use of warehouse tools, ladders, and equipment

**Reporting Relationships**

jobs.description:
**Job Summary**The primary function of a Bobs Squad Support Associate is to represent Bob’s Discount Furniture and its products with honesty and integrity while providing exceptional support to guests through all stages of their journey. The goal of the Sales Support Associate is to support the omnichannel experience and to identify root causes of issues to assist stores efficiently in a timely manner.  
  
**Who We Are**At Bob’s, we have fun, we love what we do, and it shows in our expansive growth! Bob’s Discount Furniture is more than just a furniture store. We are one of the fastest growing omni-channel furniture retailers in the country.  
  
**How We Will Support You**At Bob’s we understand there are many companies you can choose to work for, so, along with exceptional opportunities for career growth we offer a fun team-oriented work environment and great benefits! Let us tell you more.  
  
**Benefits & Perks-** We’ve got you covered! We believe in supporting our employees and their families in the best ways possible is a top priority. We focus on three core wellness pillars: Emotional, Physical and Financial. Below are just some of the benefits that we offer:  
  

* Feeling under the weather, we’ve got you covered! We offer Nationally provided Medical, Dental and Vision Insurance
* Paid Vacation, Personal Days, Sick Days, Holidays, work anniversary and your Birthday! After all, your birthday should be a holiday
* 401(k) Profit Sharing Plan with a Generous Company match!
* Pet Insurance to help keep your furry friends happy and healthy
* Life insurance – Employer-paid basic Life Insurance, with the option to add Voluntary Life Insurance as well!
* Financial Planning, Voluntary Legal Benefits and Wellness Plans
* We already offer value priced furniture, but on top of that we offer a Generous Employee Discount starting on your 1st day!
* Additional Employee Discounts through the “Hays Perks discount program” offering hundreds of online discounts from your favorite merchants.
* And so much more!

**Culture and Core Values-** At Bob's we have a set of core values that shape the decisions we make every day and help define our company culture. These values comprise what we call "The Bob's Way." **Honesty, Integrity, Transparency, Community, Safety, Diversity, Accountability and Fun.****DIVERSITY IS A CORE VALUE AT BOB’S**At Bob’s Discount Furniture, we want you to feel at home. Whether you’re shopping with us or a part of the Bob’s team, we want you to know that you are valued, appreciated, and free to be who you are.  
  
We are committed to creating a place as diverse as the communities we serve.  
  
**Learn and Grow-** We believe in developing our team members and helping them grow both personally and professionally! We promote Professional Development: In-person, virtually and offer an infinite library of on-demand classes in Workday Learning. We also offer Tuition Reimbursement as well as the BDF Education Foundation Scholarship Program open to employees and their dependents. Want to grow at Bob’s professionally? We look to promote from within our organization by having robust succession planning in place to ensure that our team members have the opportunity to advance their careers.  
  
**Responsibilities**

* Be consistently positive, enthusiastic, and respectful in all interactions with guests and co-workers.
* Accurately and honestly represent all company policies, products, and services, to help the store reach quantitative goals the “BOB’S WAY,” bringing his positive image and energy into all service situations.
* Update guest orders into the system accurately and completely across all store locations using BobsBoost.
* Accurately process payments; be responsible for security of cash and other legal tenders in the store and on the phone.
* Ensure the company’s assets are properly cared for and in good working condition.
* Answer national incoming calls and respond to guest queries in a timely and courteous manner.
* Stay well informed about Bob’s products, pricing and policies.
* Assist guests in using the most appropriate Bob’s systems.
* Maintain guest communication on all national open orders and communicate status with guests.
* Provide communication and guidance along the guest journey from pre-purchase to the day of delivery.
* Follow up and complete all training and tasks, including but not limited to, e-learnings and daily tasks assigned by the company and managers.
* Execute all behavioral and operational standards per company policies, procedures, and processes.
* Arrive to work on time dressed according to the Dress Code Policy on scheduled days, which includes being able to work weekends and major holidays per the company’s scheduling guidelines and Dress Code Policy.
* Support all company initiatives as directed by Bobs Squad Management or company.
* Attend and constructively participate in all scheduled meetings, workshops and training sessions.
* Ad hoc assignments that support the instore sales function, that include the CPU instore process
* The list of responsibilities is not intended to be all-inclusive as there may be other duties assigned.

**Required Qualifications**

* Flexibility to work a retail schedule that includes nights, weekends, and holidays.
* Ability to effectively use technology and learn new technologies.
* Effective cash handling skills.
* Effective verbal and listening skills.
* Interpersonal and human relations skills.
* Global call center experience.
* Proven analytical and problem-solving skills.
* Ability to use sound judgment and decision making.

**Preferred Qualifications**

* Retail background
* Sales experience
* Customer Service experience

**Physical Requirements**

* Ability to stand and walk.
* Ability to complete seated work at a desk
* Ability to answer the phone and utilize a computer.

**Expected Base Pay Not Including Potential Commissions, Incentive, Bonus, etc. Opportunities:**Pay:$16.63 - per hour plus commission  
  
*It is policy of Bob’s Discount Furniture, Inc., to provide equal employment opportunity to all employees and applicants for employment. No person shall be discriminated against or harassed because of race, religion, color, sex, age, national origin, disability, pregnancy, citizenship, veteran or military status, or any other protected status in accordance with federal, state or local law.**If you would like to contact us regarding the accessibility of our website or need assistance completing the application process, please contact talentacquistionteam@mybobs.com. This contact information is for accommodation requests only and cannot be used to inquire about the status of applications.*

jobs.job_title: Digital Content Manager - Temporary Role (Manchester, CT)
jobs.description:
At Bob’s Discount Furniture, the Digital Content Manager (Temporary Role) plays a critical role in owning and optimizing our digital asset management (DAM) system while streamlining workflows and ensuring efficient content delivery across platforms. This role blends technical expertise, project management, and creative collaboration to drive efficiency, structure, and scalability within our growing content ecosystem.  
  
**What You’ll Bring To Bob’s**Success in this role requires a unique combination of technical, operational, and interpersonal skills. You will leverage your expertise in DAM systems, automation, and metadata structures to support end-to-end creative operations, while serving as a trainer, collaborator, and process optimizer.  
  
**Key Skills For Success****Core Competencies & Expertise**

* Digital Asset Management (DAM): Proven experience with DAM platforms (Cloudinary preferred) including organization, tagging, archiving, rights management, and user onboarding/training.
* Workflow Optimization: Ability to analyze and streamline creative workflows, leveraging low-code tools (Zapier, Power Automate, Airtable Automations) and light scripting (Python) to increase efficiency.
* Content Metadata & Taxonomy: Skilled in developing and managing scalable metadata standards, taxonomy models, and folder structures to ensure intuitive and accessible content.
* Creative & Technical Tools: Proficiency with Adobe Creative Suite (Photoshop, Illustrator, InDesign, Premiere Pro) to collaborate with design teams and support asset formatting.
* Systems Integration: Knowledge of REST APIs and connectors for integrating DAM with marketing tools, repositories, and analytics dashboards.
* Project Management: Experience using tools like Asana, Trello, or Monday.com to support creative timelines, asset flow, and cross-team visibility.
* Compliance Awareness: Understanding of content rights, licensing, and accessibility requirements (including ADA compliance).

**Preferred Competencies & Skills**

* Strong communication and training skills to onboard and enable diverse stakeholders.
* Highly detail-oriented, organized, and process-driven, with the ability to scale complex systems simply.
* Background or interest in library sciences, content taxonomy, or metadata systems.
* Retail or e-commerce creative team experience.

**Minimum Qualifications**

* 3–5 years of experience in digital asset management, creative operations, or marketing project coordination.
* Demonstrated technical skills in low-code platforms, workflow automation, and light scripting.
* Familiarity with cross-functional collaboration in creative or marketing environments.

**Who We Are**At Bob’s, we have fun, we love what we do, and we’re growing fast! As one of the leading omni-channel furniture retailers in the country with over 200 stores, we’re committed to creating a workplace that values **skills-based hiring, diverse perspectives, and an inclusive culture where everyone can thrive.****Growth Opportunity**This is a high-impact role at the intersection of marketing, operations, and technology. You will:  
  

* Lead simplification and automation efforts to reduce friction in creative workflows.
* Shape how digital content systems scale as our product and creative output grows.
* Collaborate with passionate creatives in a team-oriented, no-ego culture that values clarity, collaboration, and momentum.

**Diversity is a Core Value at Bob’s**At Bob’s Discount Furniture, we want you to feel at home. Whether you’re shopping with us or a part of the Bob’s team, we want you to know that you are valued, appreciated, and free to be who you are.  
  
We are committed to creating a place as diverse as the communities we serve. It is policy of Bob’s Discount Furniture, Inc., to provide equal employment opportunity to all employees and applicants for employment. No person shall be discriminated against or harassed because of race, religion, color, sex, age, national origin, disability, pregnancy, citizenship, veteran or military status, or any other protected status in accordance with federal, state or local law.  
  
If you would like to contact us regarding the accessibility of our website or need assistance completing the application process, please contact talentacquisitionteam@mybobs.com. This contact information is for accommodation requests only and cannot be used to inquire about the status of applications.  
  
**Expected Base Pay Not Including Potential Commissions, Incentive, Bonus, etc. Opportunities:**$45.00+  
  
*It is policy of Bob’s Discount Furniture, Inc., to provide equal employment opportunity to all employees and applicants for employment. No person shall be discriminated against or harassed because of race, religion, color, sex, age, national origin, disability, pregnancy, citizenship, veteran or military status, or any other protected status in accordance with federal, state or local law.**If you would like to contact us regarding the accessibility of our website or need assistance completing the application process, please contact talentacquistionteam@mybobs.com. This contact information is for accommodation requests only and cannot be used to inquire about the status of applications.*

jobs.description:
**Job Title**Retail Guest Experience Sales Specialist  
  
**Job Overview**Our Retail Guest Experience Sales Specialists are a driving force behind Bob’s Discount Furniture’s success and expansion. Whether you're looking for full-time or part-time opportunities, you'll find a supportive, fun, and team-oriented environment at Bob’s. As a Guest Experience Sales Specialist, you’ll help customers bring their home design dreams to life while delivering world-class service in a low-pressure, gimmick-free atmosphere—just the way Bob’s intended!  
  
**What You’ll Bring To Bob’s**At Bob’s Discount Furniture, we value the unique skills and experiences that each candidate brings. Success in this role is driven by a combination of customer service ability, interpersonal skills, and a passion for helping others. If you enjoy working with people, are energized by a sales environment, and love home décor, this role is for you!  
  
**Key Skills For Success**To excel in this role, you will need to demonstrate strengths in the following skill areas:  
  
**Core Competencies & Expertise**

* Customer Engagement and Active Listening
* Relationship Building and Client Follow-Up
* Consultative Selling and Product Knowledge Application
* Team Collaboration and Communication
* Adaptability to Retail Schedules and High-Energy Environments
* Comfort with Digital Tools and Point-of-Sale Systems
* Organizational Skills and Time Management
* Problem Solving and Goal Orientation

**Preferred Competencies & Skills**

* Previous retail or commission-based sales experience
* Bilingual communication skills
* Passion for home design and interior décor
* Experience with customer relationship management tools or systems

**Who We Are**At Bob’s, we have fun, we love what we do, and we’re growing fast! As one of the leading omni-channel furniture retailers in the country with over 200 stores, we’re committed to creating a workplace that values skills-based hiring, diverse perspectives, and an inclusive culture where everyone can thrive.  
  
**How We Will Support Your Success**We know you have many choices when it comes to your career. At Bob’s, we invest in your growth, well-being, and career advancement.  
  
**Benefits & Perks**

* Hourly Advance / Draw vs. Commission pay structure
* Medical, Dental, and Vision coverage
* Employer-paid and voluntary Life Insurance options
* 401(k) Profit Sharing Plan with generous match
* Paid time off including vacation, sick days, holidays, and your birthday!
* Employee Assistance Program and Emergency Support Programs (Bail Out & Helping Hand)
* Exclusive Employee Discounts
* Flexible retail schedules including evenings, weekends, and holidays
* Tuition reimbursement and professional development opportunities

**Our Culture & Core Values**At Bob’s, we believe in fostering a positive, inclusive, and skill-driven work environment. Our core values—Honesty, Integrity, Transparency, Community, Safety, Diversity, Accountability, and Fun—guide everything we do. We’re not just a workplace; we’re a team that supports and celebrates each other!  
  
**Minimum Qualifications**

* Energetic and self-motivated with strong interpersonal skills
* Basic computer proficiency
* Must be at least 18 years old to be considered for employment with Bob’s
* Ability to work a flexible retail schedule, including weekends and holidays

**Physical Demands**

* Ability to stand for long periods and move throughout the showroom
* Must be able to lift and move up to 50 lbs as needed

**Diversity is a Core Value at Bob’s**At Bob’s Discount Furniture, we want you to feel at home. Whether you’re shopping with us or a part of the Bob’s team, we want you to know that you are valued, appreciated, and free to be who you are. We are committed to creating a place as diverse as the communities we serve.  
  
**Expected Base Pay Not Including Potential Commissions, Incentive, Bonus, etc. Opportunities:**Pay: $26.50 against commission  
  
*It is policy of Bob’s Discount Furniture, Inc., to provide equal employment opportunity to all employees and applicants for employment. No person shall be discriminated against or harassed because of race, religion, color, sex, age, national origin, disability, pregnancy, citizenship, veteran or military status, or any other protected status in accordance with federal, state or local law.**If you would like to contact us regarding the accessibility of our website or need assistance completing the application process, please contact talentacquistionteam@mybobs.com. This contact information is for accommodation requests only and cannot be used to inquire about the status of applications.*

jobs.description:
**Job Title**Retail Outlet Sales and Operations Manager  
  
**Job Overview**As a **Retail Outlet Sales and Operations Manager** at Bob’s Discount Furniture, you’ll lead and inspire a team dedicated to optimizing sales, operations, and customer experience within our outlet locations. You’ll play a critical role in ensuring merchandise is received, staged, and sold efficiently, while maintaining a safe, organized, and customer-friendly showroom and warehouse. This hands-on leadership role blends sales strategy with back-end operational excellence to drive success across multiple departments.  
  
This is a full-time, in-store leadership position requiring flexible availability including evenings, weekends, and holidays.  
  
**What You’ll Bring To Bob’s**At Bob’s Discount Furniture, we value the unique skills and experiences that each candidate brings. Success in this role is driven by a blend of operational expertise, sales acumen, team development, and strategic thinking. If you thrive on leading teams, solving problems, and delivering results while creating a fun and organized retail environment, this is the opportunity for you.  
  
**Key Skills For Success**To excel in this role, you will need to demonstrate strengths in the following skill areas:  
  
**Core Competencies & Expertise**

* Retail sales and back-end operations leadership
* Team management, coaching, and scheduling
* Inventory control and cycle counting
* Logistics coordination and merchandise flow
* Safety compliance and warehouse standards
* Showroom merchandising and outlet presentation
* Customer experience and satisfaction
* Performance feedback and employee development
* Critical thinking and process improvement

**Preferred Competencies & Skills**

* 2–5 years of retail and/or warehouse leadership experience
* Experience in sales-driven environments
* Proven success in team development and accountability
* Bachelor's degree or equivalent work experience
* Familiarity with receiving, returns, and outbound logistics processes

**Who We Are**At Bob’s, we have fun, we love what we do, and we’re growing fast! As one of the leading omni-channel furniture retailers in the country with over 200 stores, we’re committed to creating a workplace that values skills-based hiring, diverse perspectives, and an inclusive culture where everyone can thrive.  
  
**How We Will Support Your Success**We know you have many choices when it comes to your career. At Bob’s, we invest in your growth, well-being, and career advancement.  
  
**Benefits & Perks**

* National Medical, Dental, and Vision Insurance
* Paid Time Off: Vacation, Sick Days, Holidays, and Your Birthday
* 401(k) Profit Sharing Plan with a generous company match
* Employer-paid Life Insurance with voluntary options
* Pet Insurance and Employee Assistance Program
* Bob’s Helping Hand & Bail Out financial support programs
* Tuition Reimbursement and Employee Scholarship Programs
* On-the-job training and career path development
* Employee Discount from Day 1 and additional partner discounts

**Our Culture & Core Values**At Bob’s, we believe in fostering a positive, inclusive, and skill-driven work environment. Our core values—**Honesty, Integrity, Transparency, Community, Safety, Diversity, Accountability, and Fun**—guide everything we do. We’re not just a workplace; we’re a team that supports and celebrates each other!  
  
**Minimum Qualifications**

* Demonstrated leadership and decision-making abilities
* Strong communication and organization skills
* Experience in inventory, receiving, and merchandising
* Must be at least 18 years old to be considered for employment

**Physical Demands**

* Ability to stand, walk, bend, and lift throughout the workday
* Capable of lifting or moving items up to 50 lbs. without assistance
* Frequent use of warehouse tools, ladders, and equipment

**Reporting Relationships**

* Reports to: Retail Store Manager
* Direct Reports: Retail Product Support Leads, Retail Outlet Experience Leads, Retail Product Associates, Retail Outlet Experience Specialists (may vary by location)

**Equal Opportunity**Bob’s Discount Furniture is proud to be an equal opportunity employer. We celebrate diversity and are committed to creating an inclusive environment for all team members, applicants, and customers.  
  
*It is policy of Bob’s Discount Furniture, Inc., to provide equal employment opportunity to all employees and applicants for employment. No person shall be discriminated against or harassed because of race, religion, color, sex, age, national origin, disability, pregnancy, citizenship, veteran or military status, or any other protected status in accordance with federal, state or local law.**If you would like to contact us regarding the accessibility of our website or need assistance completing the application process, please contact* *talentacquistionteam@mybobs.com**. This contact information is for accommodation requests only and cannot be used to inquire about the status of applications.*

jobs.description:
**Job Summary**The primary function of a Bobs Squad Support Associate is to represent Bob’s Discount Furniture and its products with honesty and integrity while providing exceptional support to guests through all stages of their journey. The goal of the Sales Support Associate is to support the omnichannel experience and to identify root causes of issues to assist stores efficiently in a timely manner.  
  
**Who We Are**At Bob’s, we have fun, we love what we do, and it shows in our expansive growth! Bob’s Discount Furniture is more than just a furniture store. We are one of the fastest growing omni-channel furniture retailers in the country.  
  
**How We Will Support You**At Bob’s we understand there are many companies you can choose to work for, so, along with exceptional opportunities for career growth we offer a fun team-oriented work environment and great benefits! Let us tell you more.  
  
**Benefits & Perks-** We’ve got you covered! We believe in supporting our employees and their families in the best ways possible is a top priority. We focus on three core wellness pillars: Emotional, Physical and Financial. Below are just some of the benefits that we offer:  
  

* Feeling under the weather, we’ve got you covered! We offer Nationally provided Medical, Dental and Vision Insurance
* Paid Vacation, Personal Days, Sick Days, Holidays, work anniversary and your Birthday! After all, your birthday should be a holiday
* 401(k) Profit Sharing Plan with a Generous Company match!
* Pet Insurance to help keep your furry friends happy and healthy
* Life insurance – Employer-paid basic Life Insurance, with the option to add Voluntary Life Insurance as well!
* Financial Planning, Voluntary Legal Benefits and Wellness Plans
* We already offer value priced furniture, but on top of that we offer a Generous Employee Discount starting on your 1st day!
* Additional Employee Discounts through the “Hays Perks discount program” offering hundreds of online discounts from your favorite merchants.
* And so much more!

**Culture and Core Values-** At Bob's we have a set of core values that shape the decisions we make every day and help define our company culture. These values comprise what we call "The Bob's Way." **Honesty, Integrity, Transparency, Community, Safety, Diversity, Accountability and Fun.****DIVERSITY IS A CORE VALUE AT BOB’S**At Bob’s Discount Furniture, we want you to feel at home. Whether you’re shopping with us or a part of the Bob’s team, we want you to know that you are valued, appreciated, and free to be who you are.  
  
We are committed to creating a place as diverse as the communities we serve.  
  
**Learn and Grow-** We believe in developing our team members and helping them grow both personally and professionally! We promote Professional Development: In-person, virtually and offer an infinite library of on-demand classes in Workday Learning. We also offer Tuition Reimbursement as well as the BDF Education Foundation Scholarship Program open to employees and their dependents. Want to grow at Bob’s professionally? We look to promote from within our organization by having robust succession planning in place to ensure that our team members have the opportunity to advance their careers.  
  
**Responsibilities**

* Be consistently positive, enthusiastic, and respectful in all interactions with guests and co-workers.
* Accurately and honestly represent all company policies, products, and services, to help the store reach quantitative goals the “BOB’S WAY,” bringing his positive image and energy into all service situations.
* Update guest orders into the system accurately and completely across all store locations using BobsBoost.
* Accurately process payments; be responsible for security of cash and other legal tenders in the store and on the phone.
* Ensure the company’s assets are properly cared for and in good working condition.
* Answer national incoming calls and respond to guest queries in a timely and courteous manner.
* Stay well informed about Bob’s products, pricing and policies.
* Assist guests in using the most appropriate Bob’s systems.
* Maintain guest communication on all national open orders and communicate status with guests.
* Provide communication and guidance along the guest journey from pre-purchase to the day of delivery.
* Follow up and complete all training and tasks, including but not limited to, e-learnings and daily tasks assigned by the company and managers.
* Execute all behavioral and operational standards per company policies, procedures, and processes.
* Arrive to work on time dressed according to the Dress Code Policy on scheduled days, which includes being able to work weekends and major holidays per the company’s scheduling guidelines and Dress Code Policy.
* Support all company initiatives as directed by Bobs Squad Management or company.
* Attend and constructively participate in all scheduled meetings, workshops and training sessions.
* Ad hoc assignments that support the instore sales function, that include the CPU instore process
* The list of responsibilities is not intended to be all-inclusive as there may be other duties assigned.

**Required Qualifications**

* Flexibility to work a retail schedule that includes nights, weekends, and holidays.
* Ability to effectively use technology and learn new technologies.
* Effective cash handling skills.
* Effective verbal and listening skills.
* Interpersonal and human relations skills.
* Global call center experience.
* Proven analytical and problem-solving skills.
* Ability to use sound judgment and decision making.

**Preferred Qualifications**

* Retail background
* Sales experience
* Customer Service experience

**Physical Requirements**

* Ability to stand and walk.
* Ability to complete seated work at a desk
* Ability to answer the phone and utilize a computer.

**Expected Base Pay Not Including Potential Commissions, Incentive, Bonus, etc. Opportunities:**Pay:$16.63 - per hour plus commission  
  
*It is policy of Bob’s Discount Furniture, Inc., to provide equal employment opportunity to all employees and applicants for employment. No person shall be discriminated against or harassed because of race, religion, color, sex, age, national origin, disability, pregnancy, citizenship, veteran or military status, or any other protected status in accordance with federal, state or local law.**If you would like to contact us regarding the accessibility of our website or need assistance completing the application process, please contact talentacquistionteam@mybobs.com. This contact information is for accommodation requests only and cannot be used to inquire about the status of applications.*

jobs.description: Company DescriptionFounded in 1978, California Closets has built a reputation as the leader and design authority for custom-designed organizational solutions and exceptional service. We believe home is more than just a place — it should be a source of creativity, comfort, and connection. From beautiful walk-in closets and entertainment centers to versatile pantries and home offices, we design and install custom solutions for the whole home that add value to your life and home by making space for what belongs. Think of it as ‘Practical Magic.’Job DescriptionThe Sales and Design Consultant role is critical to the California Closets Design Brand experience and the relationship earned with each and every customer. By listening to a customer’s needs and collaborating on every detail, this role is responsible for delivering highly personalized, whole-home design solutions and exceptional service. Supported by enhanced training, this role requires passion for design, integrity, and commitment to excellence for measuring, designing, selling, and delivering custom solutions that add lifetime value and impact. This is a full-time (40+ hours per week) position.What We OfferCalifornia Closets has both company-owned and franchise locations. jobs.description:
**Company Description**Founded in 1978, California Closets has built a reputation as the leader and design authority in premium space management, delivering custom-designed organizational solutions and exceptional service. We believe home is more than just a place — it should be a source of creativity, comfort, and connection. From beautiful walk-in closets and entertainment centers to versatile pantries and home offices, we design custom storage solutions that add value to your life and home by making space for what belongs. Think of it as ‘practical magic.’  
  
**Job Description**The Sales Supervisor role focuses on ensuring that company sales goals are met or exceeded including achieving all key business metrics while following the California Closets policies and procedures. This role ensures that the designers are delivering on the California Closets standards of excellence with each and every customer. The Sales Supervisor also collaborates with the Sales Manager to ensure that the process flow is being followed and delivering on a high standard of customer service at all touchpoints.  
  
**What We Offer**California Closets has both company-owned and franchise locations. This location is a franchise, therefore earns the following benefits:  
  

* A fun, creative, and inclusive work environment
* Compensation is Salary plus a commission based on sales. Approximately $75k annually.
* Health insurance – Medical, and Dental
* Paid Vacation and Sick time
* Simple IRA retirement plan with company match
* Company phone number

Company-owned locations may offer different benefits.  
  
**Essential Functions**

* Coach and mentor, an assigned team of Design Consultants ensuring all company revenue goals and key performance indicators are met or exceeded through monthly (Goal Setting & Review Meetings) GS&R’s.
* Ensure direct reports are delivering on an exception customer experience with every customer touch point and follow up on completed procedures per company policy
* Performance manages underperformers following performance management guidelines to improve results including detailed documentation, may have to include HR and General Manager.
* Collaborate with Sales Manager to ensure all mandatory training is completed as per training strategy for new and on-going training and development.
* Working in collaboration with the Sales Manager to ensure the assigned Design Team has the appropriate mix of company leads and self-generated leads.
* Work with Design Consultants to create a plan for driving self-generated leads.
* Manage day-to-day performance of all sales team members
* Co-Manage sales contests and incentive programs and collaborate with the Sales Manager on creation and tracking.
* Working in collaboration with Sales Manager to co-schedule and co-facilitate monthly Sales Meeting including coordination with guest speakers.
* Analyze sales data and develop strategy to address areas of opportunity.
* Monitor and enforce sales team’s participation in local industry meetings and functions (i.e. BIA, Chamber of Commerce, and ASID).

**Qualifications**

* High school diploma and/or GED, some college education preferred
* Interior design education, direct industry experience or proven passion for home décor.
* 5+ years of direct selling consultative sales experience within a business to consumer environment, preferably in high-end furniture, design showrooms, or luxury retail environments
* 3+ years of management/leadership experience
* Proven track record of leading a team to exceed sales quotas and sales metrics

**Additional Information***We are an equal opportunity employer.*All your information will be kept confidential.  
  
CA Privacy Policy - California Privacy Policy - California Closets  
  
Terms and Conditions: https://www.californiaclosets.com/terms-conditions/

jobs.description:
**Company Description**Founded in 1978, California Closets has built a reputation as the leader and design authority for custom-designed organizational solutions and exceptional service. We believe home is more than just a place — it should be a source of creativity, comfort, and connection. From beautiful walk-in closets and entertainment centers to versatile pantries and home offices, we design and install custom solutions for the whole home that add value to your life and home by making space for what belongs. Think of it as ‘Practical Magic.’  
  
**Job Description**Position Overview  
  
We are seeking a Marketing & Growth Manager to drive the execution of marketing initiatives, lead generation programs, and trade partnerships that accelerate company growth. This role blends hands-on execution with strategic input, supporting the Director of Marketing in bringing the company’s growth strategy to life. The ideal candidate thrives at the intersection of marketing, partnerships, and sales enablement—turning strategic goals into measurable results through campaigns, events, and partnerships. The Marketing & Growth Manager will be responsible for executing marketing initiatives, analyzing performance metrics, and bringing forward innovative ideas that enhance brand visibility and pipeline growth.  
  
Key Responsibilities  
  
Marketing Strategy & Execution  
  

* Execute the company’s marketing strategy under the guidance of the Director of Marketing.
* Translate high-level marketing plans into actionable campaigns across digital, event, and trade channels.
* Provide input on creative and strategic direction to enhance performance and brand consistency.
* Track and report on key marketing metrics, including lead sources, campaign ROI, and conversion trends.

Lead Generation  
  

* Develop and execute lead generation programs that drive high-quality inbound and partner-sourced leads.
* Optimize marketing funnels in collaboration with sales to improve lead-to-close ratios.
* Report on Marketing Qualified Leads (MQLs), Sales Qualified Leads (SQLs), and conversion metrics.

Trade Partnerships & Business Development  
  

* Identify, secure, and grow relationships with designers, contractors, builders, and real estate professionals.
* Create and execute trade and referral programs that expand the pipeline and increase referral-driven revenue.
* Collaborate with the Director of Marketing to co-develop partner campaigns that align with brand strategy.
* Manage partnership engagement, performance reporting, and ROI analysis.

Event Marketing & Brand Activation  
  

* Plan and execute high-impact showroom and trade events that generate leads and strengthen community presence.
* Oversee logistics, promotions, vendor coordination, and post-event follow-up.
* Analyze event performance and report on ROI and lead conversion.

Territory Marketing & Local Growth  
  

* Support regional growth plans by tailoring marketing campaigns to local markets.
* Work with the sales team to identify high-opportunity markets and drive localized awareness and leads.
* Track territory-level performance and provide insights to leadership on growth opportunities.

**Qualifications**3–5 years of experience in marketing, partnerships, or business development.  
  

* Proven track record in executing marketing campaigns, event management, and relationship development.
* Proven ability to develop and manage trade relationships
* Strong ability to translate strategy into execution while contributing new ideas and innovation.
* Excellent project management, analytical, and communication skills.
* Experience using CRM systems and marketing performance tools.
* Entrepreneurial mindset with accountability for measurable outcomes.

**Additional Information**Find us on Facebook, YouTube, and Instagram  
  
*We are an equal opportunity employer. We E-Verify.*All your information will be kept confidential according to EEO guidelines.  
  
Privacy Policy: https://www.californiaclosets.com/privacy-policy/
