jobs.job_title: Sr Manager, Growth Marketing & Paid Search - Remote
jobs.description:
**Company Description**Founded in 1978, California Closets has built a reputation as the leader and design authority in premium space management, delivering custom-designed organizational solutions and exceptional service. We believe home is more than just a place — it should be a source of creativity, comfort, and connection. From beautiful walk-in closets and entertainment centers to versatile pantries and home offices, we design custom storage solutions that add value to your life and home by making space for what belongs. Think of it as ‘practical magic.’  
  
**Job Description**We are seeking a strategic Senior Growth Marketing Manager with a strong focus on Paid Search including Bing and Google Paid Search, Demand Gen, Performance Max, and YouTube campaigns. This role will be responsible for using data-driven insights to develop and own paid search strategies, manage media budgets, drive campaign execution, and work cross-functionally to achieve growth and ROI objectives. You understand the full search landscape to identify opportunities where paid and organic search can work together to maximize performance.  
  
We are seeking a creatively strategic Senior Growth Marketing Manager with a strong focus on Paid Search including Bing and Google Paid Search, Demand Gen, Performance Max and YouTube campaigns. This role will be responsible for using data-driven insights to develop and own paid search strategies, manage media budgets, drive campaign execution, and work cross-functionally to achieve growth and ROI objectives. While this role is focused on paid search, we’re seeking a candidate that is aware of the greater paid digital ecosystem including broadcast, streaming and OTT advertising, paid social, affiliate marketing and their potential impacts on paid search performance. The ideal candidate has a passion for problem-solving, a data-first mindset, and excellent communication skills. You will be part of the Growth Marketing team—a collaborative group of marketers working to expand brand awareness and generate demand for California Closets through conversations with the customer. Optimizing their brand experience from awareness through first contact with us.  
  
Base salary for this range is $130k - $150k + benefits. Our salary ranges are determined by role, level, and location. This is a remote position, however there is occasionally travel required about 3-5x per year.  
  
**Responsibilities**

* Ownership role in the planning, management, and execution of all California Closets Paid Search campaigns, including but not limited to account setup, development and implementation of strategies, campaign structure, budget management, bidding strategies and invoice and billing management
* Experience managing budgets more than $10M, with an aptitude for managing market-specific billing details and reporting these charges to internal finance teams
* Actively direct and manage a digital agency to define, execute and measure marketing campaigns to maximize efficient customer growth for existing and new paid media channels, including paid search (SEM), YouTube video and display, programmatic, and retargeting
* Actively direct and manage digital agency efforts to conduct keyword research, competitive analysis, and audience targeting to identify growth opportunities and mitigate risks
* Have a true love of data and problem solving. Know what data to pull to obtain needed insights and be skilled at interpreting the data and knowing where and how to dig deeper to uncover anomalies, unexpected outcomes and key performance insights
* Review paid search and YouTube campaign performance by market/DMA and work directly with local business owners & managing operators to adjust strategies to align with their business specific objectives
* Meet and exceed monthly volume and ROAS targets by driving continuous improvement and experimentation of new optimization concepts and tactics
* Meet regularly with agency and platform account teams to assess account performance, and to ensure optimal solution adoption while continually evolving strategies in tandem with the rapidly shifting paid search landscape
* Partner with digital agency to monitor new opportunities within the Google and Microsoft Ads platforms to test and optimize accounts
* As the driving force behind our YouTube efforts, you’ll create a data-driven YouTube advertising strategy that compliments California Closets overall business goals
* Conduct in-depth post-campaign analysis, test plans for new user acquisition initiatives, and measure performance to identify testing opportunities across paid search and YouTube
* Collaborate across levels and functions within the Growth, Tech, Operations, Solutions and Brand teams to support company growth initiatives
* Develop creative and innovative solutions for how to leverage paid search and YouTube for customer acquisition with a willingness to test new strategies and tactics
* Derive critical insights from data (front-end performance metrics from search engine platforms and back-end California Closets actions) and synthesize recommendations to deliver improvements to campaign performance
* Proven ability to seek cross channel insights by conducting attribution analysis to understand how the market specific media mix impacts paid search performance, regarding new/returning visitor volume and quality
* Proactively seek ongoing education with the very latest industry trends and advancements in paid search, AI and all other aspects of modern digital marketing
* Ensure that your efforts and those of 3rd party partners adhere to the latest corporate privacy and data governance policies

**Qualifications**

* 7+ years of Paid Search experience managing and optimizing campaigns in Google Paid Search and Microsoft Ads.
* Hands-on experience managing and optimizing YouTube video campaigns.
* Google and Microsoft Ads certifications.
* Advanced proficiency in Google Analytics (GA4).
* Strong skills in Excel (macros, charts, pivot tables) and Tableau or similar BI platforms for data manipulation and visualization.
* Proven experience with A/B testing and iterative campaign optimization.
* Detail-oriented with a passion for creating processes to manage multiple campaigns and track location/franchise-specific strategies.
* Ability to use data and metrics to solve problems, support assumptions, and identify opportunities.
* Track record of exceeding performance goals through analysis, problem-solving, and strategic execution.

**Additional Information**Find us on Facebook, YouTube, and Instagram  
  
*We are an equal opportunity employer. We E-Verify.*All your information will be kept confidential according to EEO guidelines.

jobs.job_title: Sales and Design Consultant (GTA East End - Whitby & Scarborough area)
jobs.description:
**Company Description**Founded in 1978, California Closets has built a reputation as the leader and design authority for custom-designed organizational solutions and exceptional service. We believe home is more than just a place — it should be a source of creativity, comfort, and connection. From beautiful walk-in closets and entertainment centers to versatile pantries and home offices, we design and install custom solutions for the whole home that add value to your life and home by making space for what belongs. Think of it as ‘Practical Magic.’  
  
**Job Description**The Sales and Design Consultant role is critical to the California Closets Design Brand experience and the relationship earned with each and every customer. By listening to a customer’s needs and collaborating on every detail, this role is responsible for delivering highly personalized, whole-home design solutions and exceptional service. Supported by enhanced training, this role requires passion for design, integrity, and commitment to excellence for measuring, designing, selling, and delivering custom solutions that add lifetime value and impact.  
  
**What We Offer**California Closets has both company-owned and franchise locations. This location is company-owned, therefore earns the following benefits:  
  

* A fun, creative, and inclusive work environment
* A generous compensation package that includes a paid training program and ability to earn uncapped commissions + bonuses
* Health, Dental and RRSP program
* 401(k) retirement plan with company match
* Cell phone and mileage reimbursement
* Company leads to help bridge the gap after completion of training
* Ongoing training on products, CRM, and proprietary CAD software
* An excellent environment in a refreshingly open culture alongside individuals who love to exceed expectations

Franchises are independently owned and operated and may offer different benefits.  
  
The address listed for this position is part of the region the Sales and Design Consultant would oversee and does not reflect a specific location the Designer reports to. **We are seeking designers in the GTA East End (Whitby & Scarborough area).****Duties And Responsibilities**

* Design personalized storage solutions for customers utilizing our proprietary CAD software program.
* Utilize a consultative sales approach to meet monthly sales goals.
* Commute to customers’ homes for a needs analysis and to design a storage unit.
* Participate in meetings and training sessions.
* Continuous follow-up with the customers and collaboration with the installation team to ensure job completion.
* Pursue referrals and repeat business. Meet goals for self-generating leads.
* Meet or exceed monthly and annual sales related goals and targets.
* This is a full-time (40 hours/week) opportunity
* Collaborate with team to deliver an exceptional brand experience

**Qualifications**

* Interior design education, direct industry experience, and/or in-home sales experience is preferred.
* Advanced knowledge of Microsoft 365 and experience working with laptops, tablets, and other electronic devices is required.
* Previous experience with Salesforce, CAD, or design software is preferred
* The ability to be creative, yet meticulously detail-oriented with a sense of craftsmanship.
* Valid driver’s license and reliable transportation is required.

**Additional Information**Find us on Facebook, YouTube, and Instagram  
  
*We are an equal opportunity employer. We E-Verify.*All your information will be kept confidential according to EEO guidelines.  
  
#ON112

jobs.description:
**Company Description**Founded in 1978, California Closets has built a reputation as the leader and design authority in premium space management, delivering custom-designed organizational solutions and exceptional service. We believe home is more than just a place — it should be a source of creativity, comfort, and connection. From beautiful walk-in closets and entertainment centers to versatile pantries and home offices, we design custom storage solutions that add value to your life and home by making space for what belongs. Think of it as ‘practical magic.’  
  
**Job Description**We’re looking for a motivated go-getter who wants to make a real difference in sales and marketing. In this role, you’ll team up with our Sales Manager and General Manager to drive leads, grow opportunities, and keep things moving in the Atlanta market. You’ll be hands-on with marketing campaigns, events, and the behind-the-scenes coordination that makes our sales team shine. You’ll also get the chance to work on a variety of projects that will help you build new skills and sharpen your toolkit. Every day will look a little different, so if you’re eager to learn, ready to jump in, and excited to grow your career, we want to hear from you!  
  
**What We Offer**California Closets has both company-owned and franchise locations. This location is company-owned, therefore earns the following benefits:  
  

* Health insurance – Medical, Dental, and Vision
* PTO days and paid holidays
* 401K retirement plan with company match
* 40 hours/week with overtime potential
* Grow your career with us – many promotional opportunities are available

Franchises are independently owned and operated and may offer different benefits.  
  
**Essential Functions**

* When in a showroom, serves as first contact to greet all clients who visit our showroom, including assisting the clients with signing our guestbook and offering refreshments as necessary.
* Responsible for lead management in an efficient and detailed manner for our Design Consultants, using CRM.
* Responsible for answering incoming phone calls & emails to either the local scheduling office or local showrooms and address client needs.
* Updating the local marketing including showroom hours on the website, social media, Yelp and Google reviews.
* Updating and maintaining Design Consultant bios on the website.
* Running and distributing weekly reports for rescheduled consults, open status jobs, and “pending” client lists.
* Collaborating with Design Consultants to follow up on the “pending” client lists.
* Sending out “client anniversary” marketing campaigns.
* Will assign Trade Partners for the Trade program.
* Managing “Digideck / Hepburn” activities including local photos and keeping the “offer list current based on market.
* Responsible for sales administrative duties including, online social media support, warranty, trade packages, additional sales support (add-ons), and other clerical responsibilities.
* When in the showroom, maintains the showroom at the direction of their leader in accordance with the maintenance and cleanliness checklist. This includes opening and closing of the Showroom duties.
* Tracking and maintaining client traffic reports and distributing to leaders.
* Maintains an adequate supply of the Design Consultant and Showroom samples in the showroom at all times.
* Assists the Sales Manager with the ongoing education and training of the Design Consultants with Central Scheduling, as needed.
* Responsible for assisting General Manager and Sales Manager with any administrative needs that may arise.
* \*Some locations may include CAD Design Support as part of this role including:

+ Review and mentor Design Consultants in CAD and Design process, providing guidance
+ Train new Design Consultants Advanced CAD Design with the assistance of the Sales Manager
+ Weekly office hours and individual meetings with Design Consultants
+ Heavy focus with Design Consultants who’s defect rate is higher than 30%.
+ Support team and sales manager with product training as needed, may included CAD/Design presentation in monthly Sales Meetings.

Qualifications  
  
**Competencies:**

* Decisions will affect others within the functional area.
* Understanding a range of routine work procedures and their impacts on internal and external work areas, requiring a longer period of job training.
* Internal Communication that includes CCO team and/or corporate.
* Requires the ability to elaborate on routine information and ensure understanding.
* Problems encountered are routine, somewhat repetitive, and generally solved by following clear directions and procedures.
* Work is guided by specific procedures and well-defined instructions. The team member would normally not deviate without seeking advice or guidance.

**SKILLS & ABILITIES:**

* High school diploma and/or GED
* Associates Degree related to business & or sales administration from an accredited college or university preferred
* 1-2 years of experience of administrative and/or customer service experience in construction and/or in the home renovations/improvement industry – preferably within a luxury brand environment
* Advanced knowledge with internal CC CAD system.
* Strong communication, interpersonal and presentation skills
* Ability to communicate politely, clearly and professionally with clients
* Ability to work quickly and accurately data entry
* Calendar management / regional scheduling experience preferred
* Must be able to adapt to a fast-paced, changing environment and exercise independent though to challenges and improve the status quo.
* Self-starter with a positive attitude, ability to manage own schedule and comfortable working in a fast-paced environment
* Detail oriented, organized and time management skills
* Ability to provide an exceptional client experience aligned to the company values
* Must possess strong critical thinking, problem solving, time management, and organizational skills with the ability to work under pressure
* Strong multi-tasking, time management, and prioritization capabilities
* Must possess an unwavering commitment to foster a safe and event-free work environment
* Tech savvy with the ability to quickly learn and apply various business systems (CAD, Epicor, Salesforce, Microsoft Office, etc)

**Certificates & Licenses:**Successfully complete a Background check  
  
**PHYSICAL DEMANDS**

* Ability to stand on feet for minimum 4–6-hour shift.
* Minimal sitting in front of a computer for periods of time
* Ability to operate office equipment using hands and fingers, handle or feel, and reach with hands and arms
* Minimal bending, squatting, kneeling, stretching, twisting, reaching, and climbing
* Ability to frequently talk and hear
* Ability to reach with hand and arms and grasp objects
* Flexible work schedule: ability to work evenings and weekends

**WORK ENVIRONMENT**Company office and/or showroom location  
  
Additional Information  
  
Find us on Facebook, YouTube, and Instagram  
  
*We are an equal opportunity employer. We E-Verify.*All your information will be kept confidential according to EEO guidelines.  
  
#GA148

jobs.description:
**Company Description**Founded in 1978, California Closets has built a reputation as the leader and design authority in premium space management, delivering custom-designed organizational solutions and exceptional service. We believe home is more than just a place — it should be a source of creativity, comfort, and connection. From beautiful walk-in closets and entertainment centers to versatile pantries and home offices, we design custom storage solutions that add value to your life and home by making space for what belongs. Think of it as ‘practical magic.’  
  
**Job Description**The Sales Manager ensures that company sales goals are met or exceeded including achieving all key business metrics while following the California Closets policies and procedures. This role ensures that the Design Consultants are delivering on the California Closets standards of excellence with each and every customer. The Sales Manager also collaborates with the GM and Operations Team to make sure that the process flow is being followed and results in delivering a high standard of customer service at all touchpoints.  
  
**What We Offer:**California Closets has both company-owned and franchise locations. This location is a company-owned, therefore earns the following benefits:  
  

* Health insurance – Medical, Dental, and Vision
* PTO days and paid holidays
* 401K retirement plan with company match

Franchises are independently owned and operated and may offer different benefits.  
  
**Duties and Responsibilities:**

* Collaborate with GM to hire and retain top talent based on the budgeted number of Design Consultants.
* Manage a team of Design Consultants ensuring all company revenue goals and key performance indicators are met or exceeded. Ensure the Design Team has the appropriate mix of company leads and personal marketing plan leads.
* Performance management of underperformers while following guidelines to improve results including detailed documentation.
* Collaborate with head office operations team on process flow and identify opportunities for improvement.
* Conduct monthly goal setting and reviews with all team members.
* Work closely with the GM on a variety of initiatives including the creation of sales contests and incentive programs, a sustainable charitable strategy, and develop a sustainable trade business strategy.
* Schedule and facilitate monthly Sales Meetings including coordination with guest speakers and head office personnel.
* Analyze sales data and develop a strategy with GM to address areas of opportunity.
* Ensure correct usage of CRM (dashboard) including quality of data entry, statuses, etc.
* Review feedback through 5 Star and follow up on all negative responses with the customer and or Design Consultant, communicate findings to GM.

Qualifications  
  

* 3 -5 years as a Sales Consultant or in a sales management role preferred.
* Industry experience is a plus.
* Proven sales coach and mentor.
* Strong conflict resolution skills.
* Exceptional written and verbal communication skills.
* Familiarity with data analysis and reporting.
* Exceptional customer experience skills.
* Experience with design fundamentals preferred.
* Experience with CAD is a plus.

Additional Information  
  
Find us on Facebook, YouTube, and Instagram  
  
*We are an equal opportunity employer. We E-Verify.*All your information will be kept confidential according to EEO guidelines.  
  
#NJ071

jobs.description: Job DescriptionWe’re seeking a Senior Salesforce Marketing Cloud Specialist who is a data-driven decision maker and marketing enthusiast to help drive our email marketing program. The ideal candidate has a strong track record of leveraging Salesforce Marketing Cloud to deploy technically-advanced email campaigns that enhance customer engagement and drive business results. With a passion to dive deep, this candidate has a strong technical background and project management skills with attention to detail, and a track record of transforming email marketing performance data into digestible, actionable insights. You’ll work cross-functionally with marketing, analytics, and CRM teams to create advanced customer journeys, automated workflows, dynamic content, and system integrations. The ideal candidate is an expert in Salesforce Marketing Cloud tools, scripting languages, and marketing automation best practices.We foster a values-based, collaborative environment and are seeking candidates who know how to drive growth while building deep partnerships. As a key driver of California Closets’ growth, this role works in partnership with cross-functional teams, and drives the results for a high-impact, high-visibility marketing channel, offering significant opportunities to make a meaningful impact on meeting our business objectives. all email assets (email lists, subject lines, content blocks, links, dynamic fields, and imaging) across multiple devices and email clients before launch to ensure successful executionREPORTINGStrong jobs.description: Company DescriptionLife at California Closets:Are you craving something more out of your work life? More inspiration, a better culture, the chance to make an impact, the opportunity to learn and grow? Maybe you have a job,but you’re looking for a career.At California Closets, we’re designing a better work life for all of our employees by investing in skills, encouraging growth, and celebrating excellence.We want to be the best employer and the longest career for anyone who has theenergy, drive, anddesireto serve.Our commission-based compensation structure allows our Sales and Design Consultants to reap the benefits of a job well done. If you’re a sales-driven, networking champion with a flair for creativity, apply to be a California Closets Design Consultant today.Job DescriptionJob SummaryOur Sales and Design Consultants are the keepers of our most important relationships and joy-makers who believe there is real purpose in helping others design better lives, where they are free to focus on what matters most.In this role, you’ll work directly with our clients to create closets and storage solutions customized to their needs during in-home consultations and in our design showrooms. This is sales position that sells the designs you create.We will get you started with the design training and tools you need for success. From there, your opportunity for growth is virtually unlimited: It all comes down to you, with our full support along the way.What will make you successful in this role is your desire to learn and grow, your passion for making a difference, and your ability to listen to customers’ ideas and transform an everyday space into one that truly improves their lives.Here, you’ll find flexibility with the support system of an industry-leading company. The ability to wear different hats — and to thrive while doing so — is a plus.If you are self-motivated, hardworking, want to be part of a family culture, love forging relationships with customers, are energized by creating tranquility and order, and committed to unrivaled customer service and delivering excellence, then there is a home for you here.What We OfferPaid trainingSalary plus commission pay based on sales performanceNo commission maxProfessional development opportunitiesPaid time offMedical, dental, vision, and other insurance benefits available401KWhat Will You Do?Manage all facets of the sales cycle, from initial inquiry through final installationDesign solutions that inspire and meet client needs using proprietary CAD software to complete design specificationsDevelop ongoing client relationshipsMaintain an ongoing consultation schedule through company and independently generated leadsStay updated and understand industry trends that include organization, fashion, and interior designBuild relationships with clients and potential clients through networkingWork Design Showroom shifts as scheduled by managementQualificationsWhat You NeedPrior sales experiencePassion for organization, design, and helping peopleStrong communication and listening skillsA desire to learn, grow, and build relationships with customersAbility to work with computer software and to learn CAD programsValid Driver’s LicenseHigh school diploma or equivalentLearn more about the California Closets Michigan team here.Hear directly from some of our Sales and Design Consultants on finding their dream career here.Check us out on InstagramAdditional InformationAll your information will be kept confidential according to EEO guidelines.Privacy Policy: https://www.californiaclosets.com/privacy-policy/Terms and Conditions: https://www.californiaclosets.com/terms-conditions/

jobs.description: Company DescriptionFounded in 1978, California Closets has built a reputation as the leader and design authority in premium space management, delivering custom-designed organizational solutions and exceptional service. website.Running and distributing weekly reports for rescheduled consults, open status jobs, and “pending” client lists.Collaborating with Design Consultants to follow up on the “pending” client lists.Sending out “client anniversary” marketing campaigns.Managing the Digital Showroom activities including local photos and keeping the “offer list current based on market.Responsible for sales jobs.description: CB2 is transforming the perception of home design for today's modern consumer. Born out of Crate and Barrel, CB2 is committed to high-quality, sophisticated design at an approachable price. Located in downtown Chicago, CB2 offers an engaging, collaborative work environment. If you're creative, team spirited and have a passion for modern design, then join the team as a Director, Digital and Paid Marketing.The Director, Digital and Paid Marketing will oversee all aspects of paid marketing initiatives from vision, planning, budget management, customer insights, analytics, execution and decision making across programs across CB2. They will lead a dedicated team across paid search, social, and display, and is the primary decision maker with the external digital marketing agency.This is a 4 day hybrid position based out of our CB2 Headquarters in Chicago, Illinois.A day in the life as a Director, Digital and Paid Marketing…Own the strategy for growing all paid and digital marketing efforts, working in close partnership with the Ecommerce, Brand Marketing, Creative, and other cross-functional teamsEnsure cross functional alignment to paid marketing strategy for building immediate and long term visionAccountable for conceiving and executing customer-centric strategies that support key brand objectives: acquisition, retention, key program support (Design Services, New Movers, Registry, Trade, B2B)Accountable for ensuring all budgets are strategically aligned to business goals including ecom sales, traffic, and conversion goals in partnership with the ecom teamResponsible for driving and communicating hind-sight performance and optimizationsAccountable for developing and maximizing marketing budget in partnership with the external agency to drive business objectivesResponsible for ensuring CB2 Marketing has strong relationships with key platform and vendor partners (Google, Meta, Pinterest, TikTok, etc) and is staying abreast of new ideas and developing tactics and technologyPartner with Analytics, Ecom, and Agency partners to develop “source of truth” reporting that triangulates marketing platform reporting and ecom reporting to ensure strategy and performance alignmentPartner with the Marketing/Planning/Merchandising/Ecom leadership to develop customer-centric promotional and advertising strategies that deliver on financial goals and the editorial calendarTeam leadership excellence. Be able to develop a strong performance minded team, and communicate strategy cross-functionally to business partnersWhat you’ll bring to the table…A Digital thought leader with a passion for connecting media to business performanceAn analytical leader with a passion for digital innovation Results Oriented while maintaining a balance between brand building and performanceA strong passion for retail with entrepreneurial energy, an innovative spirit, and insatiable curiosityPassion for understanding the customer and influencing their journeyAbility to think strategically & tactically to ensure ideas turn to actionAbility to dive into technical details, understand nuances and work with technology leaders on complex initiativesAbility to simplify and structure complex and ambiguous problemsConceptualize and provide thought leadership and strategic direction to product & data roadmapsAbility to handle diverse and conflicting opinions to arrive at the best decisions and outcomesExcellent presentation and written communication skills; experience presenting to and engaging with senior and executive level audiencesCollaborate and work effectively across functions. Influence and achieve consensus on goals and objectivesAbility to present complicated material in a concise and effective wayWe’d love to hear from you if you have…Bachelor's degree in Marketing or equivalent field10+ years of Digital Marketing experience with best in class organizations in consumer-focused industries (specialty-retail preferred), including strategic planning, implementation & executionDemonstrated experience in stewarding media investment and driving for a brand in the retail or DTC spaceStrong business management experience including full responsibility and accountability for managing a substantial budgetProven ability to leverage data to drive measurable results and track accountabilities to ensure desired outcomes and ROIMust be knowledgeable, savvy and strategic as to the effective deployment of all forms of media with significant experience leveraging analyticsDemonstrated knowledge of digital marketing methods, and a track record of testing and learning in this spaceExperience with Media Mix Modeling, brand health tracking, lift studies, and other pertinent methodologies for measuring and tracking impact of media

conversion_revenue.evidence: driving initiatives that enhance the overall customer experience and create a seamless and engaging omnichannel journey.

key_decision_makers.role: Senior Vice President (SVP) of Retail Technology

collaborators.evidence: Partner with key stakeholders, including product management, UX design, and customer operations.

ecommerce_platforms.evidence: oversee the engineering and delivery of AshleyFurniture.com and the consumer-facing mobile application.

analysis.sales_recommendation: Il est recommandé d'approcher Ashley Furniture en mettant l'accent sur la capacité de presti.ai à générer des images de haute qualité à grande échelle, ce qui peut améliorer l'expérience client sur leurs plateformes numériques. En soulignant la rapidité de production et la réduction des coûts, vous pouvez démontrer comment presti.ai peut soutenir leur stratégie omnicanale.

jobs.description: Position SummaryThe E-Commerce/Admin Customer Service Rep will work closely with our e-commerce accounts, processing accounts, and working closely with our E-Commerce Manager to ensure all customer needs are met accurately and timely.Position DetailsPull orders from dealer portalsSend/receive shipping info for dealer orders sent via emailCheck dealer portals for questions/tasksMonitor/update ship dates in dealer portalsReceive/respond to order-specific questions/claims/returnsPosition RequirementsHigh school diploma preferredMinimum of 2 years customer service experience requiredPrevious E-Commerce experience strongly preferredPrevious furniture experience strongly preferredPhysical RequirementsThe physical demands and work environment expectations described below represent those that must be met by an employee to perform the essential functions of this job successfully. Reasonable accommodations may be made to enable individuals with disabilities to perform essential functions.Prolonged periods of sitting and performing repetitive tasks, including but not limited to computer and telephone usageMust be able to work in noisy environmentsFrequently lifting/carrying objects up to 10 lbs.; on occasion up to 25 lbs.

analysis.sales_recommendation: Il est recommandé de cibler les entreprises de décoration intérieure et de mobilier qui cherchent à améliorer leur expérience e-commerce. Mettre en avant la capacité de presti.ai à générer des images de haute qualité et à optimiser les processus de merchandising pourrait répondre à leurs besoins en matière de conversion et de cohérence de marque.
